loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Cliente de 27 ans, mariee et mere de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9 mois et 9 ans; elle se lance dans la vente des grillades en 2007.Pour commencer elle avait juste acheter un barbecue local  faite avec une moitie de tonneau et un grillage, un carton de cuisse de poulet,  et tous les soirs les gens viennent manger car elle a une grande  clientele et  son petit coin est tres celebre.
Ses ventes sont de 30.000 frs a 70.000 frs par jour.
Avec ce nouveau pret elle va acheter 2 cartons de cuisse de poulets, 2 cartons d'ailes de dindes, 2 cartons de cotes de porcs.
Elle pour ambition de faire beaucoup d'epargnes , acheter des chaises en plastiques, des couverts, parcequ'elle  veut ouvrir un restaurant pour satisfaire les desirs de ses clients..
texts.en:
A 27-year old client, married and the mother of two children, nine months and nine years of age. She launched a business selling grilled meats. To start, she simply bought a locally made half-barrel barbeque, a grill, and a box of chicken legs, and people started coming every evening to get their food. And so she has a big customer base and her stand is very well known. Her sales range from 30,000 to 70,000 francs per day.

Wit this new loan, she will buy two boxes of chicken legs, two boxes of turkey wings, two boxes of pork chops. Her goal is to keep saving and to buy plastic chairs and utensils, because she would like to open a restaurant that would meet her clients’ wishes.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken legs and wings, meats and pork chops

loans.name: Santa Cipriana

texts.es: La señora Cipriana tiene de 2 hijos ya ambos mayores de edad, su hijo menor tiene 24 años, ella vivió 11 años con el papá de ellos de profesión Fotógrafo y ahí fue donde a ella le nació el gusto por la fotografía durante ese tiempo acompañaba al que era su esposo a realizar los trabajos de fotografía que el tenia  y  le ayudaba en organizar el material de trabajo pero siempre con la ilusión de que algún día ella podría hacerse cargo de un evento, sus primeras fotografías profesionales fueron en una graduación de uno de sus hijos de esto ya hace 8 años y desde entonces la fotografía a ha sido la fuente de ingresos de ella.  Cipriana tiene un evento próximo de 15 años por tal motivo quiere estar preparada con el material de trabajo para poder cumplir su compromiso.
texts.en: Mrs. Cipriana has 2 grown children, her youngest is 24 years old.  She lived with their father, a photographer, for 11 years, this is where her liking of photography was born.  During this time she would accompany her then husband to his photo jobs. She would help him organize his work materials with the desire to someday being the one in charge of an event.  Her first professional photographs were at the graduation of one of her sons, which was 8 years  ago.  Since then, photography has been a source of income for her.  Cipriana has a 15th birthday event coming up and wants to be ready with all the material needed to be able to fulfill the engagement.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 43 years old. He is married with five children between 3 and 16 years old. He sells various goods such as rice, sugar, soap, lotions etc and he has five years of experience in this business. He works from 6 am until 8 pm every day except on Sunday.

Bosco has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as rice, sugar, soap, lotions etc to sell. Once his business is expanded, he hopes to reinvest in this business and to save in the future. He will also be able to pay school fees for his children and to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as rice, sugar, soap, lotions etc to sell

loans.name: Estelvinai Irene

texts.es:
Doña Estelvina es una mujer trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosmeticos, zapatos y tambien en tiempos libres trabaja en la costura, vende en su casa y ambulante, pues ha logrado aumentar las ventas al introducir mas productos con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en once ciclos, el cual ha logrado equilibrar y mantener sus ventas.
Es madre de tres hijos mayores, trabajan y aportan  a los gastos, su esposo labora como albañil siendo de gran apoyo para su familia. Tiene poco productos, es por eso con este nuevo prestamo comprara: ropa para dama, zapatos, cosmeticos Avon y quiere invertir en joyas de plata para seguir creciendo en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Estelvina is a hard-working woman whose business is selling clothes, cosmetics and shoes.  In her free time, she also sews.  She makes her sales from home and also as an itinerant vendor.  She has managed to increase her sales by introducing more products through loans that she has received over eleven loan cycles with Afodenic.  This has enabled her to balance and maintain her sales.

Estelvina has three grown-up children who are working and contributing towards household expenses.  Her husband works as a builder and is a great support for their family.  Estelvina has few products and so will use this new loan to buy: women's clothes, shoes and Avon cosmetics.  She would also like to invest in silver jewelry in order to continue growing her small business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes, shoes, cosmetics and silver jewelry to increase her sales

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años.
Gloria tiene una plastiquería, y tenía el negocio de venta de ropas, empezó con poco capital, pero ahora esta muy bien en su plastiquería, empezó en lima pero a causa de un problema tuvieron que venir a Ayacucho, y una tía la invitó a ser socia del Banco Comunal y desde la fecha no se retira, con las capacitaciones  aprendió a como hacer que su negocio pueda crecer. Esta muy feliz, y con el préstamo que esta sacando viajará a Lima para poder traer descartables como platos y vasos que es lo que mas vende, su meta es poder fabricar ella misma bolsas, y esta ahorrando para ello.
texts.en: Gloria is a member of the communal bank Tarpuy.  She is 42, has two children and has been a member of Finca Perú for three years.  Gloria has a plastic merchandise store and also sells clothing.  She began with a small amount of capital but is now doing very well in her plastics business which she set up in Lima, but had to transfer to Ayacucho because of problems.  An aunt invited her to become a member of the communal bank and she has continued since then.  Through the training courses she has learned how to grow the business.  She is very pleased and plans to use the loan to travel to Lima to bring back disposables such as plates and cups which is what she sells the most.  Her goal is to start making bags and she is saving towards that end.

loans.use: To buy plates and cups.

loans.name: Josefa Maritza

texts.es: Doña Josefa Maritza es una mujer trabajadora y constante, ella es casada pero ya no tiene hijos que dependen de ella. Ella tiene su actividad que es la venta de carne desde hace más 22 años, ella está pidiendo un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su actividad y comprar carne molida, hueso, carne de cerdo. Ella está muy contenta porque quiere salir adelante con su negocio, el sueño que tiene es comprar material para construcción realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Josefa Maritza is a hardworking and persevering woman. She is married, but does not have children who are dependent on her. Josefa has been selling meat for more than 22 years.

She is requesting a loan so that she can continue investing in her business. Josefa will buy ground beef, bones, and pork. She is very pleased because she wants to move forward with her business. Her dream is to buy construction materials so that she can make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy ground beef, bones, and pork.

loans.name: Djissoff Litt Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de treize femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Adama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 68 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 28, 2001. It is made up of 13 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is commerce. 

Madame Adama who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 68 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She is also raising two other children confided to her by her relatives. 

She sells vegetables. She has a good deal of experience in this business since she has been in it for several years. This loan will permit her to grow her working capital and better develop her activity. 

The profit will permit her to improve living conditions for her family (health, food, clothing, etc.) and add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Rashidan's Group

texts.en:
Rashidan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son who will buy a large number of bedsheets to sell to his customers. 

He has many business contacts and supplies bedsheets to different shops in the market.

She is very confident that her son will make good use of loan and increase his sales and profits.  He has been in business for many years.

Rashidan is a housewife, stays at home and does her household duties.  She is a very responsible person and does her responsibilities very well.

She is the mother of four children.   Three of them remain at home.

Note:  In the photo, the lady holding a book (Asasah Passbook) is Rashidan”.

loans.use: to sell bedsheets.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison has been in the property business in Naivasha town for the last five years.  He is 34 years old, married to Purity, and they have one school-going child.  Besides the rental houses business as his primary activity, Harrison also practices dairy farming.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy dairy cows for raising and to sell the milk produced.

In future, Harrison hopes to have a big ranch and produce milk for distribution to dairy companies in Naivasha and Nairobi and become one of the leading dairy farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy dairy cow.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mr. Neang, 33, is a humble farmer who has been residing in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. He has a life partner in his wife who is in the same business: cultivating rice crops. This couple is blessed with 3 single, dependent children. Mr. Neang is a diligent father. He also sometimes works as a construction worker with his building team, earning approximately $2.00 per day. Mr. Neang has requested this loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle for use in his family. This loan will improve his living conditions. In the future, he wants to see his children get a good education. That is why he has to try hard to save some money for their education.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: K Ndege A Group

texts.en:
Edward is the facilitator of the K Ndege A group. Edward and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edward takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Edward had a good maize yield harvesting five bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edward was only able to harvest 3½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edward and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Edward will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of K Ndege A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Edward is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Eunice Esther

texts.es: Eunice pagó el primer semestre de su hijo en la universidad con su credikiva, con ello inicia el cumplimiento del sueño que es estudiar mecánica de aviación. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual pagará un nuevo semestre, pues su hijo le fue muy bien y se propone hacer su segundo semestre. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Que Dios los ilumine y que sigan apoyando a los pequeños empresarios”
texts.en: Eunice paid for her son's first semester at the university with her Kiva loan. With it he began the fulfillment of his dream, which is to study aviation mechanics. She is now applying for a new Kiva loan, with which she will pay for a new semester, since her son is doing very well and is determined to do his second semester. Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following "May God shine his light on you and may you continue supporting the little entrepreneurs."

loans.use: to pay for a second semester at the university.

loans.name: Chik

texts.en:
As shown in the photo, Mrs. Chik is standing in her cabbage field, located in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She has been in this business since 2000. She is able to yield an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband is the one who always helps and works alongside her in the field. Chik has been blessed with six children, two of whom are working to help support their living standard: Her first child is a civil servant who works for the government and her second child is a driver for a tour company. 

At this time, Chik has applied for a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorcycle for the two children to improve the way they commute to their workplaces and to avoid taking a motor-taxi service any longer. This loan will improve a part of her living condition. She hopes that our lenders won’t reject her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children.

loans.name: Nancy Vicenta

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en la parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos uno ya es mayor de edad y sus hijos menores estudian en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo,  él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, recorre con sus productos en un triciclo por las calles de la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 3h00 hasta las 16h00, los productos los compra en el mercado en Portoviejo y luego se desplaza hasta esta linda ciudad a realizar sus ventas.  Realiza esta actividad desde que tenía 12 años y es así como se gana el sustento diario de toda la familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para el negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda el Banco.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres en su casa.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora community bank meet in Sequita parish, in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí which is full of hard-working people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and devote themselves to their families.

This is where Nancy lives.  She is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  One of her children is grown up and her younger children are in school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Nancy is a great homemaker who is taking out this loan for her husband's business.  Her husband sells fruit and vegetables.  He travels the city streets on a three-wheeled vehicle, selling his products.  He works from Monday to Friday, from 3.00am to 4.00pm.  He buys his products in a market in Portoviejo and then travels to this beautiful city to make his sales.  He has been in this business for 12 years and it is how he earns a living and provides for his whole family.

This loan will be used to buy fruit and vegetables for the business.  Nancy is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it for the benefits it provides.

Nancy's dream is to have a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has been farming for 15 years and currently operates with the help of two farmhands. Her farm produce of potatoes, milk, maize, beans and vegetables is sold in the local market. She is the married mother of three children between 15 and 9 years of age, all in school.

Perturbed by rampant poultry diseases, Violet has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to improve her poultry farming through the purchase of more birds. She adds that she will use the additional income to pay for the education of her children.

Violet aspires to improve both her farming and the state of her low-cost rental houses for better financial security.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Anthony's Group

texts.en:
Anthony’s group has six group leader farmers and is located in Chwele District.  The group leaders in this group represent a total of 72 individual farmers (not pictured), who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Anthony is pictured on the right of the group with his hand raised.							

Anthony is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 4 children.  Anthony is 30 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 15 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Anthony is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, and savings group, and prayer group, and burial committee.  He described his harvest last year as excellent.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Anthony first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Anthony joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed family, and send children to school.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Anthony plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to repair the home, and send children to school, and save for the future, and buy a cow, and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Anthony’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, and has more farm training, and has more farm group support, and was able to save money, and was able to feed the family.  							

Anthony and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, de 51 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene mucha experiencia en los negocios gastronómicos; actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos, uno de 23 años de edad que es empleado y una niña de 15 años de edad que estudia primaria.

Catalina, tiene 16 años de experiencia en el área gastronómica, ella vende todo tipo de tortas con diferentes ingredientes, es muy reconocida por la calidad de sus tortas y es por eso que la prefieren sus clientes.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos alimenticios y para remodelar un poco más el local donde vende, todo para que su negocio sea más atractivo a la vista de los clientes. 

Catalina, desea en un futuro tener un negocio más grande y un local propio, porque la renta de los locales es muy cara.
texts.en:
Catalina is 51 years old and a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She has a lot of experience in the food business. Currently, she lives with her two children, one of whom is 23 years old and works as an employee, and the other is a 15-year-old girl who is studying in primary school.

Catalina has 16 years of experience in the food industry. She sells all types of cakes with different ingredients and is well known for the quality of her cakes. Thanks to this, her customers prefer her.

She needs the loan to purchase food supplies and to remodel a bit more the location where she sells her products, so that her business is more attractive in the eyes of her customers. In the future, Catalina hopes to have a bigger business and own her own location, because the rent for her current location is very expensive.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies and remodel her business a bit more.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentin con 41 años, de estado civil separado,vive en casa propia de material rústico,vive junto a su menor hijo, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitante de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Valentin es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,a trabajado con dos créditos, campaña pasada se le otorgó S/ 1500 del cuál lo realizó con pagos puntuales.

loans.use: lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en: Loyce is a hard workingwoman who has been working with Mercury Women Group since 2004. Joining this group helped her greatly because she learnt the use of savings and starting an income-generating project. Through her small savings, she bought a dairy cow at the beginning of this year in February. She gets 15 litres of milk every day and changing the type of feeds can increase milk. She hopes to increase milk production to at least 20 litres of milk; this will give her $5 per day. She will go an extra mile in improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To increase milk production, she wants to  buy improved dairy feeds.

loans.name: Tahirov

texts.en: Tahirov O. is a butcher in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Tahirov is married with 2 children. His wife works as a house wife raising the children. Finding employment is Azerbaijan, where the unemployment rate is very high, is currently very difficult. Tahirov is a small business owner who needs access to capital in order to invest in his business so that his business can continue to grow and prosper.

loans.use: General investment in business (Animals, tools, etc...)

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.en:
Mrs. M. has a grocery store in one of the most populous parts of the city. On weekends, many people come to the local craft fair and the population increases threefold. "Every weekend it's the same," she says. "So many people come to buy that I sell out. I just don't have enough to sell and that's why I want this loan for $1000."

Translated from Spanish by Alexis Hult, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. M. tiene una tienda de abarrotes en una de las colonias mas pobladas de la ciudad los fines de semana es tradición acudir a los tianguis que hay en ese sector y la población se triplica. "Cada fin de semana siempre es lo mismo se me termina la mercancía, es mucha la gente que viene y no les doy abasto, por eso quiero que me ayuden con $1,000.00 dlls".

loans.use: To buy goceries for resale.

loans.name: Maa Musu

texts.en: Maa Musu is 36 years of age with seven children.  With all the children in school, Musu and her husband are unable to generate enough income from subsistence farming.  Musu decided to engage in the business of selling firewood to the city wholesalers who come to the village to purchase the items.  In addition, Maa Musu also sells saucepans by hawking them from door-to-door.  The businesses have enabled Maa Musu to meet her children’s education expenses.  Musu would like the loan funds to expand her business of selling sauce pans.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of saucepans for door-to-door hawking

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam Asipiazu works selling articles of clothing, sportswear, sweaters, and jackets. She buys merchandise locally and distributes it to her customers. At the same time, she is a beauty consultant for stores that deal in cosmetics.

Three years ago she started with this business, which is generating income for her, but not enough to support her three children. At present she lives in the Tembladerani neighborhood of the city of La Paz, living in just two rooms with her children.

Miriam needs capital in order to continue with her business, primarily to pay for her merchandise up-front, since buying on credit ends up costing more and reduces earnings, and for that reason she can't generate enough to support her household.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Se dedica al negocio de la venta de prendas de vestir, deportivos, chompas, chamarras, compra mercadería local y la distribuye entre su clientela. Paralelamente a esta actividad, es consultora de belleza de empresas que se dedican al rubro de la cosmética.

Hace tres años que se dedica a esta actividad, la que le esta generando ingresos, pero no los suficientes como para subsistir con sus tres hijos.

Actualmente vive en la zona de Tembladerani, en la ciudad de La Paz, ocupando solo dos piezas, con sus hijos.

Miriam A., precisa de capital para poder seguir con su negocio, pero principalmente para poder adquirir su mercadería al contado, puesto que al crédito le resulta más costoso, le reduce las ganancias, y por tanto no genera lo necesario para poder llevar el sustento a su casa.

loans.use: Miriam needs capital in order to continue with her business, primarily to pay for her merchandise up-front, since buying on credit ends up costing more and reduces earnings, and for that reason she can't generate enough to support her household.

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.es:
Maria is 36 years old. She is a woman that with all her effort and optimism in her daily agricultural tasks has been able to look after the needs of her young kid aged 10. Her husband abandoned them and took with him their second boy aged 7.

Since this shameful incident happened she has been farming with diligence her small piece of land. She puts in all the love and care she cannot offer to the son that was taken away from her. In spite of being overloaded with melancholy for not having him in her arms, she knows that she still have hopes to find him and that she now has to look after the well being of the child that accompanies her. This makes her forget the immense pain for a few moments.

The desire to find him promptly and shelter him in her home has pushed her to keep working and make an effort in each of her tasks with the objective of making enough profits to pay for all of the family needs and save enough to undertake the search and recovery of her son who she dearly needs.

This is the reason why she speaks to your heart and requests a loan for 350 USDs with which she will increase the harvest of her agricultural products.

Let us allow this diligent and loving mother be able to reunite briefly with her young boy who she loves and misses dearly.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


María tiene 36 años y es una mujer que a base de mucho esfuerzo y optimismo en sus labores agrícolas diarias ha podido velar por las necesidades de su pequeño hijo de diez años ya que su esposo la abandonó llevándose a su otro pequeño de tan solo siete añitos.Desde que ocurrió este penoso incidente ha cultivado con mucho más diligencia su pequeña parcela de tierra y le dedica todo el amor y cuidado que no puede ofrecerle al hijo que le arrebataron, a pesar de inundarle la melancolía por no tenerlo en sus brazos sabe que aún tiene esperanzas de encontrarlo y ahora tiene que velar por el bienestar del niño que lo acompaña y hace que por instantes olvide su inmenso dolor. El anhelo de ubicarlo pronto para cobijarlo en su hogar la impulsa a seguir trabajando y esforzándose en cada de sus ocupaciones con el objetivo de generar buenas ganancias para solventar las necesidades de su familia y ahorrar para emprender la búsqueda y recuperación del niño que tanta falta le hace.Es por ello que apela a vuestro corazón y solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares con el cuál incrementará la siembra de sus productos agrícolas. Hagamos que esta diligente y noble madre pueda reunirse en corto tiempo con su pequeño niño a quién ama y extraña mucho.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds to increase production

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.en: Sharafniso is one of the active clients of Microinvest. She has high education as a teacher of  physicist and mathematics and has experience working at a school for over 10 years. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a worker in a factory, but his salary and her teacher's salary were not enough for the family needs and she decided to sell children's clothes at the market after her teaching work. Gradually she increased her working capital and teaching school was not essential and she devoted herself to her business completely. Today she skillfully sells her goods and her experience working at school helps her in personal contact with her clients. She services them with great attention and they become her constant clients. Currently she wants to get a loan for increasing her volume of goods, as she needs money for pay of her son's education.

loans.use: Increasing the volume of goods.

loans.name: Sayaad Haroon

texts.en: Sayaad Haroon lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and he lives with his own family. He is the only to support for his family and he has plots of land for cultivate. He is unable to further this business so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his lease purchase to start working on his land and make a good income to help his family and make bright future for himself.

loans.use: To complete his lease purchase

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
"I am borrowing for the first time in my loan group. I am the group leader and I require this loan for my husband who needs to buy rugs and blankets in bulk. I have some savings that I will pool with the loan for this purpose. I have two kids: one boy and one girl. My son is four years old and attends kindergarten whereas my daughter is only two years old.

I would like to borrow in a group with several other women. Waziran B. needs this loan to buy her son a rickshaw. Zaiba B. will invest the loan to buy an additional motorbike. Zubaida B. needs this loan for their restaurant. Zareena B. requires this loan to buy a rickshaw. I am the guarantor of all these women and I assure you that they will repay your loan on time."

loans.use: Buy rugs and blankets in bulk

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
My name is Mumtaz S. N. from Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I own a four-room brick house herein Multan. I have four kids: three boys and one girl. All of my kids are under 12 and attend a local school. My husband works in a public corporation for meager income. I am a textile designer and I create embroidered dresses.

I want to expand my business and therefore require a loan. My loan group is comprised of three other women all of whom are hardworking entrepreneurs. Sabra B. needs this loan to expand her fruit business. Nighat B. is borrowing for her husband’s paint business. Tasneem B. is borrowing for her family’s restaurant.

loans.use: Expand embroidered clothes business

loans.name: Marleny

texts.en:
Marleny is a young and budding entrepreneur. She sells pants and shoes to women of the Buenos Aires community of Santo Domino. She operates the business mostly out of her parents' house, but sometimes she visits friends to sell her goods. Marleny explains that she’s recently finished high school and in a short time she wants to study marketing at the university.

With her loan, Marleny will purchase customer-recommended products in order to augment her sales volume and her revenue. Marleny hopes that her business’ growth will help her achieve her goal of becoming a professional.

loans.use: Funds will be invested to buy clothing for her small business

location.town: Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.es:
Carmen, Anotonia and Gloria have been members of Banco Comunal Llamocctachi for 3, 4 and 4 years respectively.

Carmen is 33 years old and married with 4 children. Together with her husband she sells slippers in rented premises near the Magdalena market.

Then there is Antonia, who lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Together with her partner, she cultivates vegetables and also purchases vegetables from other producers. She sells her produce at the market in Nery García.

Gloria is 26 years old and is married with 1 child. She has a well-supplied grocery store. She also purchases piglets to sell in the city of Huanta.

Carmen, Antonia and Gloria need a loan of $575 to invest in the purchase of slippers from Iona, scales and piglets.

Carmen, Antonia and Gloria dream of a good education for their children, of having more captial, of purchasing land and of a prosperous business.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen, Antonia y Gloria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Llamocctachi hace 3, 4, 4 años respectivamente.

Carmen es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo venden zapatillas en un local alquilado cercano al mercado Magdalena.

Por otro lado Antonia es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Antonia junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras, alfalfa y también compra de otros productores, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Gloria es casada, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Gloria tiene una tienda surtida de abarrotes. Además Gloria compra tara y cochinilla que luego lo comercializa en la ciudad de Huanta.

Carmen, Antonia y Gloria necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 300 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas de lona, alfalfa, tara, cochinilla.

Los sueños de Carmen, Antonia y Gloria son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener más capital, comprar terrenos y sus negocios prosperen.

loans.use: Carmen, Antonia and Gloria need a loan of $575 to invest in the purchase of slippers from Iona, scales and piglets.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa Nyaneba is forty-five years old. She is married and has a child who has completed senior high school. Adwoa sells ground nuts, beans, yams and waakye - cooked rice and beans typically eaten as breakfast in the mornings with stew, macaroni and fish. Waakye is very tasty and filling, and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy it. Adwoa currently needs a loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, and yams to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called Nyame kye Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, and yams

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr:
Born on March 15,1962 in Cotonou and the mother of 3 children, the eldest of whom is aged 26 and in the third year of university, the second aged 21 and in the first year of university and the youngest aged 15 and in high school, Mrs. Louise E. lives in Godomey Salamè and runs a business in Cotonou. She sells menswear and womenswear. She is married to Barthélemy K. Dossou, an accountant by profession, who works at the oil factory Fludor. Mrs. E. has been running her business for 20 years and gets her supplies from Lomé (Togo). Ever-increasing demand has meant that she has had to turn to our institution over the past year in order to satisfy her very keen clientele. For her second loan, she is requesting CFA 350,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 15 mars 1962 à Cotonou et mère de 03 enfants dont le premier âgé de 26 ans et en 3è année d’Université, le second âgé de 21 ans et en classe de 1ère année d’Université et le dernier âgé de 15 ans est en 5è du cours secondaire. Dame E. Louise réside à Godomey Salamè et exerçe son commerce à COTONOU. Elle vend des vêtements pour homme et pour dame. Elle est mariée à DOSSOU K. Barthélemy comptable de profession et exerçant à la société d’huilerie FLUDOR .Dame E. Louise exerce cette activité depuis 20 ans et s’approvisionne à Lomé ( TOGO ). La demande de plus en plus forte l’a obligé à faire recours à notre institution depuis l’année passée pour satisfaire sa clientèle très active. Pour son second crédit, elle sollicite un crédit de 350 000 francs CFA.

loans.use: To buy 60 dozen t-shirts and men’s undergarments, 38 dozen t-shirts and women’s undergarments, and 18 packs of caps

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aminata Dioné is 47, has seven children, and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wife and their children in the Darsalam II area of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali).

After unsuccessfully trying several business activities, she decided, 28 years ago, to specialize in selling freshwater fish. She has been doing this using her own means, which have proved to be inadequate. While looking for financial assistance, she decided to enter the Soro Yiriwaso micro-credit program a year ago. She is on her second personal loan, and the first was repaid without difficulty.

With this loan, she plans to buy 10 large baskets of fish in the Mopti region (a region rich in fish) with the help of Bozo and Somono fishermen, and to store them in freezers at home or in an area set up for such a purpose. She sells at the Koutiala fish market, which is very popular with homemakers, restaurant owners on the square, and other passing clients.

Mrs. Aminata Dioné estimates a monthly profit of 90,000 CFA francs, with which she will contribute to her household expenses, pay the interest on the loan, and add to her operating budget. In the future she plans to increase her points of sale in the city of Koutiala.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Aminata Dioné a 47 ans, mère de 7 enfants et vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Darsalam II de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso République du Mali).

Après plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus entreprises sans succès elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente de poissons d’eau douce et cela depuis 28 ans. Elle exerçait cette activité avec ses moyens propres qui s’avéraient insuffisant. Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires elle intègre le programme crédit de l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant une année. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et le précèdent a été remboursé sans difficulté.

Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 10 gros paniers de poissons dans la région de Mopti (région poissonneuse) avec des pêcheurs (Bozos et Somonos) pour les stocker dans ses congélateurs à domicile ou un endroit est aménagé à cet effet.. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché de poissons de Koutiala très fréquenté par les ménagères, les restaurateurs de la place et d’autres clients de passage.

Madame Aminata Dioné compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA, avec lequel elle contribue aux charges de la famille, payer les intérêts du prêt et renforcer son fonds de commerce. Dans l’avenir elle envisage multiplier les points de vente dans la ville de Koutiala.

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Lourdes Beatriz

texts.es:
Lourdes is 21 years old, studied until the second year of secondary school, is married without children, and lives on Ave. Tacna.

She is a member of the Community Bank Julia Jiménez - Mazocruz. A year ago she began with initial loans in the amount of 300 Soles, with which she bought a dozen shoes. When she was fifteen she began in business selling gelatin and food.

With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy one dozen slippers that cost 300 Soles, one dozen shoes that are 500 Soles, and with the rest she will buy jeans.

Her desire is to put a store of shoes and slippers in the city of Ilave and to sell in bulk and at retail prices.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Lourdes tiene 21 años de edad, estudió segundo de secundaria , es casada , sin hijos, vive en la Av. Tacna s/n.

Ella es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, hace un año empezó con los préstamos iniciando con el monto de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual compró una docena de zapatillas, desde los 15 años empezó hacer negocio vendiendo gelatina, comida.

Con este préstamo de S/1,500.00 que pagará en 04 cuotas comprará 01 docena de zapatillas que cuesta S/ 300.00, 01 docena de zapatos que está S/.500.00 y con el resto pantalones Jeans.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de zapatos, zapatillas en la ciudad de Ilave y vender al por mayor y menor.

loans.use: Buy shoes and jeans.

loans.name: Khekh

texts.fr: Khekh Niakk  qui signifie lutter contre la pauvreté en wolof  est un groupe de cinq  personnes qui s'active communément dans la couture. ce pret Contribue au renforcement de leur capital pour satisfaire la demande de clientèle dans les préparatifs des fetes de korité et tabaski.les membres du groupe habitent dans le quartier  Diakhao de thiés.
texts.en:
Khekh Niakk which means struggle against poverty in Wolof is a group of four persons who are working jointly in the field of dressmaking. This loan will contribute to bolstering their capital so that they can satisfy the demand of their clientele as they prepare for the holidays of korité and tabaski (Muslim Feast of the Sacrifice).l The members of the group live in the neighborhoods called Diakhao in Thiés.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dressmaking

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 59 años, ella y su esposo tuvieron 9 hijos, de los cuales ahora solo 2 están con ellos y estudian en el colegio de su pueblo.  Rosita es una madre muy activa, en horas de la mañana prepara desayuno y a la vez cocina el almuerzo, después tiene que salir a comprar plátano o sacarlo de su propio huerto, luego procede a colocarlos en sus cajones, para llevarlos a un mercado de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a sembrar café, maíz, yuca, fréjoles y plátano. Cuando es temporada de siembra, apoya a su esposo. Lo que más le gusta es ganar lo adecuado según su trabajo, lo dificultoso es el precio del transporte de sus cajones de plátano, que es muy alto y tiene que recuperarlo en la venta de la fruta.  Ella y su esposo tienen que trabajar en sus actividades porque sino no les alcanza para el menú diario y para los gastos de sus hijos menores que aun les falta estudiar, y como padres quieren darles lo mejor.  El préstamo que ha solicitado será invertido en cajones y la otra parte en la compra de plátanos en mayor cantidad. Además dedicarse a sembrar ella misma, para no tener que comprar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old. She and her husband have 9 children, of whom only 2 now live with them and study in the high school in their town. Rosita is a very active mother. In the morning, she makes breakfast and, at the same time, she cooks lunch. Later, she has to go to buy bananas or take them from her own garden. Then she puts them in boxes to take them to a market in the city. Her husband sows coffee, corn, yucca, beans, and bananas. When is the sowing season, she helps her husband. What she likes most is to earn a sufficient amount after her work. The difficult thing is the price of transportation for the boxes of bananas, which is very high. She has to recover that when she sells the fruit. She and her husband have to work because otherwise they won’t have enough to pursue their daily activities and for the expenses for their young children, who are still studying. As their parents, they have to give them the best. This loan will be invested into boxes and the purchase of more bananas. In addition, she will sow herself, so that they don’t have to hire other people.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell and boxes for transport

loans.name: Thoeung

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeung M. is a villager in Bravong village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ros Rom, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice for a living. They face an obstacle because they do not have much money to support themselves. Thus, Mrs. Thoeung M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to start a new business. She hopes to increase the family income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs Thoeung M. is 45 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to start a new business.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ny N. is a group leader of four members who all live in Ta Krong village in Kampong Chhnang province.  He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.  

Aside from this plantation, he is a firewood seller.  Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it.  Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood to re-sell.  He hopes to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.  

His wife, Mrs. Nil Sary, is a pig breeder.  Mr. Ny N. is 37-years-old and the father of three children, one of whom helps their father with his business while the other three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to re-sell.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en: Monalisa Fareti, 21, is married with two children.  She has many years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the villagers and general public five days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 140 Tala ($58 US).  SPBD loans are Monalisa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The purpose of her loan is to buy weedkiller, vegetable seeds, sacks of fertilizer, and chemicals. Her husband helps her run the business.

loans.use: Purchase weedkiller, seeds, fertilizer, and chemicals

loans.name: Agiri Nayiga  ‘S Group

texts.en: Agiri is a 65 year old widow with 4 children ages 30 to 50 years old. She lives in a rented two room house which she shares with five other people. They typically don’t have electricity and piped water at their home. She works in a semi urban area which is located on the outskirts of Kampala.  She sells eatables like chapatti mandazi and pan cakes in the Kamwokya market seven days a week. She rents her business premises and sells on retail. She sells her products to an average of 20 customers per day. Agiri has been in this business for the last sixteen years and has been in MCDT for 13 years and is servicing her twenty seventh loan. Agiri wants to buy a baking flour machine. She hopes to buy a plot of land and own a permanent home.

loans.use: She wants to buy flour mixing machine

loans.name: Maeataanoa

texts.en:
K. 70, is a widower with 7 children. He has many years of experience in the shop business. He sells to the villagers and the public 7 days a week. He has 5 previous loans with SPBD. He expects his weekly net cash flow to be 208 Tala.

SPBD loans are K.’s only access to capital because he was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. K. is the only male who has joined the SPBD programme since 2004 and he is one of the most outstanding members in the programme. K. chose to join SPBD when his wife died; he decided to continue what his wife had begun. His loan will be used to buy goods and a new refrigerator for his shop.

loans.use: Purchase goods and a new refrigerator for his business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia C. C., pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 23 años de edad, con 3 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (segundo de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años e inició su negocio con ventas de bebidas y compra y venta de maíz al mayor, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió como capital inicial en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
Debido a la alta demanda de maíz en los mercados de Arequipa y Tacna, ella pretende ampliar su mercado como proveedora, para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, que le permitirá comprar más maíz y adicionalmente pocor y distribuirlo en los referidos mercados. Finalmente se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Eugenia C. C. belongs to the Mujeres Unidas ('United Women') community bank of Desaguadero district, in the Chucuito province of the department of Puno. She is 23-years old, has three children, and has an incomplete secondary education (she finished two years of secondary school). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos program for five years. She started her business, selling drinks and buying and selling wholesale corn, with her first loan of 300 PEN, which she used as her initial capital investment in Desaguadero. Due to the high demand for corn in the Arequipa and Tacna markets, Eugenia expects to expand her market as a supplier. Therefore she needs a loan of 3,000 PEN, which will allow her to buy more corn and also popcorn, to distribute in the previously mentioned markets. Finally, she promises to make her loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and popcorn for distribution in market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has two children, one at the university and the other in senior high school. She has been married for almost thirty years. Her husband is a teacher who teaches in the government school in their community.

Mary enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk. However, she is constrained by low capital from making meaningful progress.

She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams etc. to make increased profits. She believes that, with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to realize her dream.

She belongs to the Maranatha village bank. She hopes to receive GH¢800 to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She sells sarongs of various colors to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Bobo

texts.en:
M. Bobo has dedicated himself to raising livestock since he was very young. He is a married father who supports his children, none of whom need his help to complete their studies. His wife also helps him with business. Bobo is faced with the need is to purchase calves. The animals Bobo raises are sold to farmers who then resupply him with calves. To acquire the animals, Bobo has come to IMON International to obtain the necessary credit so he can continue to maintain his dear home.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the outer reaches of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: the purchase of calves

loans.name: Omoyemwen

texts.en: Omoyemwen is 25 years-old and married with one child.  To earn income for her family, Omoyemwen sells cosmetics in retail to her customers.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell.  She would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia S. makes a living primarily from selling raw bananas and coconut fruits in her local community. She is 28 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. Alia has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Alia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Alia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to buy more bananas and coconut fruits. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and to supplement income for her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy bananas and coconuts

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abdumannon

texts.en:
S. Abdumannon is 36 years old. He is married with two children. Abdumannon is a market vendor. He sells fodder for the animals. The generated income is mainly used for the purchase of small bulls for raising and selling. Now Abdumannon is applying for a loan of 3000. He is planning to increase the working capital to expand the business and to use the generated income for forming a private farm for breeding the cattle. Abdumannon thanks all supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth S. is from the village of Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a weaving business, weaving and selling "amakan" or woven bamboo wall products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun V. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over 100 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave baskets. Recently, Sun V. has run out of essential materials from her stock supply and she hopes to acquire other raw materials to continue making baskets. She depends on using her Kiva loan as an advance.

Sun V. is a 47-year-old married woman blessed with seven children. Two of her children are married: a daughter works in the shoe industry and a son is a diver at a sea port.

loans.use: To buy materials to make bamboo baskets

loans.name: Bana

texts.en:
Bana E. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Bana is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Bana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Bana is just starting this business.

In 2009, Bana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for resale at her store

loans.name: Bomba #1 Group

texts.en:
Bomba #1 is a group of 5 borrowers led by Bamma L.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. Bamma is 47 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 8 and 25. Her youngest is in the 3rd grade. She was unable to attend school, although she enjoyed it, because the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Bamma sells dry meat, which she buys wholesale, prepares, and sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades. She is successful because her customers like her personality and the way she prepares the meat. She’s taking the loan to purchase raw meat to prepare and sell. Her dream is to expand her business so that, one day, she can build a permanent shop. With the profits from her business, Bamma dreams of raising her family well and sending all her children to the school that she was unable to attend.

loans.use: Purchase raw meat wholesale for preparation to sell

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Luzmila es casada, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Luzmila junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de bellos tejidos en telares, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de 9 personas, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Lima y también una feria en EE.UU.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos.
Los sueños de Luzmila son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener mas capital y exportar mas sus productos.

loans.use: Para la compra de hilos.

loans.name: Osayomore

texts.en: Osayomore is married with 5 children, she is 45 years old, she sells provision and foodstuff and has been in this business for years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuff. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff and provision to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia C. is from the village of Bolisong, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Alicia is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 19 años, es una joven madre que hace poco tiempo dio a luz a su primer hijo. Junto a su esposo viven en la casa de sus padres. 

Desde hace medio año se independizó, ya que anteriormente trabajaba con sus padres en sus chacras, ahora ella sola emprende sus propios cultivos en tierras que sus padres le cedieron para que las produzca. 
Desde entonces Ana y su esposo se dedicaron a limpiar el terreno fértil, sacando la maleza y otras hierbas que perjudicasen la siembra de café y plátanos, ya que son los productos que desean cultivar. Para Ana esta actividad le da mucha satisfacción, puesto que tiene los conocimientos previos que sus padres le dejaron por lo que ahora realiza una buena labor agrícola, además sus padres le brindaron lo necesario para salir adelante y con esa misma entrega desea darle lo mismo a su hijo a quien tanto adora. 
Por otro lado, su esposo realiza el trabajo de remover y sembrar para otras personas, por lo que Ana le lleva el almuerzo y después  lo apoya mientras su bebe duerme plácidamente, es así que termina el trabajo en menor tiempo y eso le da la oportunidad de empezar con otro trabajo, resultando beneficioso para ellos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ya que motivados por las referencias que tienen con la institución están dispuestos a solicitar el crédito y a cumplir con las metas que se propongan. Con el dinero que solicita desea comprar 400 plantas de plátanos para sembrarlas en la tierra ya tiene preparada.
texts.en:
Ana is 19 years old, and a young woman who just recently gave birth to her first child. Together with her husband, they live in the home of their parents. About six months ago she became independent, as she used to work with her parents on their farmlands. Now, she works for herself on lands that her parents gave her to produce crops. Since then, Ana and her husband have worked at clearing the fertile land and removed the weeds that affect the planting of coffee and bananas which are the items they want to grow. This activity brings Ana a great deal of satisfaction, as she has knowledge she gained while working with her parents that gives her the ability to produce a good crop. In addition, her parents have provided her with the necessary tools to get ahead. She wants to be able to support her child, who she adores. On the other hand, her husband works removing debris and sowing seeds for other people as well, and Ana brings him lunch and then helps him while the baby sleeps peacefully. In this manner, the work is finished quicker which gives him the opportunity to start with his other work, which is beneficial for both of them. This is her first loan with MFP and, given that they are motivated by the references they have with the institution, they are disposed to request the loan and meet the goals they have set for themselves. They intent to use the funds to buy 400 banana plants to place on the land they have already prepared for crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase banana plants.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
La señora Lita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín,  Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y 01 hijo independiente.

Lita, lleva 10 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Lita, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. En la actualidad, Lita esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,400.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Lita is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas II” (Little Stars II), which is located in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San San Martín. She is 42 years old, single, and the mother of an adult child.

Lita has worked as a seamstress for 10 years. Using her knowledge and sewing experience, Lita did not hesitate to start her own dressmaking shop that she operates out of her home. Her business is well-suited for welcoming her regular customers, who come by on a daily basis in need of her services. Lita's work is based on the orders that her customers submit in advance. She is very happy and proud of what she has achieved.

With this loan of 1400 soles, Lita will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, scissors, large spools of thread in different colors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Today Lita feels that she is an accomplished woman. She now has even more desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. Lita is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & supplies

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina E. is from the city of Maloro, Tangub City. She is 38 years old. Gina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Gina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Ayichétou

texts.en:
Ayichétou I. sells a variety of grocery products and jewelry in the Agoé region of Togo. She began her business in 2003. She is married and has two children.

Mrs. I. is requesting her first loan with WAGES. She will use the loan to purchase grocery products for sale - specifically, 10 bags of rice, 10 barrels of oil, three cases of tomatoes, one case of macaroni, and 10 cases of wine. This will increase and diversify the supply she is able to offer her customers.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products for sale

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
PameL. es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedora.
PameL. es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, PameL. culmino sus estudios D. Química Farmacéutica, PameL. venD. ropa variada a pedido, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito y contado. 
PameL. necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. pantalones.
El sueño D. PameL. son tener una farmacia.
texts.en:
PameL. is a partner of "Banco Comunal Emprendedora". She lives with her significant other, she is 25 years old and has a one-year-old son. PameL. finished her studies of Pharmaceutical Chemistry. PameL. sells a variety of clothes by order offering the products to her friends and relatives. Her sales are on credit or cash.

PameL. needs a loan of 600 soles to be invested in buying trousers. It is PameL.'s dream to own a drug store.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of trousers.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	. El joven Rafael Antonio U. es trabajador de una estación de combustible (PETRONIC) desempeñándose como conductor y también como lavador de carro.
El joven U. va utilizar este crédito para la compra de fertilizantes ya que el tiene hortaliza (tomate)  sembrado en la finca de sus padres.
El objetivo de la fertilización es para obtener mayores rendimiento y por ende mayores ganancia de su cosecha.
Rafael es acompañado (soltero) y tiene 1 hijo y en edad escolar y vive con su hijo y su compañera de vida .Es el tercer crédito que ha tenido con Ceprodel Rafael dice que ha sido de gran ayuda los crédito anteriores ya que a comprado algunos electrodomésticos que necesita en su casa y a solventado algunas necesidades personales  de el.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio U. works for a fuel station (PETRONIC) as a driver, and he also washes cars. Rafael will use this loan to buy fertilizers because he has a tomato crop planted on his parents’ farm. The objective of the fertilization is to get great output and more earnings from his harvest. Rafael is single. He lives with his life partner and his school-age child. This is the third loan that he has had with Ceprodel. Rafael says that the previous loans have been a big help. He has purchased household appliances that he needs in his house, and he has paid for some personal necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel G. K. is 25 years old and married with one child aged two years old.

Daniel has been providing bicycle transport services to the local people for the last two years. His business is located at Kimbo, a busy market in Thika, Kenya. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples.

Daniel says that his business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, hence customers are spoilt for choice. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

Daniel will use his loan of 15000 KES to start a vegetable shop to improve his living standards. He hopes to be a big business man. He is very hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: To start up a new vegetable shop.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Victoria es soltera y tiene 52 años, Victoria vende ropa variada y cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además Victoria prepara queques y humitas a pedidos.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, vainilla y canela.
El sueño de Victoria es tener un cafetín en un lugar céntrico.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Kuskanchik communal bank. Kuskanchick means "Together" in Quechua. Victoria is single and is 52 years old. She sells a variety of clothing and cosmetics through catalogs which she offers to friends and relatives. She also makes cakes and humitas (a Peruvian version of a tamale) by special order. Victoria needs a loan of 900 soles to be invested in the purchase of sugar, vanilla and cinnamon. Victoria's dream is to have a small café in a downtown location.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, vanilla and cinnamon

loans.name: Irène
