texts.fr: Née le 05 Avril 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Irène est mariée à ECLOU Edgard, un mécanicien auto. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a cinq ans environs que Irène s'est installée avec sa famille au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Irène vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, couscous, savons, conserves de sardine, lait, huile végétale, mayonnaise, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Irène s'approvisionne. Irène exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a bénéficié une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Irène sollicite un deuxième crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on April 5, 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. H. Irène is married to Mr. ECLOU Edgard, an auto mechanic. The couple have two children, who are both in school. Five years ago, Irène and her family settled in the Sènadé district in Cotonou. The couple jointly ensure that the various family expenses are covered. To address their needs, Irène sells a variety of goods (pasta, couscous, soaps, canned sardines, milk, vegetable oil, mayonnaise, etc.) out of her home. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for eight years and has benefited already from one loan from ALIDé that she repaid. Irène is requesting a second loan with the aim of bolstering her business and satisfying the burgeoning number of demands from her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods (pasta, canned foods, sardines, sugar, soaps)

loans.name: Osita

texts.en: Osita M. is from the village of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Osita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Osita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Osita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Rita

texts.en:
Ma. Rita P. is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old and is single. Ma. Rita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ma. Rita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ma. Rita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of her siblings.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Elsa H. D. 57 años D. edad, actualmente casada y tiene 4 hijos, es una D. las 7 integrantes D. la Alcancía Comunal Nuevo Amanecer.
DesD. hace 28 años viene trabajando  en la venta D. zapatos, zapatillas, y prendas D. vestir D. forma ambulatoria, los venD. al contado y a crédito, empezó con una docena D. zapatos y poca cantidad D.  prendas D. vestir: camisas, polos, y otras, pero al transcurrir el tiempo su ingreso fue mejorando y fue aumentando  su mercadería D. acuerdo a la venta que realizaba,  empezó  en Edaprospo  por intermedio D. una vecina  que la invitaron  a participar. Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra D. zapatos y prendas D. vestir.
Este actual Préstamo  lo invertirá en la compra D. una docena D. zapatos y zapatillas y una cantidad D. prendas D. vestir.
El anhelo D. Elsa es poder establecer  una tienda propia en una zona publica para  vender su mercadería, y culminar la construcción D. su casa.
texts.en:
57 year-old Elsa H. is one of the 7 members of the Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn") Communal Bank. She is currently married and has four children. For the last 28 years she has worked selling shoes, sneakers, and clothing as an itinerant vendor for cash and credit. She started with a dozen shoes and a small quantity of clothing like shirts, jerseys, and other items, but over time, her business improved and she expanded her merchandise based on the sales she maD.. Elsa came to EDAPROSPO through a neighbor who invited her to participate. She invested her first loan in the purchase of shoes and items of clothing. She will invest this loan in the purchase of a dozen shoes and sneakers and a number of items of clothing. Elsa's dream is to be able to establish her own store in a public area, where she can sell her merchandise, and to finish constructing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as shoes and sneakers

loans.name: Fight For Shameness Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Fight For Shameness Group". They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 1,200,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu K., who is pictured on the left. Isatu is age 40 and was born in a village called Robuga. She is married with two children. Her husband is an architect and her children are attending primary school. For many years now, Isatu has been selling fried food: potatoes, fish and plantains mixed with stew and breads. With her share of this loan, she will buy working materials like frying oil, fish, plantains, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: To buy frying oil, fish, plantains, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia G., is from the village of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Virginia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a cake baking business. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Virginia has successfully repaid her first loan, for 10,000 PHP, from PMPC. That loan was used to purchase additional ingredients for her cake making. Virginia is now requesting her second loan, this one for 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients of her cake making business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in cake making.

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr:
Elle est âgée de 45ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants,le pus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 8ans, les 5 enfants vont à l'école normalement.
Le commerce de fripérie est une affaire de famille,sa grande mère et sa mère le faisait déja, elle aussi a choisit cette activité après leurs morts.
Elle a commencé en 2004 avec un capital de 55000francs, aujourd'hui elle veut s'affirmer, avec le nouveau prêt qu'elle va recevoir, elle voudrait acheter les ballons de premières qualité tel que(les habits non portés , les  serviettes fins de séries et les draps de lit non utilises).
Par jour, elle vend au maximum 60000francs et quand les tenps sont durs, son minimum est de 250000francs.
L'avenir de ses enfants lui  préocupe beaucoup et veut les aider dans leurs réussites en les soutenant moralement et financierement.
Sa vision est  d'ouvrir une boutique qui sera gerer de générations en générations pour  laisser à ses enfants comme héritage.
Son entourage la considère comme une femme battante et pense qu'elle va vraiment réussir.
texts.en:
She is 45 years old and mother to five children, the oldest of whom is 16 years old and the youngest eight years old. The five children attend school normally. The second-hand clothing business is a family business, since her grandmother and her mother did this; she also chose this activity after their deaths. She began in 2004 with a capital of 55,000 francs, and now she would like to assert herself in this business. With the new loan she is going to get, she would like to buy top quality bundles of items, such as unworn clothes, end-of-series towels and unused bedsheets. Her maximum daily turnover is 60,000 francs, and when times are hard, her minimum turnover is 25,000 francs. She is very preoccupied with her children's future and wants to help them succeed by supporting them morally and financially. She has an ambition to open a shop which would be managed from one generation to another and would be left as an inheritance for her children. People close to her consider her to be a fighter and think that she will be really successful.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new bundles of second-hand items: bedsheets, T-shirts, pullovers

loans.name: La Mujer Valiente 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Edline is the coordinator of her group, La Mujer Valiente 1 & 2 (Brave Women). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenges are right now are to take her business to the next level, as she started just three months ago.

Edline is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, oil, meats and other goods. She is selling food to people in her community for lunch. She started with her savings, and she wants this loan to improve her business. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to buy some school supplies for her children.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican - many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti - clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production. The second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, Santiago, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy oil, meats, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 55 años y tiene 5 hijos, ella vive en la comunidad D. Pachar que se encuentra ubicado a 10 minutos D. Urubamba. La socia tiene un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en compra y venta D. frutas para lo cual a un inicio se le hacía difícil ya que no contaban con mucho capital, fue entonces que se presento la oportunidad D. pertenecer al banco comunal D. la Asociación Arariwa el cual le brindo apoyo con préstamos D. dinero y así pudo mejorar su negocio.  La pueden encontrar en su puesto D. venta  en el mercado central “Virgen Asunta D. Ollantaytambo”, donD. venD. frutas traídas del valle D. la Convención y del norte del país, los 7 días D. la semana, desD. las 8 D. la mañana hasta las 4 D. la tarD.. 

Aurelia es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Un flujo regular D. clientes visita su puesto y el negocio se anima bastante por las mañanas. Con su próximo crédito, Aurelia espera recibir $100. Por el momento, su puesto esta modestamente equipado D. frutas. Le gustaría usar el dinero D. este préstamo en comprar más frutas como por ejemplo plátanos, piñas, naranjas, etc. 
      
Aurelia pertenece al banco comunal “la Amistad D. Ollantaytambo” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 55 years old and has got 5 children. She lives in the Pachar community, which is located 10 minutes from Urubamba. She has got a small business, which consists in the purchase and sale of fruits. Its beginnings were difficult because she didn't have much capital. It was then that she was presented with the opportunity to join the communal bank, Asociación Arariwa, which offers loans and from there was able to improver her business. She can be found at a stall in the central market, "Virgen Asunta D. Ollantaytambo", where she sells fruit brought from the Convención valley and from the north of the country, seven days a week, from 8am until 4pm. Aurelia is a responsible and hard working woman. A regular flow of customers visit her stand, and her business gets quite busy in the mornings. Aurelia hopes to receive $100 in her next loan. At the moment, her stand is moderately stocked with fruit and she would like to use the money from her next loan to purchase more fruit, such as bananas, pineapples, oranges, etc. Aurelia pertains to the communal bank, Amistad D. Ollantaytambo of Asociación Arariwa.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fruit, such as bananas, pineapples, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Anfitrionas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Anfitrionas se encuentra trabajando y desarrollando las capacitaciones con las asesoras quienes desarrollan las clases para las señoras aprovecen practicando lo aprendido en sus actividades.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, en estos cuatro años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
La señora Sebastina es una de las integrantes y ella se dedica a la atencion de un salón de belleza que posee en su casa.
Esta profesion lo aquirio desde muy joven y es una actividad que le gusta mucho, cuenta con clientela formada.
Comenta que esta muy satisfecha con sus compañeras del comité ya que se ayudan entre todas y al mismo tiempo ayudan tambien  a sus familias especialmente con los gastos de alimentación.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de sillón para peluqueria y asi podrá brindar mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee of Mujeres Anfitrionas (Proprietor Women) is working and developing the skills with the facilitators that design classes for the ladies to practice what they’ve learned. This committee is from San Lorenzo, during the past four years of intense work they have grown not only socially but also financially, they are recognized in the area as very hardworking women. Sebastina is one of the members who works from home in a beauty salon. She started doing this activity at a very young age, she enjoys her work and has a good client base. She mentions being happy with the other members of her committee because they help each other while at the same time helping their families, particularly with food expense. She requests a loan to purchase a beauty shop chair to give better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chair for beauty salon

loans.name: G.s. Ana Virgen Noble Group

texts.es: La señora Manuela, su negocio que es la venta de ropa ambulante ropa nueva y usada, Ella aduce que en su negocio siempre vende diario, y gracias a esto su nivel de vida ha mejorado pero siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. La señora Yesenia del Socorro solicita este préstamo para invertirle a su negocio que consiste en la venta de ropa   cosméticos en general y tortillas y Marcia Rebeca C. es otra integrante del grupo, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de nacatamales y pan, los nacatamales los hace el fin de semana y el pan es vendido diario, generalmente viaja a Managua a distribuirlo.  Su esposo trabaja como albañil. Pues juntas están buscando la forma de cómo sobrevivir con sus negocios es por eso que realizan este financiamiento con el fin de mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Manuela's business is to sell new and used clothing from door to door. She says that she makes sales on a daily basis and thanks to her business her quality of life has improved. But she is always looking for a way to improve her earnings. Yesenia del Socorro requests a loan to invest in her business. She sells clothing, cosmetics, and tortillas. Marcia Rebeca C. is another member of the group and she sells traditional foods and breads. She makes her traditional foods on the weekends, but she sells breads on a daily basis. She usually travels to Managua to sell. Hes husband is a construction worker. Together they are looking for a way to prosper their businesses. This loan will help to improve their business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: María Carmen Adelaida

texts.es:
La Señora María Carmen Adelaida C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, vive en la comunidad de Guacarrumi que pertenece a la parroquia de Chican en el cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por tener un clima templado, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, en este sector de da una gran variedad de frutas.

Doña Carmen tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 21 años de edad que estudia en la universidad. Su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para brindarle a su familia un mejor porvenir. La casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad y fue construida con el sacrificio y trabajo conyugal.

La Señora Carmen se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales como: chanchos, ganado, cuyes, gansos, conejos y pollos, que son vendidos en su comunidad.

Este es el segundo año que realiza los créditos en la banca comunal y le han beneficiado mucho en la economía de su hogar, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y en su alimento.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de cría de animales y poder terminar su casa.
texts.en:
María Carmen Adelaida C. is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” (United Women) communal bank, and lives in the Guacarrumi community, in the Chican parish, of the Paute hamlet. This hamlet is known for its temperate climate, and its residents who farm and raise livestock. A large variety of fruit grows in this area. Carmen is 62 years old, married, and has one 21 year old son who studies at university. Her husband has emigrated in search of a better job so that he can give his family a better future. The house in which they live was built through their hard work and sacrifice. Carmen raises livestock such as hogs, Guinea pigs, rabbits, and chickens, which she sells within the community. This is the second year that she’s received loans through the communal bank and it has provided financial help to her household. She will use the money from this loan, through Fundacion Espoir, to invest in hogs and feed. Her goal is to grow her livestock business and finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en: Sorm V., 45, lives in the Takeo province with her husband and four children. She makes about US$3 daily, selling chickens at the local market, while her husband makes US$2 as a farmer. She is asking for a loan of US$500 to sell more chickens daily. This couple is also supported by two children who are garment factory workers.

loans.use: To buy and sell chickens.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 50 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Giovanni de 48 años y de su hija que es mayor de edad, además es independiente;  juntos se esfuerzan cada día por continuar adelante en busca del progreso. Cada día se despierta con mucho ánimo, pues no piensa dejar de trabajar hasta que termine de concretar los proyectos que tiene en mente. Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la preparación de menús (comidas diarias) para los trabajadores de una empresa  de la zona donde vive; además prepara buffets cuando le piden para diferentes eventos sociales. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues lo puede realizar desde la comodidad de su casa y esta muy contenta porque su hija le ayuda  durante sus ratos libres. Es así que el fin de semana vende diversos platillos y postres en una feria que se instala cerca de su casa, en ese lugar vende junto a otras damas trabajadoras como ella. Gracias al negocio que tiene, recibe regulares ganancias, con eso ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un restaurante, donde pueda ofrecer comida en un lugar fijo y cómodo. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una olla arrocera, además de implementos nuevos de cocina que necesita para continuar cocinando sin problemas, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
50-year-old Lina lives in her own house along with her 48-year-old husband, Giovanni, and their grown daughter.  Together they strive to move forward every day, looking for progress.  Lina wakes up every morning with a lot of energy.  She doesn’t think about stopping work until she’s made all the projects in her head a reality.

For the past six years, Lina has prepared daily meals for the workers at a business in the area where she lives.  Additionally, she prepares buffets for different social events when asked.  She really likes her work, especially since she can do it from the comfort of her own home.  Her daughter can help during her free time, which makes Lina very happy.  During the weekends, Lina sells various small plates and pastries in a market near her house.  There she sells alongside other hard-working women like herself.

Thanks to her business, Lina makes a regular income, which she uses to help her husband with household costs.  Being an entrepreneurial woman, she plans to open a restaurant in the future, so she can serve food in a place that’s established and comfortable.

This is Lina’s first loan with MFP, and she promises to complete her quotas punctually because she doesn’t want to look bad to the people who are providing her with the money that allows her to continue working in the search of progress.  Lina plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a rice cooker as well as other new kitchen tools she needs to continue cooking problem-free, which she hopes will help her increase her earnings.

loans.use: Buying a rice cooker and other kitchen supplies

loans.name: 020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu Group

texts.en:
Dung L. T. (14) is a 48 year old femaL. who lives in the town of Hoang Hoa. Dung is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu (020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu).

Dung is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Dung owns and operates a specialized retail store. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling confectionery products in the local community. Dung has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dung has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Phuong P. T. (18) is a 50 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her food stall business.
2.  Dien T. T. (16) is a 56 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her retail store business.
3.  Hoa D. T. (17) is a 39 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
4.  Thanh P. T. (13) is a 50 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her agriculture business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Dung L. T. (14) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Dung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu (020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Dung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Dung kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2008, Dung đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Dung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua cá bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Phuong P. T. (18) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.
2.  Dien T. T. (16) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.
3.  Hoa D. T. (17) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
4.  Thanh P. T. (13) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Mangidkid Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns a retail store selling daily use products such as biscuits, candies, snacks, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3300 PHP a month.

In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPCand is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis tiene 22 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de especias, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa, su madre, sus dos hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad, él es el único que trabaja para mantener a su familia, por lo que debe tener  un  trabajo estable para poder proveer de lo necesario para el hogar, trabaja solo y fue influenciado por sus amigos, no tiene un horario fijo.
Él necesita un préstamo para la compra de especias ya que quiere tener mayor disponibilidad de producto para abastecer a los clientes y de esta manera mantenerlos  fieles a comprarles solo a él, Su proyección es aumentar el volumen de sus ventas para disponer de mayores ingresos para mantener a su familia y darle un mejor futuro, quiere además ser un excelente mayorista en este comercio.
texts.en:
Luis is 22 years old and makes his living selling spices.  He lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel Department with his wife, his mother and his two daughters, ages 5 and 3 years old.  He is the only one who works to support the family, so he needs to have a stable job in order to provide all that his family needs.  He works alone, was influenced by his friends and does not maintain fixed working hours.
He needs the loan to purchase spices.  He wants to have a greater quantity of his product available so that he can keep his customers well supplied, which in turn keeps them loyal to purchasing only from him.  His plan is to increase the volume of his sales.  He would then have more income at his disposal with which to support his family and give them a better future.  In addition, he wants to be an excellent wholesaler in this business.

loans.use: To purchase spices.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Сафаев Хусейн проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 27 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хусейн не имеет высшего образования. Более 7 лет занимается торговлей. В поселке "Аскари сурх" он продает горючее. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. То есть он намерен в оптом купить солярку и бензин.
texts.en: Huseyn S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 27 years old, married, and has one child.  His wife is a housewife.  Hussein does not have a higher education.  He has been working in sales for more than seven years. He sells fuel in the village Askari Surkh.  He is taking out a loan to increase sales.  He intends to buy diesel and gasoline wholesale.

loans.use: increasing sales

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut T., age 49, sells ice cream and earns an income of USD $2.50 per day. T. is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. The family has to spend USD $83.00 on food, USD $5.00 on electricity, and USD $32 on other necessary expenses every month. 

T. is requesting a loan of USD $600 to purchase a motorbike for one of the children to use when selling ice-cream. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use when selling ice cream

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es: El Sr. Juanito es dueño taxi que trabaja en una línea de radiotaxi,  el esta casado y tiene  una hija, la esposa trabaja como empleada del hogar juntamente con su pequeña de 3 años, ellos viven  por la Zona de Cota Cota, en la casa de sus padres, este cliente anteriormente fue cliente Kiva, tiene un historial bueno, por temporadas de fiestas el se dedica a tocar en una banda de músicos tocando trompeta, quien por otra parte viaja a Desaguadero de donde compra los instrumentos, en esta ocasión el crédito destinara a la compra de llantas y mantenimiento de su transporte ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y no le permite brindar un mejor servicio, esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juanito owns a taxi that he operates in a radio dispatched taxi service.  He’s married and has a daughter.  His wife works as a domestic employee with her three-year-old.  They live in the Cota Cota area in his parents’ house.  

He was a Kiva client previously; he has a good history.  During festivals he plays trumpet in a band of musicians and he goes to Desaguadero to buy musical instruments.

This time the loan will be used to buy tires and for vehicle maintenance because it’s starting to show some problems that prevent him from providing the best service.

He’s grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.en:
Rajabgul is a young divorced lady with faith in a good future. She lives and works in Dushanbe, selling towels and kerchiefs in the central marketplace. Rajabgul launched her small venture 5 years ago and has gained much experience and a loyal clientele. Rajabgul is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni to increase her working capital. She hopes to continue developing her business and improving her living standards. Rajabgul has proved to be a reliable and solvent client.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Mathius

texts.en: Mathius is 31 years old and has three children between the age of 7 years and 4 months. His two eldest children go to school. Mathius works together with his wife in the store they own, selling a variety of goods such as rice, sugar and soap. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more inventory. He also plans to renovate their house. With the profits he wishes to install electricity in his house.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.en:
Mr. Ruperto D., 37 years of age and single, is a resident of Digson, Bonifacio, Miss. Occ. To make a living, he works at ELIM INC. as Broiler Production Specialist, earning an average net income of not less than P5,000.00 a month. He is also engaged in a business entitled Buy and Sell NFA Rice and Distributor.

Ruperto joined PAGLAUM MPC in 2010 because he was very much interested in our products and services and the fact that we are one of the best cooperatives in Northern Mindanao. As a second-time borrower, he is entitled to avail the amount of P50,000.00 as additional capital for his Buy and Sell Business.

loans.use: Additional capital for NFA Rice Buy and Sell Business

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés, es una mujer seria y trabajadora de 23 años. Que vive junto a su esposo Oscar y sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). El trabajo conjunto que realiza a lado de su esposo, le valió para poder sembrar café en su media hectárea de terreno agrícola, esperando pacientemente los 3 años de maduración que restan para que pueda dar sus primeros granos. De igual manera tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los habitantes de su localidad. Ahora desea comprar más terrenos y así poder sembrar los diferentes frutos que crecen en está parte del país. Con el trabajo de su esposo, quien tiene experiencia en la siembra de cítricos; espera obtener los objetivos que se planteó. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece la buena disposición de los integrantes, con el desarrollo de los objetivos. Inés, observó que su tienda de comestible carece de algunos productos de primera necesidad. Por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar hortalizas, arroz, azúcar, y bebidas para la temporada de verano.
texts.en: Inés is a serious and hardworking 23 year old woman. She lives with her husband Oscar and their 2 children in their own home, located in the community of Guacamayo (central Peruvian jungle). The work she has done at her husband's side has served for her to be able to plant coffee on their half-hectare plot of cropland. They are patiently awaiting the 3 years left in the maturation process to be able to have their first beans. In addition, she also has a grocery store wher she sells basic neccesity products to the residents in the area. Right now, she wants to buy more land and thus be able to plant different crops that grow in this part of the country. With the work of her husband, who has experience planting citrus, she hopes to attain the goals she has set. She belongs to the “Nuevo Amanecer de Guacamayo” [New Dawn of Guacamayo] group, and this is the first loan that she has had with MFP. She is grateful for the members good disposition, and with the development of their objectives. Inés observed that her store lacks some basic neccesity products. Because of this, with the loan she is planning on buying fresh produce, rice, sugar and beverages for the summer season.

loans.use: To buy fresh porduce, rice, sugar and soft drinks to supply her store.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny has been practicing mixed farming for the last 8 years in Litein, Rift Valley, Kenya. Her farm produces milk and eggs, which are all sold locally. Winny mainly depends on the income from her farm to provide for her family's basic needs.

Winny has requested this loan of 35,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable her to pay school fees for her two children who attend school. Lack of enough animal feed has been Winny's greatest challenge in this business. She hopes to acquire a pure breed of dairy cow in the next 5 years.

Winny is 25 years old and married, with 4 children aged between 2 and 8 years old.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en: Jemima is 26 years old, lives in the Mahanga area of Vihiga and is married to Droban, who is a bus driver. They have two children and work very hard to provide their family with a good life. For the last five years, Jemima has made a living by running a hotel. She is applying for this loan from KADET Ltd to buy ingredients that she will use to provide good and delicious food to her customers.  She makes about KES. 5,100 a month and hopes to own a large hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to use to make meals for her hotel guests.

loans.name: Mabomba Mengi Group

texts.en:
Maisha Y. is in her early thirties and married with three children who are still in school.  She has been selling cosmetics door to door for five years. She works 8.30am to 11.30am (three hours only) and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Maisha's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a fridge, sell juice, sarongs and cosmetics and paid back all of her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase on the cosmetics stock. Her dream is to one day open a cosmetics shop and a food shop.

Maisha will share this loan with her loan group Mabomba Mengi which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Maisha is the one sitting down infront in pink.

loans.use: To increase her cosmetics stock.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a fifty-three-year-old single mother of two children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has been taking care of her children all by herself and one is through with university while the other one is in senior year six.

For six years she has been selling food in markets.  She started as an employee and later set up her own stall and business has been profitable despite challenges in price fluctuation. Her dream is to own a food store.  Margret wants the money to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Shohidahon's Group

texts.en:
Shohidahon, 30, is a member of this group. In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, her husband went to work in Russia. She has a daughter and a son — both under seven. Shohidahon works as a teacher of English at school. She is also engaged in cattle breeding. To contribute additional money to the family budget, she sells about eight liters of milk every day. In this way she earns an additional 4000 soms per month. This activity helped the family to improve its living conditions. Shohidahon hopes to obtain the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase cattle. In the future she wants to save money for house repair and, of course, she will make efforts to provide her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Thor

texts.en:
Thor, age 37, is a rice farmer. Rice cultivation has been a part of her daily routine for many years. Rice is a critical product vital to the Cambodian people, and she learned her farming skills from her grandmother. She is widely known and trusted in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Noun, is employed as a secondary school teacher in his community, Kompong Cham Province. 

The couple has decided to start a new business whereby Noun will offer motorcycle taxi and transport services in their local community. Thor will therefore be using her loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, so that he can begin to operate a motor taxi service.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, so that he can begin to operate a motor taxi service

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children; three attend school and four are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, Saumu also sells charcoal and firewood as a second source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the low season, she experiences low customer turnout numbers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 57-year-old businesswoman and local farmer in the Baray district. She and her husband have owned and operated their retail business for over two years. They sell many kinds of goods to passersby and other villagers who reside next to their community. The items that they sell are cooking ingredients, shampoo, soft drink, candy, and some essential goods. They always help each other to earn money to meet the financial demands of the family. From this business they can earn net income of about US$5 per day.  

This couple have a good attitude and they are always forming relationships with their neighbors so that they attract extra clients who come to buy their goods. In order to make their fixed goods retail business successful and to earn more income, Chan would like to apply for loan funds so she can purchase more items such as cooking ingredients, shampoo, soft drink and candy in order to continue selling.

loans.use: to purchase items such as cooking ingredients, shampoo, soft drink and candy to sell.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
This is 55 year old Willy who lives in Bushenyi.  He deals in banana trading and also owns a banana plantation from which he gets bananas.  He sells them within the area of his location and also neighboring villages.  Willy is the father of 10 children and has run his business for 4 years and through his hard work, he has managed to expand the areas of operation; not only in Bushenyi but also up to Kampala which is the biggest market for his business. 

Willy, who is also married, plans to have a bigger banana plantation so that he can have a steady supply of bananas to meet the ready market in the Capital city Kampala.  His dream is to expand his business in terms of scale to enable him to have more profits and lift the living standards of the family through educating his children.  He plans to use Kiva loan buy more bananas for resale .

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Ines Milagros

texts.en:
Ines Milagros is 33 years old and married with three children. She rents a small stand in a market in which she sells different kinds of pastries such as sweet breads and small cakes. Her specialty is arroz con leche (a rice pudding) which she also sells at her stand.

Ines Milagros is asking for a loan so that she may buy more ingredients to make pastries. Specifically, she plans to purchase sugar, flour, and oil. She works everyday from 6am to 6pm selling her pastries. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and oil to make pastries

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.en:
Jose lives in Choluteca, Honduras, with his wife and two children. For the past seven years, he has run a small restaurant near the border with El Salvador where he prepares and sells local fare. His two sons attend school during the day and help their father run the business in their spare time. 

Jose is requesting a 10,000 HNL loan to purchase chicken, pork, beef, rice, beans, plantains, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, onions and condiments that he will use to prepare and sell food.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare and sell food

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is a father of four children whose wife is a farmer. He has been doing farming for the past five years. He has been doing this farming for the past 10 years. He was taught on how to grow rice by his cooperative. 

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities. 

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farm.

loans.name: Tendwan

texts.en:
Tendwan is 37 years old. He is married and the father of five children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 11 years.  

He learned about KADET LTD from the KADET staff during their marketing. This will be his first loan and he is planning to buy more sheep and farm inputs. The business has proven to be doing well in the area due to conducive climactic conditions. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to expand the business. His hope and dream is to become a prominent businessman in livestock and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and farm inputs.

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “DOS DE MAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio es el Sr. Javier; el socio a nacido en el año de 1975 y es conviviente, el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio es auxiliar de desarrollo económico, el socio también tiene su tienda de alquiler de equipo para camping y viajes  como treeking, tours; el socio desea invertir en la compra de carpas, sleeping, zapatillas para trek; el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo para camping.
Los otros socios trabajan en diferentes actividades como fotografía, comercio minorista,  venta de ropa, venta de productos de salud entre otros.
El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Javier belongs to the 'Dos de Mayo' community bank which is located in Huanchac community, in Cusco province and department.  Javier was born in 1975 and lives with his partner.  He has two children.  Javier is a financial development assistant.  He also has a store where he rents out equipment for camping, trekking and tours.  He would like to invest this money in buying tents, sleeping bags and trekking shoes.  He is requesting this loan to invest in buying camping equipment.

The other members of this group work in different businesses such as photography, retail sales, clothes sales, health product sales, etc.  Javier is grateful for the support he is being given and so pledges to make his loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying camping equipment

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 49 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children. For the past 4 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her mini-supermarket, which sells food supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for her family. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to build another supermarket in town. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food items

loans.name: Isaul Antonio

texts.es:
Don Isaul tiene la edad de 34 años, casado, padre de un hijo, de cinco años, contando con el apoyo de su esposa ya que labora como cajera. El trabajo de Isaul es como cadete, de taxi, con cinco años de experiencia, con dias buenos, en donde abordan mucho pasajero, y otros que solo saca el recorrido de la gasolina.
Su objetivo es la construccion de un cuarto de concreto, ya que actualmente su pequeña casa es de zinc, y con muchas dificultades en los tiempos llovioso, y que quiere poder ofrecer mejor vivienda a su familia.
Comenzara la construccion de un cuarto pequeño, en donde comprara cinco perlines, cinco laminas de zinc, cemento, hierro, bloques, para comenzar la obra, y que gracias al financiamiento en Afodenic se esta haciendo posible.
texts.en:
Isaul is thirty-four years old and married. He has a five year old child and is supported by his wife who works as a cashier. Isaul works as a taxi driver, and has five years of experience. Some days, when many passengers get in, are better than others when he only covers his fuel costs.
His goal is to build a room out of concrete, since currently his little house is made of zinc, which gives him lots of trouble when it rains, and he would like to be able to offer his family a better home.
Thanks to AFodenic financing, to begin the work he will purchase five beams, five sheets of zinc, cement, rebar, and blocks, and he will begin to build a small room,

loans.use: To begin building a room out of concrete to improve the condition of his home.

loans.name: Dashtsermaa

texts.en: Dashtsermaa is requesting a loan to purchase livestock for her parents and also to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and purchase livestock for her parents

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children; one is in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for five years.

Selina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. With her extra income from this loan, she hopes to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim, 51, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Khim sells hand-made brooms, and her husband is a construction worker. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Khim is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to travel to sell the brooms. By doing so, he will generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to travel to sell brooms.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Зариф целеустремленный и трудолюбивый семьянин. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. С этой целью обеспечения семьи он начал заниматься купле- продажей скота и более 30 лет занимается этим делом и имеет богатый опыт. Зариф на данный момент имеет  крупный рогатый скот и 6 голов овец. Зариф запрашивает займ для покупки скота для того, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получать хорошую прибыль для улучшения благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Zarif is a purposeful and hardworking family man. He is married and has two children. He started buying and selling cattle with the purpose to provide for his family more than 30 years ago and has rich experience in this business. At this time Zarif has large horned cattle and six heads of sheep. Zarif is asking for a loan to buy cattle so he can grow his business and make more profit for better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old and a single-mother of a two-year-old. She sells natural medicines and health products. She has been in the business for one year.  She also has an electronic shop where she earns extra income.She works hard in her business so as to provide for her child.

Being a new member of Faulu Kenya, Agnes believes that the company will help her to boost her business because she is able to access business loans easily. Agnes has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy natural medicines and health products.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines and health products.

loans.name: Maria Daysi

texts.es:
Maria,vive con su familia, ella es ama de casa y se dedica a vender antojitos, por el momento esta solicitando un prestamo ya que quiere crecer con el negocio, por esto solicita un préstamo para darle seguimiento y poder continuar ofreciendo sus productos, ella comprara maíz, condimentos, aceite, además para su granja de cerdos, comprara concentrado.
Ella espera realizar una buena inversión, y ser buen cliente como con el préstamo anterior.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her family, is a housewife, and sells snacks.  She is asking for a loan to grow her business, continue it, and offer her products.  She will buy corn, condiments, cooking oil, and feed for her pigs.

She expects this to be a good investment and for her to be a good client as with her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Goran

texts.en:
Goran is a young Iraqi man who is helping to support his family and himself. He is 21 years old and a student who also works hard in a shop that uses raw materials and various metals to create window and doorframes.

With five years experience on the factory lot, he now took a loan of $500 USD from Relief International-Iraq to buy a new heavy-duty electronic cutter machine.

He hopes that with the numerous construction in town, the industry will continue to grow, providing him with a stable income as he continues his studies and supports his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new heavy duty cutter machine.

loans.name: María Dayce

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dayce, tiene 51 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos que es soltero aun vive con ella. El esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa y esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de frutas, legumbres y verduras, se desplaza desde la madrugada a comprar verduras y frutas por los campos cercanos y algunos otros productos en el mercado mayoristas de Portoviejo para luego vender sus productos en su carro por toda la ciudad de Manta, esto lo realiza cinco días a la semanas y viene realizando esta actividad por más de 20 años.

Esta repitiendo el crédito y va a utilizar en  comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres para que su esposo siga con su negocio. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque a través de los créditos ella puede ayudar a su esposo. 

Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tienen está muy deteriorado. Para ellos los créditos son muy importantes ya que es con ellos pueden financiar su negocio y con esto su marido puede llevar el pan diario a su hogar y brindarles una vida digna.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets every two weeks in La Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a canton known for the famous straw hats that are highly regarded both within the country and abroad.

We met Dayce, 51, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five adult children; the youngest one is still single and lives with her.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She is a very good housewife and wife and she’s taking out the loan to help her husband with his business.  He sells fruit, legumes and vegetables.  He heads out at dawn to buy vegetables and fruit from nearby fields and some of the products he buys at the Portoviejo wholesale market to then resell from his car throughout the city of Manta.  He does this five days a week and has been doing it for more than 20 years.

She is repeating the loan and will use it to buy fruit, vegetables and legumes so that her husband can continue in business.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 10 years and likes it because through the loans she’s able to help her husband.

Her dream is to buy another car because the one they have is pretty deteriorated.  For them, the loans are very important because they are able to finance their business with them and her husband is thus able to bring home daily bread and provide them a life with dignity.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Maria; pertenece al banco comunal "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Taray perteneciente a la Provincia de Pisac departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 57 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo vive con el menor de 18 años de edad; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesania la socia tiene su stand asignado tres dias a la seman en el mirador de Tray, en este se consentran las artesanas del lugar regidas por su sindicato y solo vende tres dias de la semana; y de este modo se intercalan las artesanas para que todas puedan tener la misma oportunidad de ofrecer sus ventas. En esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de artesania y de materiales como arcilla, oxidos naturales, pinceles entre otros para la realizacion de sus trabajos.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Taray, which belongs to the province of Pisac, department of Cuzco.   

She is 57 years old and has 5 children. Only the youngest, who is 18, lives with her. She works buying and selling artisanal crafts. She has her stand three days a week in the tourist lookout in Taray. There area artisans are governed by the union and only sell three days a week. That way, all the artisans take turns and all of them have a chance to sell their wares. On this occasion, this member wants to invest the loan in buying artisanal crafts and materials such as clay, natural oxides, brushes and other materials to do her works. 

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying artisanal crafts and materials such as clay, natural oxides and brushes, among other things to do her work.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is a 39-year-old married man. He has six children. He describes himself as innovative. 

He operates a business where he makes jikos (cook stoves) for sale. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy metal sheets, nails and other items to make more jikos for sale. His business goal is to have a big shop within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of jikos.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, nails and other items

loans.name: Freider Danilo

texts.es:
Freider es un joven de 22 años de edad, y padre de una hija. Actualmente trabaja como minero y no le ha sido fácil conseguir nuevas oportunidades de empleo, por esta razón y, con el ideal de generar ingresos por cuenta propia, desea iniciar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes; se anima a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (estanterías y vitrinas) y surtido al por mayor (verduras, granos, pastas, productos de aseo y otros productos de la canasta familiar), esto le dará la posibilidad de iniciar con su idea de negocio, con el cual espera atraer muchos clientes para que conozcan la calidad de sus productos y del servicio que ofrece, pues este último será el factor diferenciador que le hará aumentar poco a poco su clientela y por ende, sus ventas. 

Freider es activo, emprendedor y pujante, día a día está en busca de nuevas posibilidades que le abran las puertas para llegar a progresar y mejorar las condiciones de vida y, así avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es tener un minimercado, reconocido, rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, con el que espera generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo.

loans.use: compra de activos fijos (estanterías y vitrinas) y surtido al por mayor (verduras, granos, pastas, productos de aseo y otros productos de la canasta familiar)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock in the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy a high breed dairy cow

loans.name: Alatupe

texts.en: Alatupe lives in a small Samoan village.  She is married and has six children.  She runs a small banana plantation.   The money she receives from selling 10 – 15 bags of bananas at the local market is the family’s main source of income.  Alatupe would use loan funds to purchase some basic supplies for her plantation to help make the work easier on her hands.

loans.use: Purchase of knives, gloves, and basic supplies

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu Kaba is married with four children. She is forty-two years old and runs a small business selling peppers and peanuts wholesale. Her husband is also a petty trader in Mogburaka town in Sierra Leone.

Fatu has successfully repaid her first loan from SMT, using it to expand her inventory. She is requesting a second loan with the plan of renovating her market stall and increasing her inventory.

loans.use: Renovate her stall in the market and purchase addtional inventory of peppers and peanuts

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael M. Tobal is a tailor specializing in men suits. He started working as a tailor at age 18 and has been working in this field for the past 25 years. He works from home but is an employee of Riojana, a store in Asuncion. He has been working with Riojana for 20 years now. Ismael has four employees who work for him from their own houses. He supplies about 35 suits each week to Riojana. Riojana supplies him with the fabric and Ismael gets paid for his labor per suit.

Ismael, 44, is married and the father of four children who are all studying in school. He is a hard worker and an entrepreneur. He began his micro enterprise as a one-person business, and now has four other people working for him. Without a loan, he would not have been able to hire his employees and expand his production. Now he is able to supply more suits to Riojana than when he first began his job as a tailor.

Ismael is in need of a $200 loan to use as capital to purchase needles, thread and sewing equipment. He hopes to expand his business in the future, possible hiring another employee.

loans.use: Purchase needles, thread, sewing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina R. is 53 years old, and has been married to Pablo Canete for more than 30 years. They have three adult children. Don Pablo is a shoemaker and he also helps his wife with her business. Martina has a small general store where she sells all kinds of basic goods like sugar, flour, beans, rice and other household items like thread, scissors, tape, buttons, etc. Martina began her business in a little shack and today she has a much larger store. She has been working with loans from the Paraguaya foundation since 2003 and is an excellent client. She is requesting a lona to purchase additional merchandise, particularly fruit, sugar, sodas, vegetables, canned goods and meats given that demand increases considerably at the end of the year.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Martina R. tiene 53 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Pablo Cañete desde hace mas de 30 años, tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad.

Don Pablo es zapatero y a la vez ayuda a su esposa a llevar adelante su negocio. Martina tiene una despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como ser azúcar, harina, fideos, arroz y además artículos varios de mercería: hilos, tijeras, cintas, botones, etc.

La señora Martina se inició con una pequeña casillita y hoy día ya cuenta con una mayor infraestructura, trabaja con créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya desde el 2003 y es una clienta excelente.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías especialmente frutas, azúcar, gaseosas, verduras, productos enlatados y carne pues en esta época de fin de año la demanda de estas mercaderías aumenta considerablemente.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, sugar, sodas, vegetables, canned goods and meat.

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en:
Fatuma N. is a 30 year old married mother of 2 girls (ages 5 and 3) who sells charcoal. She wants the loan to begin a fresh food business and construct a stall for her businesses.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To start a fresh food business

loans.name: Nasuti A(I) Group

texts.en:
Selina is 40 years old and married with four children.  She intends to expand her poultry busines and pay school fees for her children with the extra business profits. Farida is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to increase her flock. Grace offers tailoring services and wants to buy a new sewing machine with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the businesses of the group members.

loans.name: Sron

texts.en:
Mrs. Sron C. and her husband, Khorn That, have been married since 2002. They have one son and one daughter, both who are studying in the local school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. C. started her silk weaving in 1990. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband grows rice and weaves silk. He wants to create another business of running horse carts. They hope that their businesses will continue to support their children in school and allow them to build a new house.

Mrs. C. is requesting a loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy a horse for her husband's new business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and a buy a horse for running horse carts.

loans.name: Mariela Cena

texts.es:
Ms. Mariela Cena L. C. is 40 years old, is single and doesn’t have children. Mariela studied to be an elementary school teacher. She is presently working as a teacher at a private school. She also has her own business. She lives in the district of El Provenir in the Province of Trujillo in the department named La Libertad- Peru.

She earns a living selling “ Avon” beauty products. Her friends or acquaintances order her products from “Avon”. She also buys other products that they ask her for and she keeps them in stock to sell them for a higher price. It’s been 5 years since she’s been in this business and it has gone real well. People are always looking for her and even go to her house to place orders.

She is a member of the communal bank “ Mujeres del Buen Pastor” a place where she received her first loan of 300 soles and with this money she bought beauty products: scented shampoos and lip liner.

With the loan of 1000 soles that she will pay back in four months she will buy foot powder, fragrances, facial cream, makeup and jewelry.

Her big dream is to have her own stand in the city of Trujillo, where she will offer all of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señorita Mariela Cena L. C. tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene ningún hijo; ella tiene la carrera de educación primaria, actualmente se encuentra laborando en un colegio particular; además de tener su propio negocio. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad - Perú.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la línea de “avon” le hacen pedidos sus conocidos y vecinos así también compra algunos productos para tener en stock y venderlo a mayor precio. Hace cinco años que se inicio con este negocio en el cual le ha ido muy bien, siempre la buscan en su domicilio para hacer algún pedido.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Buen Pastor” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró algunos productos de belleza: shampoo colonias y lápiz de labio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que lo cancelara en cuatro meses comprara talco de pies, fragancias, crema facial, maquillaje y joyas.

Su mayor sueño es tener un stand en el centro de la ciudad de Trujillo, donde ofrecerá todos sus productos.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa Mariel M. is a 34 year old single mother. She has a 17 year old son that attends the local public school. He also works with his mother, helping with the business. Teresa is very proud of her son and says that he has been a blessing in her life because even though she did not get any support from his father, her son has taken care of her and has helped her since he was very young. He is her companion and her strength to continue working hard.
