Teresa owns a house with all the comforts that are necessary in a home. She is also a brilliant micro entrepreneur, owner of a small grocery store located in the Barrio Las Mercedes. It's been two years since she decided to open her store. She sells basic products used in everyday life such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, canned goods, dairy products, sodas, etc. Teresa has a lot of customers because her store is well stocked and her products attractively displayed in freezers, refrigerated stands, among others.

The loan she is requesting in the amount of Gs 2.000.000 will be sued to purchase merchandise such as flour, cooking oil, herbs, etc. She agrees to pay the loan in 11 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Teresa Mariel M. de 34 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo de de 17 años que estudia en el colegio Nacional de la zona y trabaja con en ella ayudándola en su la despensa, Teresa nos cuenta muy orgullosa que su hijo a sido una bendición muy grande en su vida, ya que aún cuando no contó con el apoyo del padre su hijo la ha cuidado y ayudado desde muy pequeño, el es su compañía y su fuerza para seguir luchando.

Teresa posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar. Teresa además es una brillante microempresaria, propietaria de una despensa ubicada en el Barrio Las Mercedes y ya van 2 años desde que decidió abrir su negocio. En su despensa ella comercializa productos de primera necesidad para el consumo como arroz, azúcar, aceite, harina, productos enlatados, lácteos, gaseosas, etc. El buen equipamiento de su despensa le permite contar con buena clientela ya que su productos están bien exhibidos en heladeras con exhibidor, frizers, entre otros.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es de Gs 2.000.000 para la compra de mercaderías de harina, aceite, arroz, yerba, y otros que se compromete a pagar en 11 cuotas mensuales.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables, fruits, beef, rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, canned goods, dairy products, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is 59 years of age and his family is composed of his four children, his two parents and his wife who has a small business selling food. Currently his children are in school, all of whom are his dependents. Francisco has a stand in the 2nd of February Market where he sells car parts. He has 20 years of experience in this field and he also acts as a wholesale distributor bringing his car parts to the Chapare region to sell them. His success is based on the effort that he puts into his work and also the location of his business in a highly frequented location. At the same time he receives help from his children who collaborate in an unconditional way. With the following application he will acquire wheel bearings that cost USD$400 per box and other lower quality wheel bearings with a value of USD$250 a box. His credit history is acceptable and all of his previous loans have been paid off.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco tiene 59 años de edad, su familia está conformada por sus cuatro hijos, sus dos padres y su esposa que atiende una pequeña venta de comidas. Actualmente sus hijos siguen estudiando, todos depende de él. Francisco tiene una caseta comercial en el mercado 2 de febrero donde tiene su venta de repuestos, tiene una experiencia en el rubro de aproximadamente 20 años, además también actua como mayorista ya que lleva sus repuestos hasta el Chapare para poder venderlos. Su exito se basa en el empeño que pone en su trabajo y también de la ubicación de su negocio que es un lugar muy frecuentado por la gente. Paralelamente recibe mucha ayuda de sus hijos quienes colaboran de manera incondicional. Con la presente solcitud adquirirá rodamientos que cuestan $us. 400.- la caja y otros rodamientos de menor calidad que tiene un valor de $us. 250.- la caja. El historial crediticio es aceptable si bien tuvieron algnos problemas con créditos anteriores siempre cancelaron los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Rahaj Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Rashid K. is the group leader of Rahj Enterprise. Rahj Enterprise has five members but the other three members are busy on their farms. Rashid is 49 years old and married with 4 children. He sells a few bags of cement and soft drinks. With his previous loan, he diversified the business and would like to expand it. He is therefore requesting a loan to purchase more crates of soft drinks.

Mohamed is a carpenter and also sells timber. He needs more capital to increase his stock of timber. Their businesses are the sole source of income for their families and their aim is to generate income to send their children to college.

loans.use: Purchase timber, soft drinks and bags of cement

loans.name: Rose Nansubuga's Group

texts.en:
Rose N., a midwife and the leader of a group of four women, is 45 years old and married with seven children ranging in age from 18 to 30. The two youngest children are in school while the five oldest work. Rose lives in an urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

As the owner of her hospital facility, Rose has been offering her midwife services since 1994, working seven days a week. She sees approximately 10 women each week and has many repeat customers because, as she says, she treats each woman very well. With this loan Rose plans on buying medicine for her patients from pharmacies in Kampala.

Rose has repaid 12 loans since she began working with MCDT. With these loans she has been able to develop her business, buy a house, build houses that she rents out and pay school fees. Rose hopes to be able to continue running her business and one day see all of her children get jobs. .

loans.use: To purchase medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Edem

texts.fr: Edem G. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse, depuis plus de 3 ans, des produits génériques à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère avec ce crédit, accroître la taille de son activité en commandant beaucoup plus de marchandises pour satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Edem G. is 38 years old, married, and mother of three children. For more than three years she has been a retailer of generic medical products in Womé, a village situated about 130 kilometers away from Lomé, which is the capital of Togo. With this loan she hopes to increase the size of her business by ordering much more merchandise so she can keep up with customer demand.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for retail

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.es: La señora Anabelle habita en el barrio Hialia III etapa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene la edad de 43  años, se encuentra casada con el señor Roberto chavarria de 48 años de edad, el es técnico eléctrico y sastre trabaja por su cuenta  propia, donde también apoya a su esposa en los gastos de la casa; ambos tienen 3 hijos de 7, 6 y 2 años de edad que están estudiando. Actualmente doña Anabelle se desempeña  como costurera y trabaja en el negocio de costura  de la señora Claudia Ordóñez hace 4 años, así mismo la Sra. Anabelle desea establecer su propio taller y trabajarlo con su marido, por tanto solicita la cantidad de C$ 8, 000 a 9 meses, para la compra de materia prima y de maquinas de coser y de esta forma poder establecer su propio negocio y a la vez ayudar a la buena educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Anabelle lives in the Hialeah III neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is 43 years old and married to Robert Chavarria who is 48 years old. Roberto is an electrical technician and a tailor. He shares the household expenses with his wife. They have 3 children, 7, 6 and 2 years old, who are in school. Anabelle now works as a seamstress in a shop owned by Claudia Ordonez, something she's been doing for 4 years. She would like to set up her own workshop and operate it with her husband. She's applying for a C$8,000 loan, for 9 months, to buy basic materials and sewing machines so that she can set up her own business and, at the same time, help her children get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic materials and sewing machines for tailoring business.

loans.name: Gulustan

texts.en: Gulustan (her son is pictured) was born in 1968. She is the mother of three children. She lives in Khachmaz region, in the Gusarchay village. Eight years ago, she started a cattle breeding business. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy a cow and a calf for improving her cattle breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a calf

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba A. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She first applied when she decided to increase her existing business. Thanks to the previous loans, she was able to increase business turnover and open a cosmetics business. Mrs. A. works directly with the suppliers, so she can sell at lower prices and therefore have repeat customers. She has a good assortment (creams, shampoo, soaps, toilet water, perfume, etc). Mrs. A. is requesting a business development loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Olataga

texts.en: Olataga F., 26, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years' experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Olataga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase chemicals, sacks of fertilizer, and bush knives.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, a plant sprayer, fertilizer, and bush knives

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Amer has been working as a mason for eight years. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and wood for his business. This is the first time that Amer has requested a loan.

Amer is special in his work because he does it well and he is honest with his clients. His clients can be anybody from his area and the surrounding villages. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital needed. In the future, Amer plans to expand his business by increasing his clients.

loans.use: Amer will use the loan to purchase tools and wood for his business.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en: Roberta B. is 45 years of age and a mother of 5. She is married to Paolo B. and lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. She is a hard working mother who finds many ways to earn money for the family. Early in the morning, she cooks puto, suman biko (Filipino native foods) and peddles them through neighborhoods and nearby villages. She then goes to the river, under the heat of the sun, and mines for gold dust using the traditional system; a bilinganan (Philipino mining tool) and shovel. This request will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI, in the amount of PHP 11, 000.00 to finance the buying gold mining tools and additional capital for her peddling business. She eventually would like to stop in her mining work so that she can take care of her children and be able to send them to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making Philippino native food for sale and to buy gold mining tools

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es: Yrma es una mujer muy laboriosa y comprometida con su trabajo y con su familia, pues es madre de tres hijos y junto a su esposo adquirieron una cada donde viven y trabajan al mismo tiempo. En el pasado, su papel de joven madre la limitó a realizar algunas actividades, pero encontró la manera de romper los límites e instaló en su casa un restaurante, donde toda la familia trabaja desde hace 20 años y no tuvo que descuidar la atención de sus hijos, por el contrario, ellos fueron de gran apoyo, logrando juntos, que su negocio sea uno de los más concurridos en su distrito. Además, lo que atrajo a las personas a este restaurante fue la deliciosa sazón de Yrma, y gracias a la demanda pudieron mejorar y ampliar su local, el cual por el pasar de los años se ha ido deteriorando y necesita remodelaciones, pues desea tener un restaurante reconocido y prestigioso, y para conseguirlo requiere de mucha inversión pues las remodelaciones son muy costosas. El iniciar este crédito con MFP la está ayudando a hacer sus deseos realidad, y espera que con el trascurrir de los años pueda ser una cliente permanente. Yrma tiene proyectado invertir 3000 soles en la reparación del techo de su local, pues su mal estado perjudica el adecuado servicio y ambiente que sus clientes merecen.
texts.en:
Yrma is a hardworking woman and very dedicated to her work and to her family. She is mother of 3 children and together with her husband they acquired a home where they live and work at the same time. In the past, her life as a young mother limited from her activities, but she soon found a way to break through those limits and set up her home inside of a restaurant, where the family has been working for the past 20 years. She didn't have to leave her children, but quite the opposite, they were of great support to her, together working to make their business one of the best in their district. In addition, what was most attracted customers to this restaurant was Yrmas delicious cooking, and thanks to the great demand they were able to improve and expand their business. But with the passage of time it has been deteriorating and needs renovations. She dreams of having a restaurant that is well known and prestigious, and to attain that dream she needs significant investments, given that renovations are so costly. She contacted MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and they are helping her to make her dreams a reality and she hopes that with the passing years she will be a permanent client. Yrma has planned to invest 3000 soles in the roof renovations of her business. The poor state of the roof impedes adequate service and the ambiance that her clients deserve.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her restaurant's roof.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro M. tiene 42 años de edad, está casado con  Elsa Franco. Ellos tienen 2 hijos, de 4 y 6 años de edad.

El nos contó que desde muy joven, había viajado a la Argentina, en busca de un puesto de trabajo. Por suerte  el  empezó a trabajar en una carpintería y ahí  aprendió este oficio. Luego de varios años de trabajo, el regreso a su país. Con el ingreso que obtuvo en la Argentina, pudo comprar las herramientas necesaria para poder montar su propia carpintería, y así trabajar en forma independiente. Con la ayuda de su señora, pudieron mejorar su nivel de vida y solventar los gastos de la casa y el estudio de su hijo.
   
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de madera y una máquina Cepilladora, de modo que pueda aumentar su producción y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro M. is 42 years old and is married to Elsa Franco. They have two chidren, 4 and 6 years old.

He told us that ever since he was very young, he would travel to Argentina in search of a job. Fortunately, he began to work in a carpenter's shop and there he learned this trade. After several years working, he returned to his own country. With the earnings he got in Argentina, he was able to buy the tools necessary to be able to set up his own carpenter's shop, and in this way work independently. With the help of his wife, they were able to improve their standard of living and to pay for their household expenses and for their son's studies.

The loan sought is for the purchase of wood and a planing machine, so that he will be able to increase production and satisfy the needs of his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and a planing machine

loans.name: Adaeze

texts.en:
Adaeze is 42 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She is standing close to her husband in the picture. 

Adaeze has a store where she sells medicine. She has requested and hopes to get a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She is an active LAPO client. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Nora's Group

texts.en:
Paglaum MPC serves in communities for the purpose of elevating or uplifting members from poverty. One of the great programs which really helps members is the PDP-LP Program, and one of the thousands of members is Mrs. Nora P.. She is a 37-year-old who is married and blessed with three children studying in elementary school. She libes in Barangay Magsaysay, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She started her membership three years ago, on January 31, 2006.

She is now in her seventh loan cycle to purchase sacks of fertilizers and pesticides and pay for the laborer who cultivates their rice field together with her husband. Finally, she is very happy managing their rice field which is one of their sources of income for their daily needs. She is very thankful that Paglaum MPC loaned her money that gives a big help for their daily life.

loans.use: Additonal capital

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Акрамова Шоира – женщина 36-ти лет, замужем имеет 3-х детей. Более 5-лет она вместе со своим мужем  занимается производством и продажей шашлыка и других национальных блюд. Её торговая точка расположена  у входа на Вещевой рынок Спитаменского района и поэтому торговля у нее идет хорошо. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть еще одну точку продажи в центре района.  Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход. Шоира благодарна нашим партнёрам по КИВЕ за оказанную ей подержку в развитии её бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shoira A. is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. Together with her husband, she is involved in making and selling kabobs and other traditional dishes. They have been in this business over 5 years. Because Shoira’s retail outlet is located at the entrance of the clothing market in the Spitamen district, her sales are high. She wants to expand her business and open one more retail outlet in the district center. This will increase her family income. Shoira is grateful to our partners at Kiva for supporting her business development.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Opening another store

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C., age 37, and her husband, Mr. Saphai Morm, age 42, have been married since 1991. They have five children, four sons and one daughter. Four of their children are studying in a local school, and the youngest one stays at home. Sopheap and her family live along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sopheap has been weaving cotton scarves since 1985. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products in Olympic market, located in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a teacher. She has set up three looms under her house. Sopheap is able to only use one loom because she doesn’t have enough capital to purchase cotton threads. Now Sopheap is requesting second loan of $1,000 in order to purchase cotton thread materials for her three looms.

loans.use: To purchase cotton threads for her scarf weaving business.

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda U. is 68 years old and married with three adult children. She is a retired employee and pensioner and presently lives at Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is a very industrious woman who raises hogs with her husband.

She is requesting Php 10,000 from Paglaum MPC to bU. hog feed and vitamins. She hopes deeply to own a bigger concrete piggery someday and become a successful hog supplier to the market.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her piglets.

loans.name: Mala Jan

texts.en:
Mala J., son of A. J., has much experience in agriculture having started his business 10 years ago, and it is still going very well. He is not alone; one of his sons works with him. Sometimes other members of his family help as well. He is 45 years old, married and has four children. He lives in Jalalabad, Nangarhar province.

Mala J. has repaid his first loan, and it was very useful to him. Now he wants to take out a second loan of 50,000 AFN to buy seeds and other necessary things for his business. He wants to make his business bigger and to stand on his own feet in the future.

Mala J. is happy with the process of loans in Afghanistan. He hopes to help better his family's situation and make a better future for them. He wishes to grow his business in Jalalabad and open many shops in the next few years. He would like to thank both Kiva and Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company (AFS) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Paul Kahungo

texts.en:
Paul K. is 31 years old. He is married to Naomi Wambui and they have two children.

For the last three years, he has been employed carrying passengers with a motorbike in Gilgil town. He has also been running a grocery store on the side.

A friend introduced him to KADET, where he has applied for a loan to buy his own motorcycle. This will make him self employed and more financially secure.

Paul's vision is to prosper in the transport business by having a fleet of public transport vans and to create employment for others.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purshase a motorbike

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 42 years old and a trader. She is married with five children. Elizabeth owns and operates a grocery store, selling items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of a different variety, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods at her store

loans.name: Clara Elena

texts.es:
Clara tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el pueblo joven José Olaya, en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años tiene un negocio de alquiler de servicio de Internet (Internet café) funcionando en una habitación de su casa, además dentro de este establecimiento tiene  un Play Station que también alquila por horas y una pequeña bodega – tienda de golosinas que eventualmente vende a las personas que vienen a usar su servicio.

La idea de este negocio nació de la necesidad que tienen los estudiantes de su barrio del servicio de Internet para realizar sus trabajos escolares, la situación económica de las familias de la zona les impide contar con este servicio en su domicilio por lo que acuden con regularidad a su establecimiento.

Ella desea comprar una anilladora de papel, darle mantenimiento a sus computadoras y también poner un mobiliario especialmente diseñado para este tipo de negocio ya que el que tiene no es el adecuado, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar para el logro de su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar su negocio con la compra de una fotocopiadora para así seguir apoyando a la economía de su hogar y, a futuro, brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.

Es la segunda vez que Clara trabaja con nosotros y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old, is married and lives with her husband and 3 children in the town José Olaya, in the city of Chiclayo.

For two years she has had an internet cafe in a room in her house, as well as a PlayStation that she also rents and a small grocery store— she sells candy to the people who use her services.

The idea of this business came from the needs of the students in the neighborhood as they need to use the internet to do their schoolwork. Since the economic condition of the families in the area does not allow them to have this service in their homes, many students visit her cafe frequently.

She wants to buy a paper ring binding machine, give maintenance to her computers and to buy some new furniture designed for the internet cafe since what she has is not suitable. This is the reason for her loan request for 1500 soles.

Her greatest wish is to expand her business by buying a photocopier to continue supporting her home and in the future, to provide her children with a quality education.

This is the second time that Clara has received a loan from Kiva’s field partner and has shown to be punctual and responsible in her payments, thus, she is regarded as a good customer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed K., Balu B. and Sinneh T.. They named their group “Together as One”. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in quality and quantity. Consequently, sales and profit will improve for these entrepreneurs and they will be in a better position to look after their families in terms of meeting their educational, nutritional and medical needs.

Mohamed K., on the left, is the leader of this group. He was born in Magburaka forty years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children who are attending primary and junior secondary schools.

Mohamed is a tailor and he has been in this profession for about three years now. He will use this loan to buy fabrics and other sewing materials. He will sew the fabrics into clothes and sell them to people within Magburaka town and sometimes in the villages around Magburaka town.

On the right of the group photo is a photo of Balu B. who was not present for the group photo session).

loans.use: To buy fabrics and other sewing materials

loans.name: Idemudia

texts.en: I. is 48 years old and she is married with 5 children. She sells frozen food and has been in the business for more than 17 years.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more frozen food. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Yenina Lidia

texts.es:
La señora  YENINA LIDIA A. Y., tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS AURORAS EN ACCION II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria. Yenina tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella.
La socia se dedica a la compra y venta  de cosméticos que vende a sus amistades y trabajadoras de las empresas cercanas. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró productos de belleza como: labiales, perfumes, talcos, polvos, etc.
Con este crédito de 1,200  nuevos soles también volverá a comprar productos de belleza como: labiales, cremas, rubores, maquillaje, labiales, etc. y también comprara una vitrina para exhibir sus productos
Yenina   sueña con aumentar sus ventas y tener un stand en un centro comercial para así poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Yenina Lidia is 24 years old and lives in the district of Salaverry, in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad Peru. She is a member of the communal bank Las Auroras en Accion and studied up until secondary school. Yenina needs to take care of her young son. She runs a business buying and selling cosmetics to her friends as well as to the women who work in nearby businesses. With her first loan, she purchased lipsticks, perfumes, powders and other products. With this new loan, she will buy beauty products such as creams and make up. She will also purchase a display case to better display the merchandise she sells. Yenina's dream is to grow her business and have a stand in the central market, where she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her business, as well as a display case to better display merchandise

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es una señora que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 7 años, su esposo y la señora ya son mayores pero aun así quiere seguir trabajado para sentirse útiles para no depender de sus hijos. En su local tiene ropa de todas tallas, bolsas, calcetines y juguetes. Como ya se viene la temporada de navidad ella quiere surtir su negocio para estar bien preparada para la época y así obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
For the past 7 years, Guadalupe has sold second-hand clothing. She and her husband are seniors but, nevertheless, she wants to continue to work to feel useful and not depend on her children. In her site, she has clothes of all sizes, purses, socks and toys. As the Christmas season is approaching, she wants to stock her store to be well-prepared for the season and thus get better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en: Catalino M. has his own house and is engaged in the production and sale of bedspreads and hammocks, having been a merchant in Asuncion for several years prior. Catalino has been a client of the Fundacion Paraguaya since 2002, has taken out several loans and has paid back all of them on time. This year, he needs a loan to buy yarn and raw material for the production of bedsheets and hammocks.

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Fania

texts.en: Fania J. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase plastic tables and chairs in order to seat more customers. Fania is 25 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big hotel. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase plastic tables and chairs to seat more customers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of living of Norma, 55. She owns a rice field in South Cotabato that is 3 hectares wide. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to fill the needs of her rice field. She needs to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

Norma is the mother of 3 children. She is married to Benito. Together they work hard to sustain their farm and family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Leonel Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Leonel Ernesto M. Chavarría, tiene la edad de 26 años, labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado  Iván  Montenegro de Managua.
El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno se encuentra  en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 6 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de cemento para la construcción de una pared ya que era lo único que le hacia falta para construir, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Leonel Ernesto M. Chavarría is 26 years old and works as a custodian in the Iván Montenegro market in Managua. He cares for his two children, one of whom is school aged. He is married, and has worked with Kiva partner CEPRODEL loans over the last five years. In this time he has received six loans to invest in the house in which he lives, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The requested loan is to purchase cement for the construction of the last wall needed in Leonel's house. The wall will afford better security and living conditions to his children and wife.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela S. is 60 years old. She is a food vendor and, at the same time, sells fish in their village. She started her business in 2007 and desires to augment her income by increasing the size of her sales. Her husband is a fisherman. Both of them work together for their family. She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more fish to resell.

loans.use: To obtain fish to resell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet has a good relationship with LAPO. She renders catering services to people in her community. She also rents plates, spoons, coolers, and forks to people that have various occasions to entertain their guests. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is always happy when she is rendering her catering services. She is a widow with seven children. Income from this business enables her to sponsor her children’s education and feeding. Janet is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more plates, pots and serving spoons. Janet is 67 years old and she lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plates, pots and serving spoons

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Raquel es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Raquel vende ropa y loceria variada a pedido,  productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito.
Raquel necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mochilas y ropa.
Los sueños de Raquel son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter. Raquel sells clothing and various types of china upon request. Her products are offered to friends and relatives, and the majority of her sales are made on credit.

She needs a loan of 1600 PEN in order to buy backpacks and clothing. Raquel dreams of building a house and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase backpacks & clothing

loans.name: Iris Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Iris Consuelo V. V., tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es costurera, y madre soltera de una hija que estudia para ser enfermera, ella elabora prendas de vestir y las vende en el Mercado Oriental.

Ella solicita de un prestamo para la compra de materiales de constrcccion con el objetivo de remodelar del porche de su vivienda, esto le permitira mejores comodidades en su hogar y la satisfacción personal de ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida para su hija, dentro de los planes a largo plazo, esta la apertura de una boutique de ropa, esto con el fin de competir en el mercado de ropa usada, que se le ha venido dando a lo largo de dos años para la fecha.
texts.en:
Iris Consuela V. V., 46, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is a seamstress and a single mother of a daughter who is studying to be a nurse. She makes garments and sells them at the Eastern Market.

Iris is requesting a loan to buy construction materials with the goal of remodeling her porch. This will make her house more comfortable and increase her personal satisfaction by being able to provide better living conditions for her daughter. Her plans in the long term are to open a clothing boutique so that she may better compete in the used clothing market, which she has been doing for the past two years to date.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy construction materials to fix her house's porch

loans.name: Sol

texts.en: Sol T. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Sol owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Sol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sol is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 7th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marcilina Banchua Group

texts.en:
Marcilina U B. is from the village of Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Marcilina U is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marcilina U is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcilina U owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Marcilina U has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marcilina U joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Marcilina U has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Marcilina U is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marcilina U from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Felipe's Group

texts.en: Felipe A. is from the village of Imurong, Baggao, Cagayan. He is 52 years old and is the group leader of this twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Felipe is married and has five adult children. He owns and operates a business providing transportation services in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Felipe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. Felipe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Flora Isabel

texts.es:
L a señora Flora es una de las socia que lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército en la bella capital manabita.

La señora Flora es fundadora de este banco comunal y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos obtenidos, es ama de casa y el crédito que solicita es para ayudar al esposo es su trabajo Y en el mantenimiento de su volqueta, el trabaja en fletes de arena, piedras a diferentes ciudades del país, tiene que invertir 20 dólares diario y trabaja toda la semana y además de pagarle a las personas que trabajan con el y cubrir los gastos de alimentación.
 
Cuenta nuestra socia que en los actúales  momentos el esposo no se ha sentido nada bien de salud y son sus hijos los que le ayudan a trabajar, es muy rentable el negocio, a diario le salen de dos a tres fletes y por cada salida cobra 40 dólares.
 
Las volquetas son de el, ellos trabajan solo en la ciudad de Portoviejo hacen fletes de piedras, arena, solo trabajan cuando lo contratan, invierten por semana 20 diarios, aparte del mantenimiento de la volqueta;  en cada flete cobra 40 y cuando es arena 20 dólares.

 Su sueño es poder ayudarle a su nieta para que tenga su negocio de ropa
texts.en:
Señora Flora has been a member for 4 cycles of the communal bank Av. Del Ejército in the beautiful capital Manabita. Señora Flora is the founder of this communal bank, and she has been very satisfied with the loans she has obtained. She is a homemaker and the loan she is requesting is to help her husband in his work and in the maintenance of his dump truck. He works for hire hauling sand and rocks to different cities in the country. This costs him $20 per day and he works all week long, as well as paying the people who work with him and covering the food expenses. Our member tells us that recently her husband has not felt well in his health, and his sons are helping him with his work. The business is very profitable, they haul two or three loads in a day and each load is charged $40. The trucks belong to him, they are working alone in the city of Portoviejo hauling stones and sand. They only work when they have a contract, his expenses are $20 per day, apart from the maintenance of the truck. Each haul pays $40, or if it is sand, $20. Her dream is to be able to help her granddaughter to have her own clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mr. Sothea L. is 40 years old and is a villager who lives in Preal village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice for a living. His wife, Mrs. Phoeung Sen, is a petroleum seller in the local village.

To support his wife's business, Mr. Sothea L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more gasoline. With this loan he hopes to increase their income and improve their family's living standard.

The couple has five children; one is a coffee seller, three are students in the local school and assist their parent's businesses, and the youngest is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka area of Uganda. She is married and has two children. Annet has a business managing a retail store in Kyotera, which sells various small goods. Despite her young age, Annet has had her retail business for about four years.

To expand her business, Annet is requesting a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy goods to resell and expand her shop’s inventory. Annet hopes to expand her business and sell more of her inventory, generating profits to help support her family.

Note to lenders

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan.

The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: More inventory for retail shop

loans.name: Angel Humberto

texts.es:
Ángel de 30 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), El vende legumbres con su esposa desde que llego de la sierra a Guayaquil. 

Con su hija de 7 años ellos llegaron a Guayaquil en busca de mas oportunidades, comenzaron a vender legumbres en las afuera de su casa, poco a poco con su esposa empezaron a tener ingresos para mantenerse en Guayaquil, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabajan desde las 08h00am hasta 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere readecuar su casa para darle una mejor vida a su familia, quiere comprar cemento, bloques, pinturas. En el futuro quiere tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Ángel, 30, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a periurban zone with unpaved streets and eroding hillsides). He and his wife have been vegetable merchants since they moved to the city from the Guayaquil mountains. They arrived in Guayaquil with their 7-year-old daughter looking for more opportunities. They started selling vegetables in front of their house and little by little started to earn enough income to support themselves in Guayaquil. Since those days they work from 8am until 10pm. He will use the funds to make some home improvements in order to provide his family with a better quality of life. He wants to buy cement, cinder blocks and paint. In the future, he’d like to have a store of his own.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Carlos Hernan

texts.es:
Carlos Hernan V. V., tiene 26 años.  Es soltero y vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Carlos es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Carlos se dedica a la ganadería, cría vacas. Realiza sus compras cada semana en Echeandia y vende las vacas en Ventanas.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de más ganado. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para comprar un vehiculo para transportar el ganado. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero.

Le gusta jugar fútbol.
texts.en:
Carlos Hernan V. V. is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. He does not have children. Carlos is a member of the "Y" solidarity group, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members altogether, who mainly work in agriculture. This is the first loan they have taken out with Cooperativa San José. Carlos raises cows. He makes his purchases every week in Echeandia and sells the cows in Ventanas. He is asking for the loan to invest in buying more cattle. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have money to buy a vehicle for transporting the cattle. A challenge he faces is lack of money. He likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle purchases

loans.name: Izaias Ezequiel

texts.es:
El señor Izasis A. R. labora para la asociación  futuro de la niñez (afunic) como instructor en los talleres brindando enseñanza a la juventud.
Es divorciado tiene tres hijos a su cargo en edad escolar.
Los créditos que ha obtenido en CEPRODEL han sido de gran impacto en su familia ya que con el primer crédito, realizo reparaciones en su hogar, el segundo fue utilizado para resolver asuntos de pagos de aranceles escolares y el tercero es el ultimo obtenido este será de gran utilidad ya que actualmente necesita realizar exámenes de la vista y compra de lentes.
texts.en:
Izasis A. R. works for the Association for the Future of Children (Afunic) as an instructor in youth workshops. He is divorced and cares for three school-aged children. The loans that he has obtained through CEPRODEL have had a huge impact on his family. With his first loan he was able to make some repairs on his home and with the second loan he paid off outstanding school fees. He will be able to make good use of this third loan as he needs to have an eye examination and purchase a pair of glasses.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use, eye examination and purchase of glasses

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Mariana is the coordinator of her group Dios es mi Pastor (God is my Pastor) 1 & 2. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to see to her children, both adult and married. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying resting at home.

Mariana has been in business for three years, starting with some savings. She is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. Mariana plans to use this loan to buy different products to sell like cosmetics, beauty products, clothing, shoes and other items. She will use the profits to invest in her business, which she wants to improve.

Mariana began her association with Esperanza because she needed to improve her business. Her story is generally representative of those in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of the former having recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry. The area’s main economic activity is a free trade zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and clothing

loans.name: Ruth Marineli

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por su clima cálido y  agradable encontramos el Banco Comunal Los Jazmines  que se reúnen cada quince días en esta linda ciudad.

La señora Ruth esta en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y desde hace cinco ciclos es la presidenta del Banco y está muy contenta por los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir con todas las socias. Está casada y tiene un hijo que  es mayor de edad, el esposo es maestro.
 
Se dedica al comercio de ropa interior, nos cuenta que antes vendía joyería de plata, pero que después ya no le gusto trabajar con eso por lo que decidió vender ropa interior y camisetas de hombres. Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas cuando tiene que entregar su mercadería, tiene muchos clientes ya que los  productos que ella vende son importados. Por eso ella viaja a Colombia una vez por mes aunque a veces compra en Quito. Todo lo que compra es para entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a  emplear en comprar más mercadería  para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
 
Su meta es comprar un carro que le sirva de transporte
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for its warm and agreeable climate, we find the communal bank "Los Jazmines," which meets every 15 days in this attractive city. Ruth has been in the communal bank for 5 years, and for the past five loan cycles, she has been the bank's president. She is very happy about the benefits provided by the Espoir Foundation to all of the members. She is married and has a grown son; her husband is a teacher. Her work is selling undergarments; she tells us that she previously sold silver jewelry, but she later found that she didn't enjoy this work, so she decided to sell undergarments and men's t-shirts. She works every day for two or three hours, when she has to deliver her merchandise. She has many customers, since the products she sells are imported. To obtain them, she travels to Colombia once a month, although she also sometimes makes purchases in Quito. Everything she buys is for delivery to customers. She will use the funds from this new loan to buy more merchandise to fill her customers' current orders. Her goal is to buy a car that will help her with transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying undergarments and men's t-shirts

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey T. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 24 years old. Joey is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joey owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joey has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.
 
In 2009, Joey joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Joey is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Joey from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Josefa Maritza

texts.es: La señora Josefa tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Ella tiene el negocio de venta de carne localizada en el mercado loval. Tiene 21 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Pues sus inicios se dan por la falta de generar ingresos a su hogar, siempre ha sido muy responsable con sus cuotas, pues no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento. Ella ofrece un buen servicio y está muy contenta con este medio de vida. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de insumos de carne.
texts.en: 54 year old Josefa is married and has one child in her care. She runs a butchers in the local market. She has been running this business for 21 years.  She started the business to generate income for the household. She has always been very responsible about her repayments, and this is not the first loan that she has received. She offers a good service and is very happy with her way of life. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies of meat.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea M., age 38, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards and beds. Her husband helps her to sell the finished products that they either weave or buy in bulk from other weavers. This couple has been married for many years, but they have only one child. This family’s living conditions are not so good because their house is damaged because of heavy wind. To solve the problem, Chea M. requested a loan to purchase a piece of wood for mending her house.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of wood to mend her house.

loans.name: Perlyn

texts.en:
Perlyn P. sells vegetables, a business she finds very productive. She learned the business from experience and using her own initiative in dealing with costumers. The proceeds of her business are a big help to the family, especially in meeting the basic needs of her family, allowing them to enjoy life in a simple way.

Perlyn is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP from Kiva partner, ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.). She will use the loan to buy more vegetables. Having additional inventory will give her family additional income and will allow her to expand her business.

Perlyn is determined to improve her business venture as well as the life of her family. Knowing that she can access financial support through loans has given her courage and faith that someday her only son will graduate from college and be ready to face his own life. Perlyn also aspires to build a beautiful home to live in. She is hoping that with ASHI and Kiva’s support there is a possibility that her family can fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy materials to be used to prepare hot dogs and hamburgers

loans.name: Rodah Naliaka

texts.en:
Rodah Naliaka S. is a 54-year-old woman. She has five children who are all over 18. She buys maize and beans in bulk and sells them in small quantities. Rodah has been in this business for 10 years now and gets a monthly income of 20,000 shillings.

This will be Rodah's first loan from KADET, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy bags of maize and beans for resale. With the income she is going to get she plans to buy a farm so that she can plant maize and beans to sell. In the future, she wants to raise her family's standard of living and provide them with basic needs like food and shelter.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie  L. is a 44-year old married woman who supports her family by operating  businesses, a general store and a school canteen. She lives in  Barangay San Juan in San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and canteen, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,500. 

Elsie  is now borrowing PHP 14,000 so that she can buy more groceries to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elsie  aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Carmen Annabell

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 años. El marido es comerciante. Está en el Banco Comunal por más de 6 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos a podido dia a dia seguir incrementando su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta,  también vende en su  casa hasta donde sus clientes llegan a comprar sus productos. Trabaja tres días en la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer. Sus sueños son terminar su casa que aun la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The “El Pedregal” communal bank meets every two weeks in El Pedregal in Picoaza parish, city of Portoviejo.  This is a very commercial zone well known for its traditional festival of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where we found Carmen, 24.  She is in a common law relationship and has four children.  Her husband is a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank for over 6 years and she likes it because thanks to the loans he’s been able to expand her business day by day.

She sells all kinds of clothes door to door.  She also sells from home where her customers come by to buy her products.  She works three days a week.  She provides her goods on credit and collects biweekly.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or monthly depending on need.

This loan is to buy more clothes, especially women’s clothes.  Her dream is to finish building her house that’s still under construction.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Samaké  est âgé de 25 ans et vit avec ses 2 enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Moridjambougou, un des quartiers de la ville de Ouelessebougou, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Moussa Samaké n’a pas eu la chance  de réussir à l’école car il fut  vite exclu du système éducatif.  Alors il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à l’embouche (qui est une des activités de leur famille) et à l’achat stockage vente de céréales qu’il appris auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de quatre ans, Monsieur Moussa Samaké jouit d’une grande renommée et est très sollicité à Ouelessebougou et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt il est à son deuxième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil) auprès des paysans producteurs qu’il gardera pendant au moins un mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
Moussa Samaké espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Moussa Samake is 25 years old and he lives with his 2 children and his wife in a traditional family in Moridjambougou, a quarter in the city of Ouelessebougou of the Kati prefecture, in the Region of Koulikoro. 

Moussa Samake did not have the chance to complete school and early on he left the school system.   He became interested in revenue-generating activities, especially raising livestock (one of the family businesses) and the sale of cereal grains, a business he learned from his uncle. With a four-year experience, Mr. Moussa Samake enjoys a high reputation and is highly solicited in Ouelessebougou and the surrounding regions.

In order to satisfy his growing clientele, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Having successfully repaid his first loan, he is now on his second individual loan. It will be used to purchase 4 tons of cereal grains (corn, beans, millet) from the producers. He will store his inventory for at least one month. He sells essentially in wholesale to a clientele made up of retailers who come from large cities, such as Bamako. 

Moussa Samake expects to earn a monthly income of 25.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan and to reinvest the remaining portion in his business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Ana Maria Carlas

texts.es:
Doña Ana, reside en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel,  vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad, se dedica a vender ropa y tiene 41 años de edad, su forma de verde es ambulante, doña Ana en compañía de su esposo realizan las ventas diariamente.
Ella por el momento necesita un préstamo para compra ropa y Joyas de oro, estos pues para ofrecer a los clientes, ayudando así al negocio y sus ingresos, ya que al tener mercadería que ofrecer tiene la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas. 
El sueño de doña Ana con respecto al negocio, es tener su propio vehículo donde salir a ofrecer y distribuir ropa por los alrededores, con su familia quiere estabilizar su condición económica y ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana lives in San Miguel, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband and two children who are 15 and 18 years old. She peddles wares and is 41 years old. Mrs. Ana sells daily with her husband.

At the moment she needs a loan to buy clothes and golden jewelry so she can offer more to her patients. This will help her make more profits since having more merchandise will increase her possibilities of selling more.

Mrs. Ana's dream is to have her own vehicle to go out to offer and distribute clothes around town. She wants to help her family financially and help her children with their education.

loans.use: To buy clothes and golden jewelry.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past six years, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. Lucy faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation when moving from door-to-door. She hopes to establish a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Duo Princesas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Princesas del mar: Este grupo la conforman Brenda Esmeralda: y Maria Floritcelda tienen diferente negocio pero un mismo objetivo.
Floritcelda tiene su tienda donde vende productos comestibles de primera Necesidad ella alquila un local serca del mercado de su localidad tambien tiene otra venta donde tambien vende productos comestibles de primera necesidad ella solicita el credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera necesidad. y asi obtener mas ganacias para ayudar a su familia economicamente.
Laseñora Brenda Esmeralda,se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica ella confecciona blusas fajas y cortes tipicos, de la misma manera ella sale a vender en el mercado de su localidad su producto ella solicita este credito para la compra de materia prima para confeccion de tejidos y asi obtener mejores ganacias.
texts.en:
This group's members are Brenda Esmeralda and María Floritcelda.  They have different businesses but share the same goal.

Floritcelda has a store where she sells basic food products.  She hires premises near her town's market.  She also has another sales location where she sells basic food products.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy basic food products and thereby make more profits to help her family financially.

Brenda Esmeralda's business is selling traditional clothing.  She makes blouses, belts, sashes and other traditional clothes.  She sells her products in the local market.  Brenda is requesting this loan to buy material for making her clothes so that she can make better profits.

loans.use: to buy basic food products and to buy material

loans.name: Roger Daniel

texts.es: solicitante 25 años de edad es soltero y vive en casa de su padre. Cuenta con negocio de transporte(mototaxi) el cual uno de ellos es alquilado y el otro es trabajado por el, experiencia en el rubro hace 3años. Cuenta con credito vigente en scotiabank el fue destinado para la compra de un auto tico el cual esta a nombre de su madre, quien firma como aval en el presente credito .solicita credito para mantenimiento de las movilidades. goza de buenas refefencias personales. se propone el credito por tener capacidad y voluntad de pago
texts.en: This loan applicant is 25 years old. He is single and lives in his father's house. He has a motorcycle-taxi transportation business. One of his taxis is rented out and he drives the other for work. He has three years of experience in this business. He has a current loan at Scotiabank, which is destined for the purchase of a Daewoo Tico; this loan is in the name of his mother, who signed as the guarantor for this loan. He is applying for a loan to maintain his vehicles. He enjoys good personal references. He is recommended for the loan because he has the ability and will to make the payments.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicles.

loans.name: Rosa Inocente

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, es una señora D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Miguel, vive con su hijo D. 33 años, ella es viuda y administra una tienda, la cual atienD. hace 10 años, con un horario D. 7:00am a 6:00pm, este negocio le ayuda a solventar muchas D. sus necesidades.

Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para el negocio, ya que quiere adquirir mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes y mejorar su atención.

Su objetivo es tener un negocio que le provea lo necesario, ya que por su avanzada edad, no podría atender otro tipo D. oficio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 60 year-old lady who lives in the city of San Miguel with her 33 year-old son.  She is a widow and runs a store which she has worked in for 10 years.  She works from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  The business helps her to cover many of her needs.

Rosa is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She would like to acquire merchandise to sell to her customers and improve her customer service.

Rosa's goal is to have a business that provides what she needs since, owing to her age, she could not work in any other type of traD..

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José B. de 47 años tiene una fábrica artesanal de calzado y bolsos  en el barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Barranquilla; su especialidad son las sandalias en las líneas femeninas, masculinas y los bolsos para damas,  productos que aprendió a fabricar con sus propias manos, cuando  trabajó como ayudante en pequeños talleres de la ciudad; este fue el ejercicio de donde se deriva su mayor experiencia,  la cual ha perfeccionado día a día mediante la observación del mercado, la aplicación de toda su creatividad, pero sobre todo,  del conocimiento adquirido en el oficio de calzado y marroquinería, en  el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje (SENA),  organización que tiene como misión “Invertir en el desarrollo social y técnico de los trabajadores colombianos,   formación profesional integral para la incorporación y el desarrollo de las personas en actividades productivas que contribuyan al desarrollo social, económico y tecnológico del país” 
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con su credikiva comprará materias primas, como cuerina, capelladas y hormas,  para modernizar sus diseños y ofrecer calzado a la moda,  adaptado a los requerimientos y posibilidades de pago de sus clientes, a los que ofrece sus productos acredito y de contado.
Su principal meta es tener un taller bien dotado de toda la infraestructura, con su punto comercial, para atender sus clientes uno a uno y ofrecer una gama de productos con diseños adaptados no solo a la moda, sino a los requerimientos de durabilidad y comodidad, exigidos por la clientela. Mientras tanto continúa trabajando persistentemente para lograr alcanzar cada uno de sus sueños.
texts.en:
José B. is 47 years old. He has a small factory for making shoes and purses in the San Isidro neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla. His specialty is women's and men's sandals and women's purses. He learned to make these products with his own hands when he worked as an assistant in small workshops around the city; this was how he got most of his experience. He has perfected his work day by day through observation of the market and application of his creativity; above all, he has gained knowledge through his trade of shoe-making and leather-working and from the National Service for Learning, an organization that has as its mission “Investing in the social and technical development  of the Colombian workers, professional training that is integral for the incorporation and development of people in productive activities that contribute to the social, economic, and technological development of the country.”

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in cooperation with Kiva. He will buy raw materials such as imitation leather, toe caps, and shoe forms to modernize his designs and offer stylish shoes that can be adapted to the requirements of his customers and their ability to pay. He offers his products for paid-in-full and also on credit.

His main goal is to have a workshop that is well-equipped with infrastructure, and with a sales room so he can attend to customers one-on-one. He wants to offer a variety of products with designs that are adapted not only to the fashion of moment, but also to the customers’ requirements for durability and comfort. Meanwhile, he continues working hard to achieve each one of his dreams.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as imitation leather, toe caps, and shoe forms

loans.name: Richel

texts.en: Richel P.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. She is 33 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Richel is just starting this business. In 2007, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Richel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use additional income to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Marcel Dieudonné

texts.fr: Né le 09 Avril 1968, Marcel Dieudonné est marié à Catherine une marchande. Le couple à six enfants à charge, dont cinq sont les leurs. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Marcel Dieudonné et sa femme vivent dans la même maison avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Marcel Dieudonné a appris le métier de soudure ; activité qu’il exerce depuis quinze ans et qui lui permet de satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle et d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Marcel Dieudonné  désire agrandir son atelier en s’approvisionnant en matériels de soudure (bouteille de gaz, carbure, etc.). Marcel Dieudonné s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C’est la deuxième  fois que  Marcel Dieudonné demande l’appui financier d’ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, d’accroître sa clientèle et  son revenu.
texts.en:
Born on April 9, 1968, Marcel Dieudonné is married to Catherine, a shopkeeper. The couple has six children to support. Five of the children are their own, and some of them are in school. Marcel and his wife live in the same house with their children. The various family expenses are covered by the couple. 

Marcel learned how to weld, an occupation he has been working at for fifteen years. It enables him to satisfy the requirements of his customers and to ensure that family expenses are covered. 

He would like to expand his workshop by stocking up on welding supplies (bottled gas, fuel, etc.) He is supplied from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. This financial support from ALIDé is the second one for Marcel, so as to boost his business and to increase his customer base and his revenues.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies and equipment

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
