Mrs. Phat is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Mrs. Phat is married to Mr. Horn, age 54. This couple, who work together in the rice-planting business, have a child who works in the farming business as well. 

Because the rainy season is approaching, Mrs. Phat wants to grow more crops on her own farmland. As she lacks the money to do this, Mrs. Phat has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Mrs. Phat will use these funds to plant corn and sesame.

loans.use: to plant corn and sesame.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a housewife. Her husband operates a grocery store business. In his store, he sells daily household items such as cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc. He has been operating his business for the past two years and has a good number of clients in his area who purchase groceries from him because he offers his products at good prices. 

Allah Rakhi has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her sons are getting their education by attending a nearby school, while her daughter is only 2 years old and has not started her education. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her husband expand his business. With this loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity which will allow him to fulfill the needs of his clients in a timely way and earn more profit. Allah Rakhi is confident that a loan investment will help her husband improve his business and allow her to send her daughter to school next year. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Allah Rakhi.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Rosvilla

texts.en:
Rosvilla, aged 42, is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has a business in which she buys and sells coconuts in the Philippines. Rosvilla has been in this business for three years. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell in her stall.

In the future, Rosvilla would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell in her stall

loans.name: Qalakoncane Group

texts.en:
Getrude is widowed with five children between the ages of 28 and 43. She operates a small store from her home where she sells chickens and sleeping mats. Getrude has been in business for five years and she has three employees. She also receives income from an old age pension program provided by the South African government.

Getrude is requesting a loan from WDB and Kiva to purchase more chickens and sleeping mats to sell. In five years, she hopes to become a wholesaler of chickens and mats to other entrepreneurs. Getrude’s biggest business challenge is that her customers buy on credit and do not repay her. She would like to thank WDB and Kiva and she hopes to make a lot of money from this loan!

loans.use: to buy chickens and sleeping mats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a wrought-iron front door

loans.name: Teresa Maria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Teresa Maria nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tiene 41 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas de forma ambulatoria. En esta oportunidad Teresa Maria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo blusas, faldas y otras cosas más.  Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El anhela de Teresa María es tener una tienda propia para poder expender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Molinito II” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco in Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

Teresa Maria was born in the city of Quillabamba. She is 41 years old and has four children. Teresa Maria currently lives in the city of Cusco, where she has developed her business activities. She sells women’s clothing as a street vendor. Teresa Maria is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as blouses, skirts, and other items. She has been in this business for 12 years and has done very well. Teresa Maria hopes to have her own store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and other items.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a father of three children. He is a rice farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 12 years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farming.

loans.name: Wise Woman Group

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Shedra from Masvingo. She is married and has four children, one attending school.  

Shedra buys and sells clothing, household appliances and maize. She has been doing this business for 13 years. Her main challenge is inadequate funding to meet the increasing orders she has. 

Shedra has requested a loan of $400 to buy TVs, radios and maize for sale. She says the extra income she will get will be used to improve her family's standard of living. 

In the future, Shedra plans to buy a commuter omnibus.

loans.use: To buy appliances and maize for sale.

loans.name: Amornia

texts.en:
Amormia is 36 years old and lives in Kapalaran,Balangasan,Pagadian City. She is married with 6 children.
Amormia has a motorcycle for rent and earns approximately P6,000.00 per month doing this. She has requested a loan of P12,000 to purchase equipment for her motorcycle .
Amormia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future,Amormia hopes to have additional motorcycles to ren.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her motorcycle

loans.name: Elvia Dinora

texts.es:
Elvia, vive con sus dos  hijas de 9 y 4 años, ella se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en el mercado, desde hace muchos años y recibe ayuda económica de su esposo, trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más frutas y verduras como: bananos, manzanas, plátanos, repollo, y de esa forma surtir más el negocio y recibir más ingresos.
El sueño de Elvia es que sus dos hijas estudien con su esfuerzo para que sigan adelante, y darle mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Elvia lives with her two daughters who are 9 and 4 years old.  She has sold fruit and vegetables in the market for many years and she gets economic help from her husband; she works every day, Monday through Sunday.

She needs the loan to buy more fruit and vegetables like: bananas, apples, plantain and cabbage to better stock her business and earn higher income.

Elvia’s dream is that with her efforts her two daughters will study so that they can get ahead and to provide them with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow and sell flowers.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 38 years old and is married with five children aged between 1 and 10 years old. Venuste owns a business selling various produts like soap, sugar, rice, and cooking oil. This is his second successful year in this business and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day except on Saturday. He currently employs three people to help him. 

Venuste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products like cooking oil, sugar, rice, and soap to sell. With additional profits, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more products like cooking oil, sugar, rice, and soap.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has been in business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for five years.
Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Paul  Ngatu

texts.en:
Paul Ngatu, 33, is married to a tailor and has two children. 

He sells bread to traders, shopkeepers, hotels and butcheries. Besides this business, Paul is a farmer. He is faced with the problem of the high cost of bread when buying it.

He wants a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more loaves of bread. He is a visionary and confident man.

loans.use: To buy more bread.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 38-year-old married woman.  She sells cereals including rice, beans, onions, maize and green grams.  She works next to a busy supermarket in the open air with the aid of her car trunk.  

Prior to selling cereals, she sold clothes. Florence has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize and rice for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business by having other outlets. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to be more accountable.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice.

loans.name: Njenda Kalaa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Njenda Kalaa Group in Western Kenya! Lydia is the facilitator of the Njenda Kalaa group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Lydia takes care of 12 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lydia had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lydia was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lydia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Lydia will educate her children and repair home.

In 2012, the members of Njenda Kalaa group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La señora Flor  de Luz,  vive en una localidad pequeña ella es  casada con el señor  Gilberto y con quien procreo tres hijos quienes dos ya estas fuera de su responsabilidad y una a un vive con ellos.

   Ella solcito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  materiales para su estética en donde lleva trabajando veintidós años nueve  meses y comenta  que le va bien  ya que con ello ha mejorado muchos sus ingresos.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó  ya que desde muy joven comenzó a practicarlo y su mama la mando a cursos  para que se prepare mejor y ve que se le está dando resultado.

  Lo que ella desea es que siga trabajando con su actividad  y el préstamo para tener sus horros y poye a su hija que esta estudiando.
texts.en: Flor de Luz lives in a small place.  She is married to Gilberto with whom she procreated three children.  She is no longer responsible for two of the children but the third still lives with them.  She requested the loan to buy materials for her beauty salon where she has worked for 22 years and nine months.  She says that it has gone well since through the business she has greatly improved her income.  Her inspiration for this business began when she started practicing her skills as a young girl.  Her mother also sent her to classes to prepare her more.  She sees that it is giving her results.  What she wants is to keep working with her business.  She also wants the loan to have some savings and support her daughter who is studying.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Germana

texts.en: Germana, a 38-year-old mother of 7 children between the ages of 1 and 14, is married to a farmer. For the past four years, she has been raising pigs, and is now requesting a loan to purchase piglets, chickens and goats to raise. Germana, who works hard to improve her income and sustain her family, hopes for her children to finish their education and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, chickens and goats to raise.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and lives in Sto. Niño in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children. 
To earn a living, Alma has a business selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. She has been in this business for six years and earns about 5,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. 
In 2011, Alma joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She also hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bertoldina Estela

texts.es:
La señora Betoldina es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos como son: en tomatadas, enchiladas, sopes, tacos dorados y empanadas.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Roberto con quien tiene  tres hijos una mujer y dos varones.
Tambien se  dedica a la venta de agua purificadora para  uso del hogar.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de: chile, cebollas, ajo, tomate, pollo, queso, frijoles y manteca.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla a crecer como persona.
texts.en: Betoldina is a hardworking lady that sells authentic Mexican food such as:  tomatadas, enchiladas, sopes, tacos y empanadas.  She is happily married to Roberto with whom she has three children, one girl and two boys.  She also sells drinking water for home use.  She requested the loan to buy peppers, onions, garlic, tomatoes, chicken, cheese, beans and lard.  She is thankful to the foundation for helping her grow as a person.

loans.use: to buy peppers, onions, garlic, tomatoes, chicken, cheese, beans and lard to make Mexican food for sale.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 22 years of age and the first in the family to complete senior high school.

Ellen dreams of becoming a nurse and has enrolled in a Nursing Training College. Now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She has resorted to Kiva because but without a loan from Kiva, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With a degree in nursing, she expects to earn salary to cater for herself, family and the needy in her society. 

Ellen believes being a nurse will give her the opportunity to help her community adopt good health measures to enable them to live healthy lives.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fees and school expenses

loans.name: Aman Joséphine

texts.fr: Mariée à un soudeur du nom de François, mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple, Aman Joséphine  est âgée de 37 ans. Aman Joséphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Aman Joséphine vit ensemble avec son mari e ses enfants. Aman Joséphine subvient ensemble avec son mari aux divers besoins du ménage. Aman Joséphine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour y arriver, Aman Joséphine  vend de l'igname et de l'huile végétales par la méthode de distribution depuis dix ans. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges de sa famille. Aman Joséphine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Aman Joséphine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter de l'igname et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana, con 27 años de edad, es madre de una hija de 6 años (Ver Foto) y responsable de su hogar junto con su esposo. 

Desde hace 3 años, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una sala de belleza que inició como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja sola todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, la actividad la aprendió tomando clases en una academia de belleza y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más conocimientos y perfeccionando sus técnicas, lo que le ha permitido darse a conocer en el sector por la calidad de su servicio. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar los diferentes utensilios e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, tinturas, shampoo, acondicionador, entre otros), así estará en la capacidad de generar un empleo directo y además podrá prestar un mejor servicio, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe. 

Diana con su perseverancia y proyección hacia un futuro, desea hacer crecer su salón de belleza, en el que pueda generar más oportunidades de empleo para madres cabezas de familia, dando como resultado un mejor bienestar no sólo para su familia, sino que aportará para que otras personas puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones para vivir.

loans.use: comprar los diferentes utensilios e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, tinturas, shampoo, acondicionador, entre otros)

loans.name: Mlamua

texts.en: Mlamua lives in Mbagala in Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. He is self employed and owns a small shop near his residence. The shop sells different consumable items. Mainly food items, which have high demand.  The shop provides him with an opportunity to raise his children. He would like to expand his business so that he can meet costs of educating his children. The shop employs himself and his wife. To expand his business he needs  USD 1000

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Chapay

texts.en: Chapay is an IDP from the Armenian occupied district of Fizuli since 1993. In 2002 he started his trading business in Baku city. In 2006 he borrowed  $300 loan from Normicro, Baku branch an expanded his business volume. Now he wants to borrow $500 to expand his business volume again.

loans.use: To expand the volume of his business

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa has three children, and when her husband abandoned the family, she was left without income and no means to provide for her children.  She heard about the SPBD program from other women in her village and decided to join and start her own business.  With her small plot of family land, she was determined to show that not only men can be successful farmers.  With an initial loan, she bought some vegetable seeds.  Three months later, she had a vegetable crop and began selling her produce at the local markets.  Now she has an income stream that is larger than the income her husband had previously been able bring home.  Having repaid the first loan, Epenesa is eligible for a second loan.  She will use additional loan funds to purchase seeds and gardening tools.

loans.use: Buy seeds and gardening tools

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata J. is a mother of four children.  She is engaged in palm oil selling.  Palm oil is the local oil made from the palm cannel and it is widely used in Sierra Leone for cooking and soap making.  Aminata’s family income comes from her business and she is solely responsible for family’s expenses since her husband is jobless. Aminata is requesting this second loan with SMT for expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of palm oil

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is 45 years old and is married to Cristina, who is 40. He says they've been happily married for 17 years and have two children, ages 14 and 16, who attend school.

Herminio founded the San Blas School Transportation company with a group of friends 12 years ago and ever since has worked driving students to and from school, Monday through Friday in the mornings, afternoons and evenings. During school vacations, he drives other passengers, such as local hospital workers. He also runs a small electrical supply store from his home, as he's an electrician by trade.

Thanks to the income generated through his hard work, he was able to build a home where he and his family live comfortably. He dreams of owning a second minibus and will one day pursue a loan to make that dream a reality.

For now, he is requesting a loan to replace the 6 tires in his minibus, which cost about $170 each.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Herminio tiene 45 años, está casado con Cristina que tiene 40 años de edad. Comenta que está felizmente casado hace 17 años y que tienen 2 hijos de 14 y 16 años respectivamente. Ambos viven con ellos y están estudiando la secundaria. Herminio fundó hace 12 años la empresa de transporte escolar San Blas con un grupo de amigos y desde entonces se dedica a transportar a los alumnos desde sus casas hasta sus lugares de estudio y viceversa. Dicha actividad la realiza de lunes a viernes de mañana , tarde y noche. Cuenta que en época de vacaciones escolares transporta otro tipo de pasajeros como ser los funcionarios de un hospital de la zona. También cuenta en su domicilio con un pequeño negocio de venta de materiales eléctricos ya que Herminio también es electricista de profesión. Gracias a su trabajo y a los ingresos que ha obtenido con él logró construir su casa propia en la que viven cómodamente él y toda su familia. Sueña con que algún día pueda comprar otro minibus y para ello espera acceder a un crédito a fin de llevar a cabo dicho proyecto. Por el momento necesita de un crédito debido a que desea cambiar las cubiertas de su transporte, el mismo lleva 6 de ellas y cada una le estaría costando aproximadamente US$ 170 cada una.

loans.use: To purchase new tires

loans.name: Basilio

texts.pt:
Basilio lives with his 2 children and their mother. Both of his sons are in school. His girlfriend is now working in a factory. Basilio plans to use this loan to buy kitchen appliances for his home. He works at a private company as a driver.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Basilio e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 2 filhos. Os filhos de Basilio estudam. A sua esposa so agora e que arranjou um emprego, pois que a fabrica onde ela trabalhava como serralheira fechou. basilio quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de electrodomesticos para a sua casa. Pois que so com o salario nao consegue comprar. Ele e motorista numa Empresa Privada.

loans.use: Buy home appliances

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.en:
Elena has a steady job as an independent breakfast caterer for a construction company in Lima. Every morning she wakes up at 3 AM to prepare breakfast for 100 construction workers. After six long hours of preparing food she then delivers it to their building. After this, she begins preparations on the next morning’s meal. She has a very diverse menu which she changes every day; she says both she and the workers enjoy the variety! Elena has run this business for five years, and has one employee who helps her.

Elena has been a single mother her entire life. She has three children; her two older children, ages 22 and 20, are both independent and working, and her youngest, 18, lives with her and is studying at the university. She dreams that her kids can be professionals so they can have the things in life that she hasn’t been able to give them.

Elena loves her catering business, but her real dream is to open up a restaurant in her home so she doesn’t have to transport the food each day. With this loan of $150 she plans on buying the necessary ingredients for her breakfasts so she can ‘seguir adelante’, keep on moving forward, and continue to put away money in savings towards opening her own restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the breakfasts she prepares

loans.name: Bang

texts.en: Mrs. Bang T., 32, is a mother of two little kids and sells fruit at a busy market earning about $5/day. Her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver and typically earns around $5 each day. Mrs. Bang T. humbly request a loan to expand her inventory by adding more fruits to meet her growing customer demands. She believes this will raise her standard of living. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Bang T. is unavailable).

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more fruits.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz M., whose son is pictured, is a 50-year-old man who owns and operates a market in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He has been working in this business for the last five years and is married with three children. He is currently looking for funding in order to increase and diversify his inventory stock.

loans.use: To increase and diversify his stock of inventory

loans.name: Sam On

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam On U. , 47, is a widow with two daughters. Her eldest daughter is working in a garment factory and the youngest one is studying in secondary school. Her family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. U. has been in the business of selling jasmine flowers and bananas for over ten years. She buys them from farmers in her village and rells the products at a market in Phnom Penh. She hopes that her business will continue to support the daughter in school. Mrs. U. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase additional jasmine flowers and bananas.

loans.use: To purchase flowers and bananas for resale

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Sokhum C. (pictured with his wife, sons, and nephew) and his wife, Choeun Pin, have been married for eight years. They have two sons. One of his sons is in school and the youngest one stays at home. Their house is located along Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. C. has been selling ice cream for three years. He makes it himself for resale around the village. His wife farms. Now she wants to create another business raising pigs.

Mr. C. is requesting a loan for the first time, asking for $500 to purchase feed and baby pigs for his wife to raise.

loans.use: For buying feed and baby pigs to raise

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian is 35 years old, is married and has three children. Two of her children attend a local school and the third one is still too young to attend. However, Lilian says the two older brothers are already teaching the youngest the basics and he is already looking forward to going to school.

Lilian has been running a small general store out of her house for over 5 years. Today Lilian and her husband tend to it. This business is one of her greatest accomplishments. She always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else.

Lilian has been married to Leoncio for over 10 years. They both come from the city of Encarnación where they were born and raised and where they met as youngsters. Leoncio helps Lilian tending to the store in shifts and buying the merchandise at the city's municipal market.

The loan that the client is requesting will be used to purchase varied merchandise for their store. One of their suppliers is having a sale and they hope to take advantage of it since it would allow them to obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lilian tiene 35 años, vive en pareja y tiene 3 hijos, dos de sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la zona en donde viven y el mas pequeño aún no asiste a clases porque es pequeño y no posee la edad para asistir a clases; Lilian nos cuenta que a pesar de ello sus hermanos ya le enseñan cosas básicas a su hermano más chico quien está muy entusiasmado de ir ya a la escuela.

La señora cuenta con un minimercado en su domicilio propio, ella se dedica a este tipo de actividad hace más de 5 años y que hoy día es atendido por ella y su pareja. Este negocio es uno de sus mejores logros ya que toda su vida soñó con contar con su negocio propio y no depender de nadie.

Lilian está casada con el Señor Leoncio hace mas de 10 años ambos son de la ciudad de Encarnación en donde nacieron y se criaron y que ya de jóvenes se conocieron. Leoncio ayuda a Lilian en el negocio atendiendo por turnos y comprando las mercaderías del mercado municipal de la ciudad.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de mercaderías varias para su negocio ya que se le presento una buena oferta de uno de sus proveedores y no desea desaprovecharla, ya que esto le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as cleaning products, sweet treats, wine, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Cao Thi L., 51 years old, joined TYM Fund in 1997. Two of her children already got married. She lives with her husband and three other children. Their main jobs are farming and breeding animals. The types of animals she breeds are also varied: chickens, ducks, pigs, geese, and buffaloes, depending on each season, the condition of the economy, and the local weather. Since investing in the farm brings good profit, each year Ms. L. is able to borrow more money from TYM Fund. On average, her income from breeding animals is about 2000 USD per year. Her three children are working and helping her whenever she finds difficulty with the repayments. This coming loan cycle, Ms. L. applies for a loan of 625USD to buy more ducks, chickens, and their food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Cao Thị Liên, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. 2 người con đã có gia đình riêng, chị Liên sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Công việc chủ yếu của gia đình là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Loại hình chăn nuôi cũng rất đa dạng: gà, vịt, lợn, ngan, trâu tùy mùa vụ và tình hình kinh tế, thời tiết của địa phương. Đầu tư chăn nuôi có hiệu quả, số vốn vay từ Quỹ tăng dần lên qua các năm. Bình quân thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của chị Liên khoảng 2000USD/năm. 3 con của chị đều đi làm và hỗ trợ mẹ mỗi khi có khó khăn. Vòng vốn sắp tới chị Liên làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua thêm vịt, gà và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy ducks, chickens

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men K., 27, is married and lives with her two young children in Siem Reap Province. She works as a chef at a local guest house, making $2 every day, while her husband, Mok Sokon, is a construction worker, making $5 per day. Inflation problems and soaring food prices in Cambodia have hit many people hard, forcing them to reduce expenses and find ways to save money. Men K. and her husband see an opportunity to save on public transportation costs through the purchase of their own motorbike. They have therefore approached CREDIT for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike that will allow them to save more money and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoua N., was born in the city of Atakpame. She is 39 years old, married and the mother of two (2) children. She is a traveling retailer of pagne (decorative cloth) and shoes in the Agoe neighborhood of Lome. She started her business in 2005 and buys pagne from the central market then resells it to customers in her home neighborhood.

After the prompt repayment of her first business loan, she is requesting this second loan to purchase 30 pieces of pagne and 28 pairs of shoes. The revenue from this business allows her to contribute to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Originaire de la ville d’Atakpamé, madame N. Akoua est une femme âgée de 39 ans mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est revendeuse ambulant de pagnes et de chaussures dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005 et achète les pagnes au grand marché avant de revendre aux clients de son quartier de provenance. Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu, elle sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter 30 pièces de pagne et 28 paires de chaussures. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité elle pourra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of pagne (decorative cloth) and shoes

loans.name: Ni Ketut Mertini

texts.id:
Eventhough getting older, Ni Ketut Mertini is not losing hope. She is still striving to move forward, either with the organization within her village, or with the business she runs. She is a hard worker, and always energetic in doing everything, especially in running her business: piglets breeding.

Ni Ketut Mertini is the wife of I Made Kompiang. They have 3 children. Eventhough she is now 54 years old, Ni Ketut Mertini is still eager to run the business. She manages 2 cages with 2-4 pigs. The cages have never been empty. The limited number of pigs she raise is just because the limited capital. The income Ni Ketut Mertini earns is varied, between IDR 100,000 to IDR 250,000 a month, that is used to fulfill her family’s daily needs and to pay her children tuition fees.

Ni Ketut Mertini is planning to increase the number of the pigs she manages and to develop the existing cages. She proposes to borrow IDR 3,500,000 through Dinari. Ni Ketut Mertini is optimistic that her business will be improved if she is entrusted the loan.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana DK, Kiva volunteer.

Usia yang semakin tua tak menyurutkan semangat dari Ni Ketut Mertini untuk maju, baik dalam berbagai organisasi di desanya maupun dalam usaha yang sedang di gelutinya. Istri dari I Made Kompiang ini terkenal sangat tekun dan selalu energik dalam segala kegiatannya, terlebih dalam hal berternak babi. 54 tahun sudah umur ibu dengan tiga orang anak ini. Tetapi dia tampak masih sangat bersemangat untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dua buah kandang semi permanen miliknya tak pernah kosong dari babi –babi peliharaan walau jumlahnya berkisar dua sampai empat ekor saja. Itu karena modal yang di miliki sangat terbatas. Keuntungan yang di dapat Ni Ketut Mertini selama ini bervariasi, yaitu berkisar Rp. 100.000.- sampai Rp. 250.000.- per bulannya. Hasil ini dia pergunakan untuk membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga dan pendidikan ke tiga orang anaknya. Ni Ketut Mertini bermaksud menambah jumlah ternak peliharaannya yang saat ini hanya dua ekor dan juga memperbaiki kandang yang ada. Untuk mewujudkan hal itu, Ni Ketut Mertini membutuhkan tambahan modal lagi yang dia pinjam melalui Dinari Rp. 3.500.000.- Dengan tambahan modal ini Ni Ketut Mertini optimis usahanya akan lebi

loans.use: To purchase piglets and renovate the cage

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora Fidelina, socia del BC “Micaela Bastidas”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de plátanos, yuca, limones, aguajes, paltas, frijoles, hojas de bijao, culantro, etc., en el puesto de venta que tiene en el mercado Poma Rosa de la ciudad  de Juanjui. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  racimos de plátanos, aguaje en sacos, hojas de bijao para juanes, papayas y  sacos de yuca, y de esa manera surtir más el negocio y atender las exigencias de sus clientes. Las ventas han aumentado en estos últimos tiempos por el trato que da a sus clientes.  

La señora Fidelina tiene 61 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora e independiente, vive con su hijo, quien la apoya en sus momentos libres. Su meta es aumentar el negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Fidelina, member of the Communal Bank “Micaela Bastidas,” lives in the San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres, Juanjui state. She sells bananas, yucca, lemons, aguajes, avocados, beans, bijao, cilantro, etc. in a stall that she has in the Poma Rosa market in Juanjui city. With this loan of S/.1,000 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy bunches of bananas, sacks of aguaje, bijao leaves to make juanes (a dish wrapped with the bijao leaf), papayas, sacks of yucca, and in this manner stock her business and meet the needs of her customers. The sales have increased lately because of the service she gives her customers. Fidelina is 61 years old, is a hard-working and independent woman, she lives with her son who supports her in his free time. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, aguaje, papaya, yucca, etc.

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira Baji is the wife of M. T. and lives in a small area named Riwind of Kasur, Pakistan. It is a half hour from Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruits and vegetable markets. Tahira Baji owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last eight years. She is the mother of two daughters. Her elder daughter is 4 years old and her younger daughter is 2 years old. Tahira Baji's husband has a scrap business where he sells particularly iron. He has been in this business for the last 8 years. Tahira Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more iron for her husband's scrap business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Tahira Baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell. Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia Baji wants a loan to buy milk to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for scrap business

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is a 28 year old woman engaged in dressmaking, specializing in making school uniforms and gowns. Her skills in sewing came from her previous employment as well as from formal training in a related course. She had just given birth to a baby girl named Crisanta Nicole. She has been married to a booking officer in a bus company for almost a year.

At present, she has three employed sewers and has engaged in a private school providing on-the-job training for its students. She earns a daily net income of Php 450.00 (approximately US$9.00) that she uses to sustain their needs. Her vision is to expand her business in order to provide more employment opportunities in the community. Aside from the quality products she manufactures, she also offers minimal and affordable costs that attract plenty of customers. With the increasing demand of her sewing services she needs an additional piping machine, fabrics and accessories for mass production of t-shirts.

She had been an active leader and member of ASHI for five years. The experiences she has had have helped develop her confidence in managing her business. When she first joined ASHI, she just used a manual machine without any employed help. Using the successive loans from ASHI, she was able to accumulate several more machines, like high speed machines and an edging machine.

Adora dreams that three years from now, she will own a well-equipped dress shop to be able to cope with orders for school uniforms in state colleges around the bustling capital town of San Jose de Buenavista, Antique.

loans.use: Purchase of a piping machine, fabrics and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Fiapapalagi

texts.en: Fiapapalagi F., 24, is single with no children.  She has 4 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $250 USD).  SPBD loans are Fiapapalagi’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to purchase chemicals, bush knives and seedlings for the plantation.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, bush knives and seedlings for her plantation.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife. He has been working as a carpenter, selling and manufacturing furniture for 12 years. Ibrahim has a reputation for doing good work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ibrahim requests a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase supplies for his work and also save some money.

This is Ibrahim's third loan and he has always paid on time. His previous loans have helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Ibrahim will use the loan to purchase supplies for furniture-making business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mr. Sarith C. is a villager in Krang Chhoer Neang village in Takeo province. He makes large pots. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing cement and sand to make more pots so his business can earn more income. 

His wife, Mrs. Sok Sreylak, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows rice. Mr. Sarith C. is a 40-year-old father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The others attend the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. She is fifty years old. One of her children is currently in teacher training college while the rest are in senior and junior high schools. Esther lives with her children and husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. Her husband is a cocoa/palm nut farmer.

Esther produces palm oil. She buys palm nuts from the local farmers and adds those to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to retailers in her community. Esther has been in business for over fourteen years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk. It is her dream to help her children to climb the academic ladder to higher heights.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Maruja es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Maruja viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra quesos, ajos, cuy, luego los comercializa en los mercados y recreos de la ciudad de ayacucho. Además Maruja se dedica a la crianza de cuy en su casa.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy, queso.
Los sueños de Maruja son tener una tienda en su casa y ampliar su galpón de cuy.
texts.en:
Maruja is a partner of the Communal Bank Santa Rita. Maruja is 42, married, and has four children. She travels to regional fairs where she buys cheses, garlic, and guinea pics to sell in the marketplace and recesses in the city of Ayacucho. Maruja also raises guinea pigs at home. Maruja needs a USD $325 loan for investment in guinea pigs and cheese. Maruja's goals are to open a storefront from her house and enlarge her guinea pig barn.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guinea pigs and cheese

loans.name: Ejiro

texts.en: Ejiro is a 38-year-old fashion designer who is married with six children. She also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She has been in this business for a long time. She has requested a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials for sale. She sends her thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Mrs. Leonila L. lives in Dipolog City. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are still studying, and an active member of Paglaum MPC for the past three years.  She is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business and helps her husband, who operates a vulcanizing shop, in generating income for the household. She has already taken loans several times for her business.  Now she seeks another loan to redeem their coconut land, which was previously pawned due to financial difficulties.

loans.use: Redemption of pawned coconut land

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en: Andrei has been selling perfume oils for over five years. This has been a very successful business.  When Andrei originally intended to start his business he was skeptical because he did not have enough money to launch the business. He had just closed a lucrative soap shop temporarily to move to a new location. After finally signing the lease, not even two weeks before he was to open, the owners of the property told him that he could not sell jewelry there because his shop would be competing with a major new store that was opening soon. Andrei had two choices. He could either back out of the lease or continue with the lease with a different product mix. This was a very viable location and he did not want to let it go. Over the coming days Andrei had to come up with an idea that he could feel comfortable with in order to move forward. He already had the oils because he carried them in his soap shop, so he decided to renegotiate the lease for a small fragrance shop instead. He knows that this would turn out to be one of the best decisions of his life. Andrei borrowed from the Kiva partner, Microinvest, to pay for the original rental of the shop. Andrei is sure that he will succeed in his business and will return the loan in time to Microinvest.

loans.use: To pay rent on the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more trees for making timber

loans.name: Norjinsuren

texts.en:
Norjinsuren T. is a 32-years-old married woman. Her family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She moved to the capital city from Gobi-Altay, one of the western provinces that is located more than 1,000 kilometers away from the capital. Her husband, Ganbat, works as a plumber for a privately held company.

As soon as she moved in, Norjinsuren started running a retail business, selling vegetables through a rental stall at the local food market. She purchases a variety of vegetables including potatoes, carrots and cabbages from the wholesale market and then resells them at retail prices to locals, mostly repeat buyers.

With this loan Norjinsuren is planning to purchase vegetables to increase her business inventory since she has bought a secondhand car for her business using her business income.

Norjinsuren seems quite a shy woman. She says that ''my husband and I are planning to have a baby in near future. Honestly I don't have a very big dream with my business. What I think in life is I want to have many children and grow them healthy and with no hunger.”

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to increase her business inventory

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience I. sells sarongs of various colors within her community in Benin City, Edo State. She is 40 years old and married with two children. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Alimurod

texts.ru: Алимурод Джурабеков проживает в районе Абдурахмон Чоми. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Алимурод более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует  мужской одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Alimurod D. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 42 years old, married and has 5 children. Alimurod has been involved in sales for over 6 years. He has a retail store at a market, where he sells men's clothing. He is requesting a loan to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius K. is 44 years old and is a married father of three children. He lives with his family in Mikindani, a town in the coastal province of Kenya. Julius runs an electrical and hardware shop in the same area and has been able to serve his customers for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client and this will be his first time borrowing from KADET to finance his business. He plans to buy square metal bars for construction and to also purchase a variety of hardware materials for the hardware business. His business is centrally located and being the only hardware in the area, Julius has been able to have many customers.

He hopes to open an even bigger hardware and electrical shop and to start supplying the goods wholesale.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying  square metal bars for construction and to also purchase a variety of hardware materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 44 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 05 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años,  es una D. las socias fundadoras,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado  vacuno y ovino para engorD. la señora Juana también se ayuda con las chacras.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde.

loans.name: Apa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une grande expérimentée de la couture. En effet, elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1984 où elle a ouvert son atelier de couture dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Grâce à cette activité, elle arrive à apporter son aide financière à son mari pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Elle dispose d’une machine surfileuse et de 02 machines à coudre. Elle dispose de 02 apprentis couturières et dispose de nombreuses clientes ; actuellement la machine surfileuse est tombée en panne ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour en acheter une. Elle compte sur ses bonnes affaires pour rembourser son crédit dans les délais exigés.

loans.use: Achat de machine surfileuse

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty, 32 years old and single, has a salon where she sells hair cream and hair extensions. She also creates lovely hair styles for her customers. Beauty hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Las Comadres Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento: LAS COMADRES  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio San Juan,el Banco esta en su 2do ciclo, compuesto por 13 personas, es uno de un grupo dinámico y alegre; dirigido por su PRESIDENTA MARIANA DALCY,la TESORERA CLAUDIA ROSA y la SECRETARIA CAROLA. En el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta de Ropa,Zapatos,Cosmeticos, Comida, Abarrotes, Panaderia, Venta de cd`s,herbalife ,Dulces etc. 
La Presidenta del grupo, tiene 6 años de antigüedad en la Venta de cosmeticos y su nueva innovacion en el mercado de herbalife a la cual va ir destinado este credito; le dedica 8 horas al dia, tiene una hija en edad escolar.  
La Tesorera del Banco, tiene 5 años de antigüedad en el rubro de venta de abarrotes a la vez este nuevo credito le permitira invertir mas en su negocio, trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 8 horas al dia, su trabajo mayormente es realizado en su propio domicilio,su meta es de seguir Trabajando y ampliar su negocio. Tiene 3 niños que estudian en la escuela del barrio y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda en el sustento del hogar.
La Secretaria lleva 2 años en el negocio de Venta de Dulces, Asaditos (lomitos) y Panza rebozada  trabaja de lunes a viernes en el colegio de la Colorada. Sabe interactuar con las socias es  muy creativa y trabajadora,vive en alquiler y tiene 2 hijas bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Banco de Emprendimiento: LAS COMADRES is located in the neighborhood San Juan. The bank is in its second cycle, made up of 13 people, and is a dynamic and happy group. It is directed by its president, Mariana Dalcy, the treasurer, Claudia Rosa, and the secretary, Carola. In the group there are women that work selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, food, groceries, CDs, Herbalife, candy, etc. The president of the group has 6 years of seniority in the sale of cosmetics, and her new innovation is in the market of Herbalife, for which this credit will be used. She dedicates 8 hours a day to her job and has a daughter of school age. The treasurer of the bank has 5 years of seniority in the area of grocery sales, and this credit will allow her to invest more in her business. She works 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, and her job is mostly carried out in her own home. Her goal is to continue working and expand her business. She has 3 children that study in the neighborhood school, and the income that she receives helps in the upkeep of her home. The secretary has worked for 2 years in the business of selling candy and grilled meats. She works from Monday to Friday in the school of Colorada. She knows how to interact with the partners and is very creative and hardworking. She lives in a rented home and has 2 daughters under her responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel L., 30 years-old, is a rice farmer in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato Minadanao.  She has  been helping her husband till their farm to be able to have an abundant harvest. From her one hectare farm, she easily earns Php 45,000 worth of grains, which she utilizes to support their daily needs. 
She needs additional capital to grow her business. The loan will help her fund her farm and buy the farming necessities to grow the harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and farm equipment.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda C. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Glenda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. She sells a variety of different products and also cell phone loads (prepaid credits) in the local community. Glenda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Glenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Glenda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is married and has one child. His child is 22 years old. Benson is 58 years old and hopes to lift his family and business above poverty. He sells clothes and shoes at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a boutique in the future. Benson has been in this business for a long time and loves this business. His customers pay cash when they come to purchase shoes and clothes. He would like to borrow a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. He says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a Palestinian man living in the city of Nablus. He owns and manages a grocery shop which he has owned for  six years. It is the only source of income for his family which consists of six members. The business is going very well and there is good demand for its products,

Mohammad requested 2,000 USD from FATEN to pay in cash for some products he previously bought on credit as paying in cash will give him a better price and better product quality. The cost of the loan is much less than the cost of buying stuff from the merchants on credit.

Mohammad appears in the photo at his store.

loans.use: To buy products for his grocery shop using cash instead of credit

loans.name: Alfredo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Alfredo Jose Manzanares C., tiene la edad de 57 años, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de sus hijos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alfredo Jose Manzanares C. is 57 years old and works as custodian of the Oriental de Managua market. He has 3 children, 2 of which are in school. He is married and has worked with CEPRODEL for 5 years. At this point in time, he has invested 5 loans in the improvement of his home, thanks to CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The requested loan will be used for payment of manual labor and the purchase of construction materials such as iron sheets, beams, etc., which will be used to change the roof of his house. This will provide better security and quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and expansion of home.

loans.name: Priscila Alexandra

texts.es:
La Srta. Alexandra S. es socia del banco comunal San Bartolo, viven en la comunidad La libertad de San Bartolo, que se encuentra a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, es un lugar muy hermoso que cuenta con una belleza natural y vegetación exhuberante. Este Bankito esta formado por miembros de un familia que se agruparon en busca de mejores días para sus hijos y también para seguir creciendo con sus negocios.

Alexandra S. es soltera  tiene 20 años y vive en el Sector la Libertad en el  cantón  Sigsig en casa de sus padres  quienes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Alexandra se dedica a la cría de cuyes, ganado, tambien  elabora quesillo que lo  vende en su comunidad,  con los ingresos que obtiene colabora con los gastos del hogar, este es su tercer ciclo en la Fundación y  nos comenta que los créditos recibidos le han  permitido comprar sus animales, ahora  con el préstamo que le entreguen  va a  comprar  una vaca y cuyes para incrementar su criadero.

Su gran sueño es comprar una casita y un terreno.
texts.en:
Miss Alexandra S. is a member of the San Bartolo Communal Bank, whose members live in the La Libertad community of San Bartolo, about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. It’s a very beautiful place with a natural beauty and exuberant vegetation. The community bank is formed by members of a family that joined together in search of better days for their children and also to continue growing their businesses. Alexandra S. is single. She is 20 years old and lives in the sector la Libertad in the canton Sigsig. She lives with her parents who are dedicated to agriculture and livestock. Alexandra raises guinea pigs and cattle. She also makes cheese that she sells in her community. With the income she obtains, she contributes to the household expenses. This is her third cycle with the foundation, and she tells us that the loans she has received have allowed her to buy her animals. Now with the loan that you give her, she’s going to buy a cow and guinea pigs in order to increase her farm. Her biggest dream is to buy a little house and some land.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and guinea pigs

loans.name: Kiné

texts.fr: Kiné G. est une femme mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 6 ans. Elle est vendeuse de friperie, elle achète des ballots de friperies par catégorie, habits pour enfants, pour hommes, pour dames etc. et les revend dans son quartier et au marché. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille par rapport à la dépense quotidienne et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Kiné G. is married and the mother of four children. She is 30 years old, and has been a member of the « Banc Villageois » loan group of Wango for the past six years. She retails second-hand clothing, by first buying bales of used clothes in different categories (children’s clothes, men’s, women’s, etc.), and then reselling them in her neighbourhood and at the market. Her objective is to assist her husband with the daily household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase general food products

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra Damaris A. tiene un negocio de venta de carde de cerdo ubicado en el sector chaco frente al sector verdura  es casada con tres hijos en edad escolar.
Sus financiamientos siempre los ocupa para su propio negocio  para comprar chanchos o para remodelar su tramo cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  y ella administra el negocio su negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo ya que el le dio la plata para que empezaran a vender en el mercado ya que la familia de él tienen sus tramos de venta de carde de cerdo. Con la ayuda del Dios ha sabido administrar bien su negocio e inculcarles a sus hijos las buenas costumbres sus financiamientos les ha ayudado a salir adelante e ir metiéndole poco a poco a su terreno que con puro esfuerzo lo compro.
texts.en:
Mayra Damaris A. has a business selling pork, located in the Chaco market across from the vegetable section. She is married and has three school-aged children. She always uses her loans for her business, buying pigs or remodeling her sales stall. She manages the business and receives help from her husband. She began the busienss with her husband's help; he provided the money so that she could begin selling at the market, since his family members also have stalls selling pork. She says that with God's help she has been able to manage her business well and also teach her children good manners. Her loans have helped her get ahead and also build little by little on the land which she bought through her own efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying some pigs in order to sell the meat at a good price

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: A sus 52 años Lidia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, hace muchos años empezó con el negocio de abarrotes que le permitió mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y aportar para la educación de su hijo, ahora nuestra socia se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, además tiene un local que lo alquila para una ferretería Con el préstamo obtenido desea hacer mejoras en su vivienda para emprender un nuevo negocio, Lidia agradece a EDAPROSPO y KIVA por los préstamos recibidos
texts.en:
At 52 years old, Lidia is a hardworking and responsible woman. Many years ago, she started a grocery store that allowed her to better the infrastructure of her home and contribute to the education of her son. Now, our member works renting rooms, in addition, she has a place that she rents out for a hardware store. With this loan, she wishes to make improvements to her house to begin a new business. Lidia is thankful to EDAPROSPO and KIVA for the loans she's received.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is a middleman, buying rice from the local farmers to stock for resale for an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband grinds rice at home and raises pigs to help his wife.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more rice to stock for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send her children to a good school.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Serfinaz

texts.en:
Serfinaz M. is 38 years old and married, with 3 children. Serfinaz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Kalbadjar region.  She has settled in the Absheron region. 

She has been in the carpet business for 4 years. Her shop is small but very good. She is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 carpets to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy 5 carpets

loans.name: Isabel Ernestina

texts.es:
Isabel de 44 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos. Isabel era vendedora de carnes hace 12 años pero por cargar carnes tuvieron que operarla de la apéndice de urgencia, y tuvo que abandonar esa actividad por lo riesgoso que era. 

Isabel en la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta de pollos fuera de su casa, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm, comprar los pollos en criadero y ella se encarga de pelarlos y tenerlos listo para la venta. Cada pollo los vende desde $ 8.00 según la librar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos para su negocio también una parte la quiere utilizar para adecuar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener una avícola (venta al por mayor de pollos).
texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old, lives in an urban zone in the suburb of Guayaquil, and has three children. Isabel has sold meats for 12 years but while loading the meats they had to do an emergency operation on her appendix so she had to abandon this activity because of its riskiness. Currently, Isabel has a chicken stand outside of her house where she works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. She buys the chickens from a farm, and she is in charge of plucking them and getting them ready to be sold. Each chicken is sold for a minimum of $8.00, according to their weight. With this loan, Isabel would like to buy chickens for her business. She also wants to use a part of the loan to improve her house. In the future she would like to have her own poultry (sell chickens at wholesale).

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Khun Ma

texts.en: Mrs. Khun Ma O., 45, is a villager who lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Rin Leng, are farmers who own three hectares of land and a threshing machine to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Khun Ma O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to pay a laborer to plow her farm. The couple has three children; one is a driver of a threshing machine, one is a farmer and the youngest is a student in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka area of Uganda. She is married and has one child. Sylivia has a business running a retail shop, which specializes in selling coffee. Sylivia has had this business for about two years. To expand her business, Sylivia is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, a Kiva partner. The loan will be used to buy more quantities of coffee that Sylivia can sell to customers in her community. Sylivia hopes to expand her business and possibly sell other products, and gain a greater income for her family. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: Buy quantities of coffee to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, tiene 38 años, y toda su vida transcurre alrededor de constante esfuerzo, ella, está casada con Fidmer, de 33 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero sólo vive con uno de ellos, en sus casa propia. Desde muy pequeña trabaja en la chacra, porque sus padres fueron grandes agricultores que le enseñaron todas las técnicas agrícolas que ahora emplea.  De esa manera han transcurrido 15 años, cultivando papa de manera independiente, que junto a su esposo cuidan de sus plantaciones. Ella, ama la tierra que la vio nacer y desde siempre sembró grandes extensiones de papa, porque la zona donde vive es alta, lugar estratégico donde produce mejor este tubérculo. Lo que más le gusta es hacer surcos para dejarlos alineados, técnica que ayuda a desarrollarse libremente y crecer fuertes la papa, sin embargo el tener que cargar los pesados sacos y trasladarlos a los mercados le resulta pesado, por eso busca compradores directos. Con el fin de tener más ingresos económicos, desea instalar un puesto de venta en el mercado de su ciudad, para que pueda comercializar verduras y papa. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, además está contenta de trabajar en este grupo comunal, puesto que conoce a todos los integrantes que la conforman. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono para sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Rosario is 38 years old and has spent her entire life constantly working. She is married to Fidmer, age 33, and they live in their own home with only one of their three children. From a young age Rosario worked on a farm. Her parents were experienced farmers who taught her all the farming techniques that she now employs. Since then, fifteen years have passed. She now works independently growing potatoes and her husband helps with monitoring their crops. Rosario loves the land where she was born and has always planted large tracts of potatoes because the area where she lives is in high altitude, making it an ideal place for producing the best tubers. What she enjoys most is aligning the rows of potatoes, a technique that has helped her develop freely as a farmer and has resulted in successful crops. However, she has to carry heavy sacks of potatoes and transport them directly to the market where the buyers are located. She does all this in order to have more income. Rosario hopes to open a vending post at the city market where she can sell vegetables and potatoes.

This is the first time she has taken a loan with MFP. Rosario is happy to be working with this Communal Bank because she knows all of the members. The loan she requested will be used to buy several sacks of compost for her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Born in 1966, Eunice D. is the mother of three children. She has faced so many challenges as a woman, like when the cold hands of death took her mother away when still very young and when she finds it difficult to single-handedly pay tuition fees and provide the basic needs for her children. This is the first time she has requested a loan from GHAPE. As she was unable to get investment capital that would help increase her income, she was motivated to request a loan from GHAPE. 

With the loan, she plans to buy three tins of beans seedlings for 195,500FCFA and she will use 30,500FCFA to pay for labor on her farm. She will pay for clearing, hoeing and planting.

She thinks the business will succeed because she has been doing this activity for a very long time, she has a plot of land on which to operate and, also, her community will provide a ready market for her beans when they are ready. The profit obtained from this investment will be used to pay tuition fees and cover the basic needs of her children.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy beans and pay for labor

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 44 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos plásticos, se siente muy contenta por tener la oportunidad  de acceder a financiamientos.  Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante con el paso del tiempo con la ayuda de su Mama logro tener en su propio establecimiento en el mercado, por lo que se levanta muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días. Este crédito es destinado para comprar sillas, bolsas, vasos, cucharas y cubiertos.  Espera seguir ampliando su negocio y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is 44 years old. She has a business selling plastic products. She feels very pleased to have the opportunity to access a loan. For more than 14 years she sold her products as a street vendor, but over time and with the help of her mother she managed to get her own establishment in the market. She gets up very early at 5 in the morning and works until 6 in the evening each day. This loan will be used to buy chairs, bags, cups, spoons and cutlery. She hopes to continue to expand her business and have higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy plastic products

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el caserío San Carranco del distrito de Túcume, un distrito bastante conocido por sus atractivo arqueológico, en el se encuentra situado un complejo de pirámides cuya construcción data de temporadas preincaicas. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar como panadero, actualmente el cuenta con un pequeño horno instalado en su domicilio, todos los dias por la noche prepara la masa que horneará al dia siguiente muy temprano para luego distribuirla en los caseríos que se encuetran alrededor del lugar en donde vive e incluso en el distrito de Túcume. Con este negocio el solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia.

José Manuel desea ampliar su negocio fabricando mas pan, por ello ha crédito conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y materiales con los cuales pueda lograr su objetivo.

José Manuel es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y preparar mas variedad de productos. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 31 years old. He is single and lives in the community of San Carranco of the Túcume district. It is a district that is very well known for it archeological attractions. A complex of pyramids is found there whose construction dates from pre-Incan times. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and it is located approximately one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For ten years he has worked as a bread baker. Presently he has a small oven installed in his home. Every night he prepares the dough that he will bake very early the next day to distribute in the communities located near the place he lives and even in the Túcume district. He is able to pay his expenses and help his family with the business. José Manuel wants to expand his business by making more bread. For this he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that he plans on investing in purchasing ingredients and materials to attain his goal. José Manuel is a hardworking and enterprising person. His greatest wish is to keep growing as a businessman and prepare a wider variety of products. He has worked with our institution before and has shown himself to be punctual and responsible when it comes time to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and materials to increase production in a bread bakery located in his home.

loans.name: Cinthia Erikca

texts.es: La Sra.
