loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mata

texts.en:
Mata is 28 years old and a single woman.

Mata owns & operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.    Mata needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 180 talas or US $75 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2010, Mata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mata's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked goods for sale

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married and has two children ages one and two years. He describes himself as an honest and ambitious man. He is a mason and runs a retail store. He has been in the masonry business for the last six years. He has three employees. His business challenge is the high cost of building materials. James will be using the loan of 20,000 KES to buy building materials and home products for the retail store. He hopes to have had diversified his business in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy building materials and home products for the retail store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of home use products to local community members. She has been in business for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan for 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La  señora Lucila es una señora trabajadora , tiene cuarenta seis años de edad se dedica a la venta de carnes frías de marrano y de res desde hace siete  años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Domingo con quien tiene tres hijos una mujeres y dos  varones a quien quiere y  trabaja para darle lo mejor.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar  mas marranos para la matanza  ya que  se vende muy bien la carne  y le deja buenas ganancias.
Le da las gracias  ha fundación por ayudarla a seguir con su negocio
texts.en:
Lucila is a hardworking woman.  She is 46 years old and has worked for seven years selling pork and beef cold cuts.  She is happily married to Domingo, with whom she has three children, a woman and two boys, whom she loves and works to give the best.

She requested the loan to buy more pigs to butcher because the meat sells very well and gives her a good profit.

She thanks the foundation for helping her continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock in the business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a low-income person from the Agsu district, Dalilar village. He started his animal breeding business in 2000. In 2005 he borrowed his first loan  of $300 from Normicro, Agsu branch. Now he borrows $600 from Normicro to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 2 head of cattle

loans.name: Logitu

texts.en:
Logitu is one of the veteran members in the program. She started with a pancake business, but now has a general store at the front of her house. The shop was financed and planned when she started in the SPBD program. The idea came from her eldest son: He knows that she is not suited for doing any home duties such as grass weeding, so he decided to run a shop, and Logitu is responsible for looking after it.

The shop is open seven days a week, from six o'clock in the morning to ten at night. The maximum profit that she can earn a week is between 500 and 1000 ST (USD180-360). This money is then used to buy goods for the shop, and what is left goes for her savings and the loan payment.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to stock the shop

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 34 and has 3 children aged 4-14. The family has been making a living by raising pigs and chickens, and farming a small rice field and fruit garden. Two years ago, her husband Khoat found work as a builder in Vinh City, 20 km away . From his salary and her first loans, they bought a water buffalo which they use to plow both their own and the rice fields of their neighbours. Mrs. L. now wants to buy more pigs and also try to raise ducks.

loans.use: To buy ducks and pigs

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun K. L. is 25 years old, married with 1 child. She lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, and works at a garment factory, earning around $6 each day. Her husband works for a private company as a security guard and typically earns $1 to $2 each day.

Mrs. Lun K. L.' s husband would like to start a taxi service in their area. Mrs. L. requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a car so her husband can start a taxi service.

loans.use: Purchase a simple car to start a taxi service.

loans.name: Rui João

texts.pt:
Rui João M. is 34 years old, he lives with his wife and 4 children. He joined the credit program in 2006, his first loan was of 6.000MT. He is now in the 4th cycle of the program and requests a loan of 10.000MY to be repaid in 6 months. He has invested all loans in construction in Khongolote and has never been late with a payment.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Rui João M. tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 4 filhos.Entrou para o programa em Maio de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Vai para o 4º ciclo de empréstimo e vai tomar 10.000MT para pagra em 6 meses. Tem aplicado todo o valor dos empréstimos na construção em Khongolote e nunca teve atrsos no reembolso.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi V., 43 years old, and her husband live in Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province. In her province, almost everybody relies solely on the rice fields for their livings. If one wants to earn extra money, they have to work for someone else. Besides working on the rice-field, Mrs. V.’s husband also works as a construction worker. Mrs. V. herself makes wooden basket to increase her family income. These jobs help her life less difficult. She wants to borrow 450USD to buy more pigs and chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị V., 43 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Ở vùng quê chị đang sinh sống công việc chủ yếu của mỗi gia đình là làm ruộng. Nếu muốn có thêm thu nhập thì phải đi làm thuê. Chồng chị đã không vất vả, ngoài công việc đồng áng anh còn đi xây kiếm thêm tiền. Chị cũng là người siêng năng nên nhận thêm việc làm thúng để tăng thu nhập. Có nghề phụ kinh tế gia đình đỡ vất vả hơn. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị đề nghị vay mức 450USD về mua thêm lợn gà để chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs, chickens

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru:
Emomali B., who is 58, is married and has 3 children. Emomali has been in the business of selling men's clothing for 3 years. For that reason, he rents a space in the market called "Kovron", in the city of Dushanbe, which is recognized as the biggest market in the country. He plans to use funds from the loan to purchase winter clothing, which he obtains directly from distributors. Because this market is visited by people from all over Tajikistan, they will have an opportunity to purchase his products at moderate prices as prices at "Kovron" are a lot lower than at other markets. Emomali plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

. Боронов Эмомали, возраст – 58 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Эмомали занимается продажей мужской одеждой в течение 3 лет, для этого он арендует торговую точку на рынке в городе Душанбе, под названием «Корвон», который является самым крупным рынком в Таджикистане на сегодняшний день. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение нового зимнего товара, который он приобретает у поставщиков. Так как на данный рынок приезжают жители со всего Таджикистана, они будут иметь возможность приобрести необходимый им товар по умеренным ценам, так как здесь цены намного ниже чем на других рынках. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothes for winter season

loans.name: Haydee Jesús

texts.es: Haydee

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en: Adelaide A. has been running her own general store for the past 8 years.  She is married and has 4 children.  She is requesting $525 to buy items for her store (i.e. stationary, water and vitamins).  Adelaide is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy items for her general store (i.e. stationary, water and vitamins).

loans.name: Prisca's Upendo 2 Group

texts.en: Prisca is 23  years old, single, and has a child who is 4 years old. Prisca sells oil, diesel, kerosine and bolt. She started this sales business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7:30 am until 7 pm and is now hoping to receive a loan to buy more  items for sale. Prisca will share this loan with her sub-group member Jamila who has a food sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for a business

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokorn N. and her husband (pictured here) live in a Cambodian village located 17 kilometers from the capital city of Phnom Penh. They have two young daughters who are in grade school.

They earn a living by selling fish. They buy them directly from the fishermen and then resell them at a market called Prek Phnao Market. Besides selling fihs, they supplement their income by growing rice as well. Sokorn is requesting a loan of $200 U.S. dollars to purchase more fish to sell so that they can grow their business and income.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario Group

texts.en: Teresa is a very intelligent and hard-working woman who lives in the town of Samana with her three children, ages five, 14, and 15. She sells fried and baked bread outsiD. of her house, and hopes to expand her business. With this loan she plans to buy flour, coconut, and sugar, which she uses to make sweet bread. In her free time she attends church and spends time with her friends. She looks forward to being able to create a better future for herself and her family, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase flour, coconut, and sugar to make bread

loans.name: Thi Hoan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đỗ Thị Hoán (MS: 030001), 43 years old, lives with husband and two children. The family’s average monthly income is 2,500,000 VND. She likes the loan offered by SEDA and is excited to join. She is applying for a loan of 4,256,000 VND to invest in livestock and business of bamboo handicraft. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount of 3,360,000 VND.
  • Hoàng Thị Liễu (MS: 030003), 48 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.
  • Trần Thị Thu (MS: 030004), 30 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.
  • Hoàng Thị Thường (MS: 030005), 52 years old, applies for a loan to buy raw material for making brooms, fans.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 030007), 40 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Đỗ Thị Hoán (MS: 030001), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con. Cô và chồng thường ngày đan các giỏ hoa để bán cho các của hàng buôn hoa. Ngoài ra cô còn chăn nuôi để có thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô là80.000 VND/ngày. Cô rất thích với việc trả dần vốn vay, vì vậy cô luôn mong muốn được tham gia vay vốn chương trình. Cô vay 4.256.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi và đan lát.
  • Trong nhóm còn có:
  • Cô Hoàng Thị Liễu (MS: 030003), năm nay 48 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Chị Trần Thị Thu (MS: 030004), năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị vay 3.360.000 VND đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Cô Hoàng Thị Thường (MS: 030005), năm nay 52 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để mua nguyên liệu làm quạt, chổi.
  • Cô Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 030007), năm nay 40 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: livestock and bamboo handicraft

loans.name: Violeta Group

texts.en:
Before becoming associates of Esperanza, Yecenia and Manuel lived with their five children in a one-room shack with a tin roof, tin walls, and a dirt floor. Manuel worked at a candy producing factory, while Yecenia had no means of income at all. Their one-and-a-half-year-old child was malnourished, looking as if he had been born only three months prior. As Yecenia and Manuel began their first loan cycle, their child died because of complications due to malnourishment. Despite efforts by their loan officer and community members, the child could not be saved.

With their first loan, Yecenia and her husband bought tools, two sacks of sugar, and other ingredients necessary to make sugar cane sticks. Using the knowledge gained from his previous employment, Manuel maD. the candy while Yecenia sold it around the neighborhood. With each of their three following payments, Yecenia and Manuel have been able to expand their business to incluD. four more types of candy and a vendor who takes the highway to the center of Santo Domingo to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and ingredients in order to continue candy production

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena is a 41 year old woman from the small village of Kožuhe, near the town Doboj. She works at a petrol station, and her monthly salary is 400 KM. Sometimes Milena sells fruits and vegetables at the market during the weekend to supplement her income, and she needs a reliable car to drive her goods to the market.

This is Milena’s first loan through "Women for Women International," and she is asking for 1000 KM. She will use this loan to repair her car, so that she may sell her wares at the market.

loans.use: To repair her car so that she may sell vegetables and fruits at the market.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania!

Asha Mwagu is a Tanzanian married women and a SELFINA client. She is 35 years old with three children aged between 4 and 14. Asha established her bar and poultry businesses two years ago. She has been earning a monthly profit of about US$ 580 from these businesses.

Asha is requesting a loan of US$ 875 in order to buy additional drinks for her bar such as sodas and beer, and also to purchase additional chicks in her poultry business. Asha is assisted by her husband and one employee in running these businesses. In future she plans to open another business. She thank you for your support.

A Tanzanian bar is a good place to relax with a beer. If you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. You can relax on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting 'mishikaki' (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to everyone who happens to wander by.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To buy additional drinks for her bar; also to purchase additional chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es: La señora Maria Fedelina habita el barrio Walter Ferreti, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 54 años de edad, se encuentra casada con el señor Nestor Zeledón que es supervisor, ambos tienen 4 hijos. Actualmente la señora Maria Fidelina se dedica a la venta de lotería y de productos naturales, hace mas de 13 años tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad, donde en conjunto de su marido han venido trabajan con mucho esfuerzo para poder siempre ayudar a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, por tanto esta solicitando un crédito d e C$ 10,000 a un plazo de  6 meses para comprar mas productos naturales y mas lotería,  de esta forma poder incrementar su clientes y su niveles de ingreso para seguir realizando mejoras en la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Fedelina lives in the Walter Ferreti neighborhood located in the capital city of Managua. She is 54 years old and is married to Nestor Zeledon who is a supervisor. They have four children. Maria Fidelina currently dedicates herself to the sale of lottery tickets and natural products. She has been in this business for more than 13 years together with her husband. They put a lot of effort into their work in order to help their family and improve their children's quality of life. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $525 which she will repay in six months. The loan will be used to purchase more natural products and lottery tickets. This will allow her to increase the number of clients and her income so that she can keep improving her family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory of natural products and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Meng Hoen

texts.en: Mrs. Meng Hoen C. is a villager in Treuy Treoung village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sambath Phearak, is a blacksmith. Even though they both have businesses, they do not have much money to cover their living expenses, and now their house is old. Thus, Mrs. Meng Hoen C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build her house. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the youngest is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build her house.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: N. Sarah is 42 years old and a member of Pearl Microfinance in Lugazi. She has 7 children who are all in school and she cares for 3 more relatives. Sarah is a farmer. She also buys produce from other farmers, especially matooke, cassava, maize, and beans. She has been in this business for 8 years and ha been member of her lending group for 10 years. Her first loan helped her start to buy produce from fellow farmers. As a result, she has been able to construct a residential home as well as pay the school fees for her children. Sarah needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for her customers.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her customers.

loans.name: Zareena M.hanif Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji is a 52-year-old married lady and lives in a small area called Riwind in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She is an uneducated lady and she doesn’t hesitate to mention that she comes from a poor family and her parents couldn’t cover her education expenses. Her husband's name is M. H. and he is a farmer. She is the mother of five sons. Her eldest son has a fruit-selling business. The others work in a factory for monthly wages. Zareena baji belongs to a decorative embroidery business. She makes embroidered dresses and sells them in clothing markets, charging US$ 3 per dress. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to expand her son’s fruit-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart to transport loads. Nabila baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food-selling business. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a bicycle to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for fruit-selling business

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun N., 27, and her husband, Mr. Than Ros, 28, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 2002 and have one young daughter.

Hun has been a silk weaver for fourteen years, a skill she learned from a nearby villager. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a truck driver for eight years.

Hun is requesting her first loan of US$ 150 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong Y. is 55 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She has two children: one serves as a firewood provider, and another one works and lives separately. Y. is married to Sroe, 33, who grows potatoes in his field. Y. sells groceries, such as cooked food, plastic, and kids' sweets. She wakes up in the early morning for the garment workers' arrival so that she can earn enough money. To help increase the family's income, Y. is requesting a loan to buy more grocery products for her store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma, pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 30 años de edad, con 2 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercero de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años e inició su negocio de comercialización de variedad de productos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo en su negocio en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
En el momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para poder incrementar un mayor capital de trabajo, es decir comprar mas mercadería (regalos, vajillas, utensilios de cocina, juegos recreativos, etc.) para su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos para seguir ampliando su negocio; asimismo tiene el compromiso firme de cumplir con sus pagos, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma belongs to the community bank "El Comercio", from the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old, has 2 children, and has an incomplete high school education (3rd year). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years, and started her business selling a variety of products with an initial loan of S/.300.00 New Soles, which she invested to increase her working capital for her business in the Desaguadero district. Right now she needs a loan of S/.3,000 New Soles to increase her inventory and buy gift items, kitchen utensils, games, etc., for her store so that she can continue to expand her business and increase profits. She has vowed to stay up-to-date with her payments, according to the group's agreement.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para mercadería:regalos,vajillas,utensilios de cocina,juegos recreativos,etc.

loans.name: Yok

texts.en:
A gentle face with a great, admirable attitude from Phnom Penh, Cambodia living in a family she leads. Widowed mother E., 60, is the mother of four children: one is married and lives separately, the second two are single and sell vegetables in the market, and the last one is a student.

E. has earned her living selling vegetables in the market for more than five years. This is the harvest season; E. wants to increase the income from her stall. Therefore she is applying for a loan of $900 to buy more vegetables for her to sell.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her stall

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana tiene 20 años de edad, vive son su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, habitan en la casa de sus padres. Este año ha sembrado alverjas, papas y olluco en las chacras de sus padres, su esposo es el encargado de arar y preparar la tierra con las yuntas. Este tipo de trabajo se realiza en las chacras que han descansado de producir de 2 a 3 años. Ya que luego de este tiempo, resulta ser muy fértil y no requieren de muchos fertilizantes químicos. A Maximiliana le gusta el trabajo agrícola, ya que desde niña creció con estas labores, y ahora con la ayuda de su esposo el trabajo se hace más ligero. Sus planes a futuro son de seguir sembrando, además su madre le propuso traspasarle su tienda, a lo que ha aceptado, y empezará a trabajar en ella para que poco a poco pueda pagarle a su madre el valor de su bodega. Este es su 8vo préstamo consecutivo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha trabajado con responsabilidad, y en su cargo de tesorera cumple cabalmente sus funciones, así como con cada una de sus cuotas señaladas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, asimismo para pagar parte del traspaso de la tienda de su madre.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 20 years old and lives with her partner, the father of her 2 children and they live in her parents' house. This year they have sowed peas, potatoes and yams in her parents' plantation fields. Her husband is responsible for the plowing and preparation of the fields. This type of work is carried out the fields only after they have been rested from cultivation for 2 or 3 years. This down time allows the fields to be very fertile and do not require many additional fertilizers. Maximiliana loves to be a farmer, something she has been doing since she was a little girl and now with the help of her husband her work is much lighter. Her plans for the future are to keep sowing and her mother also proposed giving her the store and she has accepted. She will start working in the store and with time she will be able to pay her mother the value of the grocery store. This is her eighth consecutive loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and all this time she has been participating responsibly. In her role as the treasurer she has been carrying out her duties and she has been making her payments on time. The funds that she is requesting now will be used to purchase fertilizers and some of the money will be used to pay for the handover of the store from her mother.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 35-year-old businesswoman. She is a wife and mother of four kids who are currently in school. She trades in pork. She buys the pork from nearby villages and supplies it to restaurant operators as meat for their meals. Pork is enjoyed in many Ghanaian homes because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable.

Martha's business progress is slow because of inadequate funds to buy the pork from the farmers. With the loan, she wants to buy more pork to serve her customers good quality meat for their meals. She believes the loan will enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She also hopes to save more to support her kids in school.

Martha belongs to the community group called Shining Star Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure more pigs to sell as meat

loans.name: Lauro Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Lauro Gerardo G. vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos. 
Como desea tener su propia vivienda está tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental). Pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo, el  trabajo como mesero en un restauran de un hotel.
Por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para completar el crédito gubernamental y así adquirí su casa. Desea tener un patrimonio seguro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lauro Gerardo G. lives in a house that has been lent to him, along with his wife and three children. Since he would like to have his own house, he is applying for a house through Infonavit (governmental credit). However, the value of the house is more than the loan he can receive because his income is low. He works as a waiter in a hotel restaurant. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to complement the government loan so that he can buy his house. He wants to provide his children a secure future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The difference on the down payment to purchase a house through Infonavit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of chick-feed in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fashion accessories to sell

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Куватов Шерали проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Шерали имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует национальными материалами. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 15 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sherali K. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 53 years old. He is married and has eight children. Sherali has a vendor spot on the market where he sells national fabrics. He has been in this business for more than fifteen years. He is asking for a loan to increase turnaround of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Биробия

texts.ru: Джумаева Биробия 1966 года рождения. Замужем имеет троих детей . Муж работает маляром в частной фирме. Биробия занимается продажей парфюмерии на базаре Костокоз. Товар она закупает на оптовом рынке города Истаравшана. Она планирует закупить  новую коллекцию духов и тем самим разнообразить свой ассортимент.

loans.use: На закупку духов

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 40 year old woman who is married with five children aged between 22 and 28 years. None of her children go to school. She resides in a three room house where she stays with four people. Mariam doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She doesn’t incur any extra transport costs, as she buys from her place of work. She buys her bananas from delivery vans, and sells to 30 customers a day, both retail and wholesale.  Mariam works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence plus medication costs. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Mariam has been with MCDT for five years and is now servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas for resale. Mariam aspires to see her business grow bigger, as well as own a permanent business premise and home.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Larina

texts.en:
Larina own and manage a her village store in Annayatan, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 39 years old and married to Danilo who is a farmer. Their children are: Dandy - 16 years old, taking an automotive course;Dindy, 15 years old, third year high school and Lorina, 13 years old, a first year high school student. 

She hopes that her business will become progressive so that someday, her children will not experience the difficulties of life that they have been through. She also wanted them to become successful in the future.  The couple is working hard to support their studies and send them until college.

Larina is now requesting to borrow a loan of PHP5,000  from KIVA lenders that she can use for the expansion of her store. She hopes to purchase stocks of merchandise to retail that will somehow increase her daily income.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es: La señora Juana Elena Báez de 60 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora que desde joven trabaja para ayudar a sus padres. Luego que se caso  opto por trabajar en la costura para apoyar a su esposo, procreo 4 hijos que viven independiente, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, un tiempo trabajo en fabrica haciendo ropa para importarla pero, luego decidió hacer la costura en su casa, con este financiamiento comprara materia prima para hacer la costura como: tela, hilos, bordados, botones entre otros. Es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic el cual agradece por la oportunidad de poder aumentar su venta en la hecha de ropa. Las dificultades que tiene es cuando se va la luz y no puede terminar la costura y se atrasa con los pedidos de sus clientes .Sus planes a futuro es invertir mas, comprar otra maquina para seguir dando un buen servicios a sus clientes.

loans.use: Comprar tela, hilos,bordados, botones y otros

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
Epifanio is 68 years old, and is married to Ernesta, a retired teacher. They have two grown children who are married and have their own homes. Ever since Epifiano was little he was devoted to shoes, a profession he learned from his father. When he was 22 he married his wife and they decided to engage in commerce by setting up a small grocery business at home. 
Today his grocery store is run by his daughter while he manages his shoe business. He is using his loan to buy leather soles and glue, which are materials used in his line of work for making footwear.

loans.use: Leather Soles and Glue for footwear

loans.name: Ernanie

texts.en:
34-year-old Ernanie D. is a corn farmer. He has been a CEVI client for quite a long time. He maintains his good performance by conscientiously making his loan payments. He said that his loans are truly helping him sustain his livelihood. His business provides the income he utilizes to buy food, clothing and other basic needs at home.

He would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy corn seed and farming necessities that will improve his harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita C. is 47 years old and a hog raiser in the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is married to Hilario and blessed with eight school-age children.  Julita hopes that their children will finish their college education. Despite the difficulties of life, the couple is striving to improve their living conditions. Julita is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to Php6,000. She plans to purchase a supply of feed for her hogs with the additional business capital the loan will bring.

loans.use: Additional capital for her hog raising business

loans.name: Phem

texts.en: Phem V., 30, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a dessert selling business, earning about $4 per day. Her husband always helps her with the business. Also he provides taxi services in town with his motorbike, earning about $5 a day to help cover the family expenses, when the motorbike is working. V. and her husband strive to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, V. requests a loan of $600 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old motorbike is not reliable and often breaks down.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita es comerciante ambulante de bolígrafos, pañales, pañuelos higiénicos y otros; el esposo trabaja en una empresa como chofer. Así complementan sus  ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de su familia.

Vive en la ciudad de El Alto, zona Villa Tunari.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de más productos, indicados arriba, para la temporada navideña, para lograr ingresos extras.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sarita peddles pens, diapers, sanitary napkins and other items. Her husband is employed as a driver. Together they pool their earnings to cover family expenses. She lives in the city of El Alto which is in Villa Tunari zone. The financing will be used to buy more products like those listed above to earn extra income during the Christmas season. This is her second loan with Impro and her evaluation indicates that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pens, diapers, sanitary napkins,etc.

loans.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae, 24 years old, has been married to her husband Rolan since 2005. They have a 4-year old child. 

Ana does farming for a living. She also runs a sari-sari (general) store, which provides daily income for her family. She dreams that someday she will be successful in her business. Ana and her husband cultivate their land for rice crops. Ana tell us that they are now preparing for planting. 

In December 2007, Ana Mae joined CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines. Her previous loans helped sustain their farm and her small store. In times of crisis, Ana Mae finds comfort through Biblical Reflections during Cluster Meetings. Ana is now requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She will use this loan to finance her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment such as plates, containers etc for the business.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur F. is married and has three children. He is 39 years old. Teymur and his family live in the Fuzuli region. This man has been in the auto repair business for nine years. Now he needs a loan of $2500 to buy spare parts to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Félix Jose

texts.es: El señor Félix tiene el negocio de panadería, el crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en el mismo y sacar mas producción, el señor Félix antes de tener el negocio era trabajador de otra panadería y después el fue poniendo la de él poco a poco comenzó con un pequeño préstamo y así fue creciendo esto para poder tener mejor ganancia y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, es padre y esposo y todo lo hace por ellos para poder sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Felix has a bakery and is asking for this loan to invest in his business and increase production. He worked in another bakery before starting his own. He started little by little, with the help of a small loan, and grew his business in order to increase his income and give a better life to his family. He is a father and a husband and he does it all to help his family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el Mercado Ivan Montenegro en Managua, la señora Ana del Socorro R. se dedica a la venta de frutas como mangos, mandarinas y otros siendo vendidos a diario por ella misma cortandolas en rodajas y poniendolas en bolsas plásticas. Ella a diario se esfuerza por vender dichas frutas en bolsa para obtener los ingresos que le permitan el sustento en su hogar.

El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de mangos, jocotes y bolsas para llevar a cabo su actividad. Es importante destacar que también comprará golosinas para venderlas y así atraer mas clientes a su local.
texts.en:
At the Mayoreo Market in Managua, Mrs. Ana del Socorro R. sells fruit such as mangos, tangerines and others. Every day, she makes an effort to sell her fruit so that she can earn enough to support her household. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy mangoes and jocotes (hog plums), but she will also buy candy in order to attract customers to her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruit

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: María, D. 47 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo Víctor Manuel (55) y su hijo Víctor (21).DesD. hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta D. ropa por pedidos. Frecuentemente visita las casas D. sus vecinas, amigas y algunos familiares para ofrecer las más variadas prendas que adquiere en una galería comercial. Cada vez que compra  su mercadería se esfuerza en que los modelos sean variados  y D. diferentes colores, gracias a su buen gusto no es difícil que se acaben rápido todas las  prendas. Además espera en el futuro instalar  su propia tienda D. ropa donD. pueda  ofrecer, con mayor comodidad, toda su mercadería. Cada día coloca  las prendas en maniquís para que se aprecien mejor, y sabe que todo trabajo requiere D. gran esfuerzo y que aún le falta mucho camino por recorrer, pero sabe que si continua  poniendo empeño en su trabajo, como hasta ahora, logrará cumplir todas sus metas.Es su primer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos, ya que quiere seguir solicitando más préstamos.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra D. mayor cantidad D. mercadería en ropa, para así obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her husband Victor Manuel (55) and her son Victor (21). For the past 3 years she has been selling clothes on order. She often visits her neighbors, friends and some relatives to offer a variety of garments which she buys at a local mall. She makes an effort every time she buys clothes to have a variety of models and different colors and thanks to her good taste it is not difficult for her to sell her garments fast. For the future she hopes to set up her own store where she can offer her merchandise more comfortably. Every day the garments are placed on mannequins in order to look better and she is aware that all work requires a huge effort and that she still needs to improve, but she knows that if she continues making an effort, as up to now, she will be able to fulfill her goals. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to repay punctually as she wishes to continue asking for more loans. Maria plans to invest the money in purchasing more garments in order to obtain higher economic income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for business

loans.name: Julia Xiomara

texts.es: Julia Xiomara es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora de 31 años de edad. Trabaja de una manera independiente pues su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, inició su negocio por esfuerzos propios con la venta de ropa más tarde es que decide recurrir a las casa comerciales para la venta de cosméticos,  al ver que tenia ciertos clientes decide mantener este negocio, ya que tiene la obligación de mantener a sus 2 hijos. Es por eso que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Por lo que sueña con mejorar seguirle brindando a su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Julia Xiomara is an enterprising and hard-working 31 year old woman. She works in an independent way. She sells general merchandise. She started her business through her own efforts. She started selling clothes, and she later decided to turn to the commercial houses to sell cosmetics. Upon seeing that she had regular customers, she decided to maintain this business. She did this because she has an obligation to support her two children. That is why she is asking for this loan to buy raw material. She dreams of improving and continuing to provide her family with their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Many of Cambodia’s people earn a living as fishermen. One of these citizens, Mrs. Ly V., age 32, is a fish catcher. She has lived with her five family members for years in a medium-sized wooden house along the river side of the province of Siem Reap.

Ly V. and her husband sometimes prepare their net and trap and push them in the water in the evening and then pull the tool back the next morning with many fishes. They bring the fish to sell at formal place located around the river. They are able to earn $6 a day to provide for their family’s daily needs. Ly V. is applying for a loan to buy a boat to provide faster transportation to the fishing place.

loans.use: To buy a boat to get to the fishing place faster

loans.name: Elvy Torres Group

texts.en:
Elvy T. is from the village of Bato. She is 26 years old. Elvy is the group leader for a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member, if the other one is delinquent or defaults.

Elvy is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Elvy owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Elvy has been engaged in her business for over 8 years, and she earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elvy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Elvy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Elvy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Xiomara Magalis

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Magalis G. G., es una joven de 27 años de edad, soltera sin hijos que a su corta edad labora desde hace 15 años en la agricultura.

Uno de sus principales objetivos es la edificación de su propia vivienda, pero uno de los obstáculos que ha tenido en su carrera como agricultora, ha sido el robo de las cosechas que afecta de sobremanera sus ingresos. Fue con el apoyo económico y moral de su padre, que se inicio en este negocio, ahora ella solicita  de un préstamo para la diversificación de siembras que se consumen en masa, ya sea en la capital o sectores aledaños, con el crédito realizará las compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, que aporten a este fin , y le permitan a futuro la planificación de la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara is a young person that is 27 years old, single and without children. Despite her young age, she has worked for fifteen years in agriculture. One of her main goals is to have a home. One of the obstacles she faces, that she has experienced in her agricultural career, is the way the theft of crops greatly affects earnings. It is with the economic support of her parents, who began this agricultural business, that she is requesting this loan. The loan will be used to provide a greater variety of plants that are generally utilized in the capital city or the outskirts. With this loan she will buy supplies, plants, fertilizers and pesticide, which will help her reach her goals. This will allow her to plan the construction of her house in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy pesticides, fertilizers and growing supplies

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza O. is from the village of Caluya. She is 50 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a business selling of own-made "nipa" native roofs. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Liza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase to pawned a parcel of nipa plantation. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Liza from PMPC.
 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pawned a parcel of nipa plantation

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Operating a farm has been a tremendous business venture for K. Peninah from Kafunga, Ibanda.

Having had a big family of six children and one dependent with a careless husband who does no productive work, Peninah worked tooth and nail to start up the sale of bananas which are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda. She is so fond of her business and she is able to earn 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings as profits monthly.

This loan is to help Peninah do the mulching, buy stake poles for her plantation and pesticides. Further more, the expansion of her banana plantation project into a large-scale operation is her main motive for this loan. This will help her improve her production and sales revenue to enable her take care of her family.

loans.use: To expand her plantation project and buy mulches, stake poles and pesticides for increased production

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: Luis Eduardo tiene 46 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de electrodoméstico. Pues inicio desde muy joven, pues el inicio como aprendiz ya que con el tiempo fue aprendiendo poco a poco además le gustaba mucho relacionarse con sus clientes, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar cada día su actividad, es por eso que se siente muy contento con este financiamiento que solicito para realizar las compras de su herramientas que son necesarias. el sueño de él es tener su propio taller.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo, 46, services home appliances. He started very young, beginning as an apprentice and learning bit by bit, and very much enjoying interacting with his clients. He is always thinking how to improve his business every day, and therefore is very pleased with this loan he is requesting in order to complete the purchase of necessary tools. His dream is to have his own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his truck.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola N. is 19 years-old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Viola has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Viola hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food and clothes for her children.  In the future, Viola hopes to enlarge her business

Note to lenders:   BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. Initially, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, particularly girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future.  The program targets a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Silvia Elizabeth Mejía S., Casada, guatemalteca, de 24 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos la cual lo inicio con pequeño capital que habia ahorrado hace 3 años, ahora es un negocio muy rentable para ella ya que con esto ha sufragado sus necesidades básicas como alimentación y educación  para sus hijos, por lo cual necesita ampliar su capita de trabajo y asi poder invertirlo, para esto acudió a la oficina de la Asociación Asdir para la solicitud de un préstamo, y con esto poder comprar mas aves y  aumentar sus ganancias, solo así mejorará sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia Elizabeth Mejía S. is a 24 year old married Guatemalan woman who raises and sells chickens. She started this business with little working capital that she had saved for three years. Now it’s a very profitable business and she has been able to pay for her basic needs, such as food, and education for her children. She needs to increase her working capital so that she can invest into her business. She has approached the office of Asociación Asdir to request this loan, so that she can use the money to buy more birds and increase her earnings. Only this way will she be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha T. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 55 years old. Editha is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Editha is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock, feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Editha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, feed & other supplies

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Муродов Фуркат проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Furkat M. lives in Hamadoni. He is 36 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education. He has been working in animal husbandry for more than twelve years. He fattens and sells cattle. He is taking out a loan to buy more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
el señor Jose Balbino R. C. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Denia Elizabeth Colindres tienen cinco hijos.
Jose y su familia viven en la aldea Altos de la Cruz desde hace 1 año y se dedican a la elaboracion y venta de ladrillos y tejas, dicho producto se elabora con tierra, barro  para luego ser quemado en un horno a base de fuego con leña.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima y continuar elaborando ladrillos y tejas para lograr tener mas utilidades y por ende darles una mejor calidad vida a su familia.
su meta es comprarse un mejor vehiculo para transportar el producto.
texts.en:
Mr. José Balbino R. C. is 34 years old and married to Mrs. Denia Elizabeth Colindres. They have five children. José and his family have lived in Altos de la Cruz for a year and work making and selling bricks and tiles. They make these products with dirt and clay and then bake them in a wood-burning stove.

He will use the loan to buy materials to keep making brick and tile to have more profits and give his family a better quality of life. His goal is to buy a vehicle to transport his products.

loans.use: Fo buy firewood, dirt, and clay

loans.name: Sokhann

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhann P. and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Sat (pictured with her husband), live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have two sons and two daughters. Two of them work with their parents and the other two attend school.

Sokhann and his wife are vegetable farmers. They grow cauliflower, cucumbers and other crops. Sokhann has asked for a MAXIMA loan once before. He hopes to continue increasing his productivity, so he has decided to request a second loan of 1,200 USD. He will use the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides and pay for plowing to maintain his vegetable farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Peter Gitimu

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years old and divorced with one son. He owns a rice farm in Embu and has been in the business for 29 years. He earns an income of 15,000 KES a month.

He is taking his 3rd loan with Kadet. He wants to use the loan to lease an extra half acre, buy fertilizer, fungicides, and pay for labour.  He hopes to make his son happy and help him attain his goals in the future. He also hopes to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To lease an extra half acre, buy fertilizer, fungicides, and pay for labour.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn D. R. is a rice farmer from the town of Santo Niño. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children ages 12, 10 and 2. She wants her children to be able to finish their studies.

Roselyn owns and tills her own land. She plants and harvests rice crops for sale. She wants her service to their community to be better so she aims for quality rice. Roselyn's rice farm needs additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She likes its services, especially that it comes with a microinsurance program. She is hopeful that her loan will be very useful for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en:
Zosimo Y. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 61 years old. Zosimo is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Zosimo owns & operates a business venture providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport services. Zosimo is just starting this business.

Zosimo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosimo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Zosimo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua K. sells roasted maize mixed with groundnuts, cloth and cassava in Abura. Ekua has received a junior-high education. She is divorced and has two children. She has been in this trade for seven years. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cloth to expand her business. She sees to the well-being of the family. The profits that will be acquired as a result of the loan will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: The loan she is requesting  will be used to buy cloth to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build up the business by increasing the stock

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a married woman with two children, both of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over thirty years, she has operated a water point-selling business from home, selling to her neighbours. In addition, she also sells food items, which brings in another source of income. Saida faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season the demand for water is minimal. She hopes to operate a retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of potatoes, wheat flour, oil and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple loaning procedures.

loans.use: To purchase stock of potatoes, wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Deysi Janet

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 30 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el caserio Cruce D. Vega ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícoL. que se encuentra situada en L. provincia D. Piura, en L. región del mismo nombre, a más D. cuatro horas D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. L. región Lambayeque.

ElL. cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su vivienda, allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes y vecinos diversas golosinas. Adicionalmente comercializa productos D. belleza por catálogo entre los clientes que llegan a su tienda, actividad que realiza hace seis años. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, gracias a L. buena atención que Deysi ofrece. Esta actividad le hace sentir bastante activa y con las ganancias que obtiene se encarga D. sacar adelante a su familia.

Deysi desea ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. más productos, ya que desea en esta temporada aumentar sus ventas diarias. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Deysi is 30 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and their four children in the small village of Cruce D. Vega, which is located in the TambogranD. district. This is an agricultural zone in the Piura province, which is in the region with the same name, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.
She runs a small business from her home. From here, she sells candies to her neighbors and other customers. She also sells beauty products from a catalog to the customers who come to her store. She has been doing this for 6 years. The business has been very well received thanks to the good service that Deysi provides. This business makes her feel active, and the income that she makes helps her family to move forward in life.
Deysi wants to grow her business and buy more products - this season she wants to increase her daily sales. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $275 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Amé Mawulawoé

texts.fr: Dame  Mawulawoè   habite Djidjolé. Elle  a 44 ans et est mariée. Elle a 2 enfants à charge.   Pour participer  au  ménage, elle fait la restauration.  Elle achète les ingrédients de restauration  au grand  marché  de Lomé.  Elle revend à côté  de  la  pharmacie Djidjolé  après  préparation.  Elle a commencé  en 2009 cette  activité  et  a employé 2 personnes.  Elle sollicite de  WAGES un prêt  pour acheter  5 sacs de maïs  et  5  sacs  de riz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mawulawoè lives in Djidjolé. She's 44 years old, married, and has two children to support. To provide for her household, she runs a food serving business. She buys ingredients at the Grand Market in Lomé, and sells the prepared meals next to the pharmacy in Djidjolé.

She started this business in 2009, and used to employ two persons. She's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 5 sacks of corn and 5 sacks of rice.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of corn and 5 sacks of rice for her food serving business

loans.name: Astria

texts.es: Astria tiene 44 años, nacida en el distrito de San Francisco; esta casada con Severino de 44 años de edad y tienen 09 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa ubicado en la avenida Tupac Amaru del distrito de Kimbiri. Astria y su esposo son el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, Astria es campesina y cuenta con 05 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café y plantas de piña, frutos de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 22 años en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de la mano de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos y frutos de piña. Su dificultad es no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los créditos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de piña ya que cuenta con 02 hectareas de terreno no cultivado. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en la cosecha.
texts.en:
Astria is 44 years old and was born in the District of San Francisco.  She is married to Severino, age 44, and they have nine children.  They have their own home located along Tupac Amaru Avenue in the District of Kimbiri.  Astria and her husband are the breadwinners of their family.  When Astria was a young girl, her parents taught her how to work on a farm.  She is now a farmer and has five hectares of land on which she plants coffee and pineapples, tropical fruits grown in the Apurimac River Valley.  Astria has worked on her land for 22 years, and during the harvest season she has the help of her children and the labor of workers who can pick the fruit with great speed.  She considers the most difficult part of her job to be transporting her products from the farm to the distribution centers in the city of San Francisco, the place that offers the best prices for grain and pineapples.  Her difficulty is when she lacks sufficient income to pay her workers in advance since they provide assistance during the harvest.  For this reason, she has taken out loans with institutions such as MFP.  Now her highest priority is to plant more pineapples since she has two hectares of land that have not been cultivated.  

This is her seventh loan with MFP.  Astria feels the support has helped her greatly in making progress in her work.  In her Communal Bank, she is well-respected by the other members.  The loan of 2000 PEN that she is requesting will be used to hire workers to help with the harvest.

loans.use: To hire workers to help with the harvest.

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es: Yovana de 26 años, natural de la comunidad la Libertad anexo del distrito de Quimbiri; esta casada con Alfredo de 30 años de edad y tienen 02 hijas Rosalía de 09 y  Gressy de 07 meses de nacida y juntos viven en su propio lote a medio construir situado en el distrito de Quimbiri. Yovana, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo trata de sobresalir ante las adversidades del destino. Yovana es comerciante tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en el mercado del distrito de Quimbiri. La bodega de Yovana es la primera en abrirse, apertura las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la certeza de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así estar al tanto de las cosas que suceden en su ámbito circular, lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa invertir sus ganancias en verduras y depender de dos ingresos a la vez  por lo cual ella se esmera cada día por lograr ese propósito. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, siente que el crédito le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo, y a su vez agradece a la Institución  por concederle el préstamo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, adquirirá mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yovana is 26 years old and from La Libertad community, a small village in Quimbiri district.  She is married to 30 year-old Alfredo and they have two daughters, 9 year-old Rosalía and 7 month-old Gressy.  They live together on their own half-built lot which is located in Quimbiri district.

Yovana is a very industrious woman who works hard and does her best to excel even when faced with the adversities that fate sometimes provides.  Yovana is a saleswoman who has a grocery store in Quimbiri district market.  Yovana's store is the first to open each day.  She opens her business at 6.00am and is ready to receive her first customers who know that she sells a good variety of merchandise in her store and so do not hesitate to buy from her.  They know that they will find the products they need.  What Yovana most likes about her work is chatting to her customers as, in this way, she is always up to date with what is going on around her.  She has been in this business for 4 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stand up almost all day long.

Yovana will use the loan she has requested to buy more food products for her business so that she can stock her store with merchandise.  Over time, she plans to invest her profits in buying vegetables.  In this way, she will have two incomes.  She does her best every day to make sure she achieves this goal.

This is Yovana's third loan from MFP.  She feels that this loan will really help her to make progress in her business and she is grateful to the institution for granting her the loan.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus 3 Group

texts.en:
Kirsy is married with three children. She lives in a simple structure in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Kirsy is in the business of selling all kinds of clothes and different home-decoration items like bedding sets, curtains and others. She went into business about a year ago with her husband's help. When she is not working, she enjoys watching television. She says that her most difficult challenge is to improve her house.

Kirsy is the coordinator of her group Caminando Con Jesus 3 (Walking with Jesus 3). She began with Esperanza International Dominican Republic because she wanted to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

Kirsy is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save for future investments.

loans.use: To buy jeans, blouses, shirts, etc. to resell

loans.name: Jaiko Porave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Jaiko Porave Rekavo se conformó el 24 de setiembre del 2010, se encuentran en el 2º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos, principalmente el de trabajar para apoyar económicamente a sus familias en especial.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Petrona B., quien se dedica a ser macatera, vendedora ambulante, nos comenta que solicita el crédito para mejorar su actividad y su administración; su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
Ella comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que actualmente posee también una pequeña pensión de su marido que es parapléjico para poder solventar los gastos.
Según la Sra. Petrona las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya son muy importante ya que mediante ellas pudieron  desarrollar sus  capacidades de trabajo y autoestima.
texts.en:
The Women's Committee known as Jaiko Porave Rekavo was formed on September 24, 2010. They are now in their second cycle, and are together and unified in the program. 

Aside from the independent work that each one does, they also do activities together to raise money to create capital within the group. They also help each other out to meet their objectives, especially that of working to support their families economically.

One very moving story is that of Mrs. Petrona Benitez, who is a street vendor. She tells us that she asked for a loan to improve her business and administration; her quality of life and income. She says that through this business her family's economic situation improved substantially and that she now also receives a small pension for her husband who is a paraplegic, which helps cover the family's costs. 

According to Petrona, the activities that she does with the Fundacion Paraguaya are very important since they allowed her to develop her work capacity and self-esteem.

loans.use: to buy shirts and blouses made with ao poi [Paraguayan embroidery]

loans.name: Nonignon Group

texts.fr: NONIGNON est un groupement constitué de dix sept personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Sylvie. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier à Womey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.Née le 16 Mars 1959 à Adjohoun dans le département de l’Ouémé, Sylvie vit depuis douze ans à Womey avec sa famille. Sylvie est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Paulin et a quatre enfants, qui sont tous  scolarisés. Sylvie assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Sylvie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis environs trois ans, Sylvie vend des condiments de sauce, des boissons et des tissus de façon secondaire dans sa boutique sise à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Sylvie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Sylvie et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: NONIGNON is a group made up of seventeen people, whose president is called Sylvie (she has her hand raised in the photograph). The group members live in the same quarter of Womey in the Abomey Calavi area. In order to boost their working capital, this group is seeking their first loan from ALIDé. Sylvie was born on the 16th March 1959 in Adjohoun in the Ouémé region, and has lived in Womey with her family for twelve years. She is married to a mechanic called Paulin with whom she has four children who all attend school. Sylvie and her husband see to their family's needs together. Sylvie left school after second grade. For the past three years, she has sold sauces, condiments, drinks and fabric from her shop situated at her home. This business enables her to generate revenues which help her to see to her family's needs. She buys her products from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. This loan will enable Sylvie and her group to boost their business and grow their customer base and revenue.

loans.use: to purchase cans of drinks and condiments

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
To become economically stable is the main goal of Evelyn. This is why she is working so hard in her general store business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional revolving capital to buy new products to offer like vegetables, meat, soft drinks, crackers and a lot of food ingredients.   

Evelyn is a married woman with two children. She is now 44 years old and has been managing a general store for two years. She is earning around PHP 6,000 monthly doing this business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, soft drinks, crackers and food ingredients to sell

loans.name: Wilmer Alberto

texts.es:
Este  tiene su domicilio en la ciudad de Managua, siendo  persona  trabajadora  padre de familia que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y en brindarles
Una mejora calidad de vida.
 El señor Wilmer Alberto   visito  nuestras oficinas con  el fin  objetivo de conseguir crédito para realizar una mejora en su hogar como es acondicionar un cuarto para sus  hijos con este crédito comprar laminas de zic  y perlìnes   para el techo  y para el pago de la mano de obra  y así  ofrecerle  un hogar digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer Alberto lives in his own home, in the city of Managua.  He is a hard-working father who looks after his family's well-being and would like to provide them with a better quality of life.

Wilmer Alberto visited our offices in order to request a loan with which he could improve his home, fitting out a bedroom for his children.   He will use the loan to buy sheets of corrugated metal and beams for his roof and to pay labor costs.  This will enable him to offer his family a decent home.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home, buying building supplies

loans.name: Agneter

texts.en:
Agneter is a married woman with 2 children. One attends school while the other is still too young.  She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is hospital bills.
