For the past year, Agneter has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a goat-meat business which contributes an additional source of income. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Agneter dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase goats and cattle to sell as meat.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats and cattle to sell as meat.

loans.name: Djaria

texts.fr: Mariée à un commerçant et maman de 02 enfants, Djaria a 29ans et elle réside à Agoé avec son conjoint.  En 2009, elle a ouvert dans son domicile une boutique où elle vend des produits de premières nécessités (sucre, riz, huile végétale). Elle désire voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions. Ce premier  prêt l’aidera à acheter afin de répondre à la demande de ses nombreux clients. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de Lomé.
texts.en: Djaria is married to a merchant and the mother of two children. She is 29 years old and lives in Agoé with her spouse. In 2009, she opened a store in her home where she sells basic products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil). She wants to see her children grow up with a stable family background. This is her first loan; it will help her to buy some inventory and meet the demand of her many customers. She gets her supplies at the market in Lomé.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: San Isidro 11 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "San Isidro 11" porque L. comunidad en L. cual habitan son muy devotas al santo “San Isidro”. Esta ubicado en el estado D. México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes y es L. primera vez que solcita un prestamo. MariC. es tesorera del grupo. Tiene 23 años, estudio hasta L. preparatoria. ElL.  
cuida a sus papas pues son personas D. edad avanzada a quienes quiere mucho. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, negocio que inicio hace 1 año aproximadamente. Solicita este prestamo para comprar productos como fragancias, cremas y cosmeticos. Lo que elL. espera con este prestamo es que al final pueda tener sus productos a L. mano para que los exiba en un pequeño local que piensa construir para que cuando lo requieran sus clientes los tenga sin ningun inconveniente. Al momento solicitar este prestamo elL. se siente feliz porque pueD. surtir su negocio. Tambien quiere apoyar a sus papas en los gastos D. L. familia y brindarles una mejor vida para su vejez.
texts.en: The name of this group is "San Isidro 11" and it is named as such because the community in which they live is very devout to the saint "San Isidro". It is located in the state of Mexico. The group is maD. up of 11 members and it is the first time they request a loan. MariC. is the treasurer of the group. She is 23 years old and she has a high school education. She takes care of her parents who are advanced in age and whom she loves very much. She sells beauty products, a business she started approximately 1 year ago. She requests a loan to purchase products such as fragrances, skin lotions, and cosmetics. What she hopes with this loan is to finally have the products that she needs in hand and to display from a small store she's thinking about having built. So when clients require a product they will not be inconvenienced. When she requested the loan she felt very happy because she will be able to add inventory to her business. She also wants to support her parents with the family's expenses, and to proviD. them with a better life in their old age.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fragrances, skin lotions, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Toeuy

texts.en: Aged only 16, Mrs. Toeuy is married to a husband who stays in the village like she does. Her husband is 27 years old. At present both of them are farmers. They can earn about $4 per day to support themselves. They don't have any children at present. Living with her husband from day to day, Mrs. Toeuy wishes to expand her farming business and make it better than before. She would like to borrow the amount of $300  to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Javier Rodolfo

texts.es: El Sr. Javier es casado,  tiene una hija de 15  años, va todavía  al colegio. El Sr. Javier se dedica  al servicio de taxista en un auto alquilado desde hace 10 años y  gana aproximadamente 200 soles semanales.  Sus metas que tiene  es tener su propio auto para así aumentar sus ganancias. Su desafío  es que a veces no hay pasajeros y él tiene q dar más vueltas que sus  demás compañeros.  El crédito se va invertir en renovar la licencia de conducir que ya caduca el próximo mes. El Sr. Javier está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Javier is married and has a 15-year-old daughter in high school. He provides taxi services using a rented automobile. Javier has been in this line of work for 10 years and earns approximately 200 PEN each month. His goals are to have his own vehicle and to increase his earnings. His challenge is whenever there are no passengers available and he wants to make more trips than his co-workers.

Javier will invest this loan in the renewal of his driver’s license, which will expire next month. He is very grateful for the loan being granted to him.

loans.use: to renew his driver's license.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Daniel. He is married and has four children who are 6, 8, 12, and 14 years old. In 2001, Daniel established his spare parts and lubricants business. This business has helped Daniel to provide a livelihood for his family for the past years. My family and I depend only on this business, said Daniel.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Daniel has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to buy outer tires, rings, timing chain and crank shaft. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Daniel plans to establish a vehicle/motorcycle trade, build a house and support his children's education. He travels to Freetown twice a month by public transport to buy his business stock.  He serves riders and drivers in the township of Makeni City. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy outer tires, rings, timing chain and crank shaft

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Santo Domingo que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Eugenio es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra caña de azúcar, es un producto que se consume diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive  y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares.  También vende aguardiente (bebida que se extrae de la caña de azúcar), luego la vende a los pobladores de la misma zona y así obtiene otro ingreso para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras y de aguardiente para seguir comercializandolo a los pobladores, con la finalidad de tener una buena ganancia y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Eugenio es una persona que se preocupa por que su negocio crezca para que tenga algunas comodidades y seguir apoyando a su familia en los gastos diarios.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 46, and lives with his wife and children in their own home, which does not have basic services. It is located in the rural area of the Santo Domingo district, which is part of Cajamarca department. This area is known for farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Eugenio is a farmer.  He has his own land, where he grows sugar cane, a product that is consumed every day.  Once he harvests his crop, he sells it at the different markets in the area where he lives; in this way he can earn income to cover his family's expenses.  He also sells aguardiente (a drink extracted from sugar cane), to people in the same area, and so earns other income for his household. 

He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles through the Capital Semilla (Seed Money) program, in order to buy fertilizers to improve his land and aguardiente to keep selling to local people.  His aim is to earn a good profit, and thereby improve his quality of life. Eugenio is a person who is concerned about making his business grow, so that he can have a few home comforts and keep supporting his family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve his land, and aguardiente (drink made from sugar cane) to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Eva has a shop that makes & sells hypo or cleansing agent by the liter. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo or cleansing agent.

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo or cleansing agent

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old, married and has eight adult children. Her spouse worked as a farmer in the village of Lapas, Cabatuan, Isabela. 

She enjoys the daily activities in her hog-raising business. She devotes herself full time to maintaining her business, which is the only source of income she has for her family. After taking care of the pigs for four months, she sells them, earning PHP 4,000 per head.

Carmelita wants to buy baby livestock but she has insufficient capital. That’s why she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and at least one additional pig to raise.

loans.use: to buy one pig and feed.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Victor Manuel es padre de familia que siempre ve por el bienestar y comodidad, para poder sostener los gastos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida trabaja como chofer de transporte colectivo desde hace 8 años. El cuenta con su propio automóvil que utiliza para taxi  que circula en toda la ciudad para ofrecer a sus clientes amplio servicio.
En este momento necesita de un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, lo que necesita es comprar algunas partes y aceite para que este en buenas condiciones. De esta manera ofrecerá mejor servicio y a sus clientes una mejor seguridad.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel is a father who is always looking after his family’s comfort and wellbeing.  To be able to meet household expenses and offer them a better quality of life he’s been working as a collective taxi driver for 8 years.  He owns his car that he uses as a taxi circulating throughout the city to offer his customers wide service.

Presently, he needs a loan to service his work tool.  He needs to buy a few replacement parts and oil so that it will be in good operating condition so that he will be able to offer better service and increased safety to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 31 years old and married to Naleng'oyo. They are blessed with two children. She is a livestock trader in the area of the Mlolongo Kitengela slaughter house, Kajiando and other surrounding markets where she supplies livestock. She has  been in this business for the last five years and gets an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a KADET staff member. She has good credit history in KADET, and she is applying for her third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to buy more livestock.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business and become a K.M.C. meat supplier. Hellen hopes to become a K.M.C meat supplier within the next two years. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Linda is a 53-year-old lady who is married and has five children aged 32, 30, 28, 25, and 23 year. They have five other dependents who stay with them. 

She operates from home and has been in business for eight years. She buys some of her products from Harare and Zambia. She does not have any employees. She faces a challenge of high competition in the market and inadequate packaging material for floor polish. In the next five years, she would like to own her own shop as well as a factory to make floor polish. This loan would improve life for her family as she would be able to generate more income to sustain the extended family

loans.use: to buy perfumes, sanitary pads, and raw materials to make floor polish.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a single mother. She has one child, who is in school. She lives in her family’s house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanakombo has operated as a tailor for the past three years; her potential clients are local women. She faces a major challenge of inadequate capital to expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With her loan of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more fabrics and also buy some vegetables for her new grocery business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and to buy vegetables for her new grocery business.

loans.name: Leunidah

texts.en: Leunidah is a hardworking business woman. She is 48 years old, married and blessed with three children who are in school. She runs a grocery business to support her family. She has been in business for the last 16 years. Leunidah also rents houses to supplement her family's income. The major challenge she faces is competition. Leunidah is requesting a loan of 20,000 shillings to buy vegetables and fruits for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Martin

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Martin, âgé de 41 ans  célibataire et père de 4 enfants  a récemment investi dans la vente de denrées alimentaires et  d’habits.
Il veut acquérir un prêt pour acheter des habits adaptés au froid et préparer  les fêtes de Noel et de fin d’années.
Avec  les revenus de son commerce il arrive à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et veut élargir son activité car il a l’intention de vendre aussi de la boisson.
texts.en:
Martin is 41 years old, single and the father of 4 children. He has recently started a business selling food and clothing. He is requesting a loan so that he can stock up on cold weather clothing and products to sell during the Christmas and New Year celebrations.

Martin uses his earnings to pay for his children´s education and also plans to reinvest some into his business, as he would like to expand his activities and start selling drinks.

loans.use: to buy food and clothes to resell during the end of year festivities.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: La señora Teresa, es una humilde agricultora del zona de Ticuantepe, ella habita junto a su familia, durante muchos años se dedica al cultivo de piña, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, con el financiamiento anterior logro darle mantenimiento a una manzana de Piña , ahora ella quiere establecer  media manzana mas , pero no cuenta con el capital para poder realizar la inversión , ya que si logrará establecerlo mejoraría sus condiciones de vida , ya que la agricultura es su gran fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de fondo Kiva para lograr sus planes hacia su cultivo.
texts.en: Teresa is a humble farmer from the area of Ticuantepe.  She lives with her family.  She has grown pineapples for a living for many years.  Her plans for her family are to improve their living conditions.  With her previous loan she was able to maintain a field of pineapple; now she wants to plant half a field more, but she doesn't have the capital to make the investment.  If she is able to set this up, it will improve her living conditions since agriculture is her main source of income for supporting her family.  She is thankful for the help she has received from AFODENIC through Kiva to achieve her goals for her  crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 31 years old. He is married with two children aged 7 and 8; both go to school. He and his wife work together in the same restaurant. He has been running the restaurant for the past two years. He is requesting the loan to add more equipment as well as different types of food to serve in the restaurant. He plans to use the profits to build a house. In the future, he wants to see his business prospering.

loans.use: To buy more equipment and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is from the simple village of Dioyo, Sapangdalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years of age, married and blessed with three adult children. Her husband is working as farmer.

Gemma used her last loan to purchase raw materials needed to make furniture for sale like beds, sala sets and cabinets for tourists and local community members. Her business is successful, and she has discovered that it's better to also engage in a different line of business to double her return. So now she is taking a new loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy grocery goods to sell in her general store, locally known as a sari-sari store. 

She has been this business for around six months. With her general store, she has been able to earn 2,300 PHP a month. This business has been quite a great benefit to the family of Gemma. 
 
In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business and make it bigger.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Las Turquesas Group

texts.es:
La señora Silviana  es soltera vive en un pueblo  en la que celebran la fiesta del santo domingo el  veinticinco de  abril.

    Ella solicito  el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrote en donde lleva trabajando  diez años   en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha mejorado muchos sus ingresos.
  
     Ella inicio   por sus propios   meritos ya que   también quiere apoyar a sus   padres con los ingresos de la casa en donde comenta  que  le va  bien ya que con ello a cubierto algunas deudas.
 
   Lo que ella desea es que con sus ingresos y el préstamo que solicito  siga  aumentado su pequeño negocio.

         Las personas quienes integran en el grupo son: María del Rosario invertirá el préstamo en  antojitos,   invertirá en  compra y ventas de ropas,  Javier invertirá bonetería y mercería, Faustina invertirá en antojitos,  Martha  Leticia venta de catálogos  de zapatos de la marca terra.
texts.en:
Silviana is single and lives in a town that celebrates the feast day of Santo Domingo on April 25th.  She requested the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store that she’s had for ten years and that she comments she does well in because her income has improved very much.

She started out on her own initiative because she also wants to help her parents with household income and she states that she’s also done well here in that she’s been able to take care of some debts.  What she wants is that with income and the loan she requested her small business will continue growing.

The group members are: María del Rosario who will invest the loan in fast food and will buy clothes to sell; Javier who will invest in notions and bonnet supplies; Faustina who will invest in fast food and Martha Leticia in catalogue sales of Terra brand shoes.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Christine Elise

texts.fr: Christine Elise est une dame âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. tous ces enfants vont à l'école. elle mène une activité de vente de vêtements et sacs dans  un quartier de la ville depuis 2 an seulement. elle exporte les fruits vers l'europe et reçoit en retour des sacs, chaussures, parfums qu'elle commercialise sur place. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des produits en grande quantités pour augmenter  ses ventes ainsi que son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui sera en partie reversée dan son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christine Elise is a 42-year-old lady, married and the mother of five children, all of whom go to school. She has been running a business selling clothes and bags in one of the city's neighborhoods since only two years. 

She exports fruit to Europe and in return receives bags, shoes, and perfumes she sells locally. She wants to use this loan to buy products in large quantities to increase her sales and earnings.

Profits will be partly reinvested in her activity so it can be expanded, and the rest will enable her to support her family.

loans.use: increase her stock of products

loans.name: Sovanara

texts.en:
E. Sovanara came to the CREDIT office with his mother, Ngen Sophan. He was requesting a $1,000 loan to invest in his food sales business and she came as his guarantor. Sophan must trust her son to guarantee such a loan. She is confident because Sovanara has successfully completed his first two loan cycle and was able to improve his house and to start the business.

Sovanara and his wife can make around $5 per day in cooking and selling food to the factory workers. Sometimes Sovanara is also earning some extra money as a moto-taxi. They have never been late in their repayment schedule because they save on a daily basis.

With his 3rd loan, he decided to buy a second motorbike. He will spend $800 in a strong second-hand motorbike and will keep the old one in case of emergency. Sovanara will use the remaining $200 to buy spices but also to cover the delayed payments he is granting to some of his clients.

In the future, the family has a plan to start another business. They would like to buy a cow and raise it for its calves.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike and invest in fod business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is a person with very good ideas. She decided to open a grocery store in her home, in order to provide food to her neighbors. The business has gone well but she needs to increase her product line, for which she is requesting a loan of $1200, which she plans to repay within one year.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Consuelo es una persona con muy buenas ideas por lo que decidio abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, para poder proveer de alimento a sus vecinos, el negocio a marchado bien pero necesita incremebtar sus productos por lo que solicita un credito de $1200.00 los cuales piensa pagar en un lapso de 12 meses

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Roine

texts.en:
Roine L. is a young mother of two, and she lives with her husband in the small Samoan village of Siuniu Falealili.

She believes in her and her husband’s farming abilities, and they manage a 10-acre taro plantation together.

Taro is a staple of the Samoan diet, and so when Roine takes their crop to market twice a week, she is usually able to sell her full supply for about ST 300 (approximately USD 120).

She is anxious to invest further in their farming enterprise, and so she has applied for a loan to buy some fertilizer to improve their crop yield. Roine also wants to use part of the loan funds to repair the damaged floor of her house.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and make home improvements

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Y. is 31 and has 3 children, aged 1 to 8. They live on the outskirts of Do Luong, a small town in the central province Nghe An. Together with her husband, Mrs. Y. farms a small rice field, but the rice is not enough for the couple's main business of making glass noodles. Mrs. Y. therefore joined  TYM Fund and applied for a loan of US$250, hoping to increase the production of noodles by 50%.

loans.use: Purchase of rice for making noodles

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Mrs. Sabitri M., 27, lives in Thecho, Nepal, with her husband and a daughter. Her husband, Dharma lal M., works in Nepal Telecom as a field worker, and her daughter is studying in higher secondary school in grade 9.

Mrs. M. opened a wood shop 4 years ago. She is a very hard-working woman and does all her work perfectly. She is a wood dealer and supplies wood to a local carpentry shop which makes windows, doors and other items. Now she needs $225 to purchase more wood to fulfill the demand of the local markets.

Mrs. M. wants to save money for the future and also wants to be able to afford further study for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy wood
